story:
Thank you for considering to help fund Take-A-Seat! We are excited to introduce our system to you and hope that you'll find it's been worth the effort we've put forth thus far.

In 2001, Take-A-Seat was born out of necessity. We had arrived at our tailgate party with everything BUT our chairs. A thought occurred to my husband, Pat. "If a chair could mount to the receiver hitch on a vehicle, it would save interior space and ensure that once you arrived to your destination, you’d have a place to sit down and take in the fun". A drawing was sketched that night and the brainstorming began. 

The "TailgaChair" is born...I did mention it was thought of at a tailgate party, yes?  It didn't take too long, the next morning I believe,  for the name change to happen!

Realizing that a hitch mounted chair was a cool idea, the practical side of us thought – it needs to be collapsible for easy transport AND who’s going to spend ‘X’ on a chair you can’t take away from your vehicle? We needed to build functionality into the system. That’s when we really got into the design and usability. When we folded the arms of the system on top of one another – it took the shape of a cargo carrier.

Cargo Carrier position

When we placed the arms in an upright position, preparing to close the unit, it looked an awful lot like a frame for a bike rack.

Bike Rack

Now – how do we tie it all together? With comfortable canvas fabric and Velcro straps, of course! 

We made a few prototypes and used them everywhere we could; campgrounds, parades, bike trails and sporting events. Each time we would pull up to our parking spot- without fail – someone would inevitably ask a series of questions, “What is that?” “Where did you get that?” “Why didn’t I think of that?” and the kicker…”How/Where do I get one?” We knew when the last question was asked, we were onto something…so we continued our journey.

In 2004, we received a patent and started our search for a manufacturer. December 2007 we took delivery of our first order.

Special Delivery!!

We sent the systems off as “demos” to large retail companies, gave some to family/friends to use and promote, set up and exhibited at flea markets and trade shows and knocked on the doors of local businesses asking for a coveted spot on their shelves or showroom floor. We began selling online through Northern Tool & Equipment, U-Haul and Discount Ramps. Momentum started to build and we were in serious talks with a national retailer. 

Then, a little thing happened that you may have heard about…the bottom dropped out. The market crashed, economy crumbled and our business plan became obsolete. In the years since, we sold out of our systems (albeit gradually) and began to focus on additional accessories to enhance the Take-A-Seat. 

We continue to talk with retailers that are interested in the system and use the unit every chance we get. What keeps us going? The same questions we were asked back when we first started, specifically – “Where can I get one?” 

That’s where YOU come in! With your help, we will be able to get back to production and distribution. 

 

Who is this hot dog?  Oh, it's  just my awesome Nana (RIP), tailgating with the Racing Hot Dog, before taking on the other sausages at Miller Park!

 

 

Folks getting their "grill on" at Lambeau, with the Take-A-Seat.

So, What's next?

Here’s how your support will be used: 

  • The initial goal is to order more systems.  We have found a local manufacturer and they are willing to work with us as we slowly get back into production.  They are allowing us to do a blanket order and pull the systems as needed vs. having to order a few hundred right away.  By starting small, we can gain momentum with sales and then buy additional units as we are able.

  • We have some stretch goals as well, if we are fortunate enough to reach above and beyond our original goal.  Here's what's on deck.......

  • Marketing – A tweak to our existing website, new brochures and other materials are needed. Plus, we need to put ourselves out there! The largest automotive accessories show, SEMA, is in November and by exhibiting there – it will place us in front of major retailers and automotive accessory companies who are looking for new and unique items. SEMA serves as a huge opportunity to reach the diverse demographic that would benefit from the Take-A-Seat. 

  • Misc Business Expenses - We work out of our home, which takes the need for office space out of the mix, for the moment.  However, once we take additional deliveries of units - we'll need warehousing space and a way to transport them there. Postage, bank fees, administrative needs all play a part... 

  • Licensing – Outside of the system's many uses: camping, cycling, hunting, etc., tailgating is where the system got its start and in the parking lot is where we see the system being utilized the most. Put the coolers on the cargo carrier, unload at your tailgate spot, flip the back support up and...BAM...you are ready to get your tailgate on! The travel cover fabric and backrest are the perfect canvas for logo placement. We plan to first obtain NCAA licensing, as it is far more affordable than others. Additional licensing, such as NFL, MLB, NASCAR and corporate opportunities will follow.

  • Accessories – The prototypes are done and with your support, we can start producing “add-ons”. Umbrella clamps, tables, cup holders and upgraded bike rack mounts are a few of the things we have planned. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like our idea and want to see Take-A-Seat succeed, but just can't swing a donation, would you consider sharing your enthusiasm with your friends, followers and family via social media?  You never know what kind of impact your "share, tweet, post, pin" may have on our project.

  • Indiegogo makes it easy with their share tools, we sure appreciate your support, financial and otherwise!!!

story:
The Bike Date Project becomes a Calendar!

Three years ago an Alaska born girl living in the Pacific North West jumped to the sunny state of Colorado in search of her creative side.  Much to her surprise, she not only found a creative community that doles out high fives, but also a passion for cycling and photography.  My name is Corie Spruill, the creator of Bike Dates. 

I started photographing intimate portraits of a woman and her bike two years ago after a few friends and I were kicking around ideas for a sexy but different bike related calendar.  After countless women and bicycles have offered me their time and good looks, I’m psyched to have given this “bike date” idea the legs it needs to become a reality!  Mountain Flyer magazine has already jumped aboard with design support and networking for distribution.

With your contribution, we can take the Bike Dates Calendar to press!  Your support will go to the printing and distribution of the calendar to over 200 bike shops across the county. A portion of the proceeds will even benefit a local non-profit Mountain2Mountain; In the spirit of getting even more women in touch with their bicycles.  Check out my video and see what this whole thing is all about!

Thanks for supporting the Bike Date Project, my first major production as an artist!

I am raising $8000

·  $4000 for the printing of 2500 calendars

·  $2500 for distribution to over 200 bike shops, and beyond!

·  $1500 for fundraising campaign

I need to reach my goal to get this calendar out there and onto your wall!  If I don’t reach my funding goal I will be able to produce a small batch run of calendars for local distribution to increase the hype about the bike date project. 

What you get! 

$10 - Get famous on our calendar thank you page.

$35 – Be the first to receive the Bike Date Calendar.

$40 - Custom Bike Date t-shirt, graphic created by artist Lindsay Jones.

$55 - Autographed Bike Date Calendar - Be one of the few to have all the beautiful women of Bike Date sign your calendar.

$75 – Two year subscription to Mountain Flyer Magazine and a calendar.

$75 – Custom Bike Date t-shirt, graphic created by artist Lindsay Jones and a Bike Date Calendar.

$250 –  Bike Date print of your choice; 16x12 canvas print ready to hang. 

$500 - Your own Bike Date photo shoot; Get yourself to Carbondale, CO and get your Bike Date on.  Your photo will be published in Mountain Flyer Magazine 2014. 

$2500 – You’re very own Bike Date photo shoot, taken by photographer Corie Spruill (me) to be published in Mountain Flyer Magazine!  This includes airfare (within the continental United States), one nights stay at a local B&B in beautiful Carbondale, Colorado and a  16x12 Bike Date canvas print.

Impact the world

You have the opportunity to help the world with your contribution!

20% percent of the calendar profits will go to Mountain2Moutnain a Colorado nonprofit; Mountain2Mountain works to empower voice and value with women in conflict zones.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share it right here on indigogo, hit the button of your choice. 

Can’t contribute? No worries, you can still help Bike Date Calendar become a reality;  Facebook, blog, tweet or tumble about Bike Date!

Here are some handy dandy links to copy and paste….

“Who needs a man when you have a bike” Bike Dates are intimate portraits of a woman and her bike, support the project at http://igg.me/at/bikedate/x/4477351

"Bikes for all"  support the biking community and and an art project at hhttp://igg.me/at/bikedate/x/4477351

"I like bikes, do you?"  A bike project that will keep you smiling all year; support it at http://igg.me/at/bikedate/x/4477351

story:
Summary

Women and Trans Bike Night is a weekly do-it-yourself volunteer-driven bicycle mechanic session with trained volunteers. We believe that it is important to share our skills about bicycle maintenance as a means of transportation and fun as women, gender-variant and trans folks.

We are running a team (called 'Nightriders) in a 100km bicycle marathon in support of Out On The Shelf, our local indepentent LGBTQ library.

Out On The Shelf will be moving soon and we want to give them the boost that they need to move into a new space.

What We Need & What You Get

We plan on running six people in the 'Nightriders bike team at the OOTS bike marathon fundraiser. Our goal is to raise $250 per person. You - our friends, family, supporters, admirers and allies - will help us to get there by pitching what you can into the bucket. Everything that we raise will go to OOTS.

As a thank you, we will be hand-crafting each of our perks - from laminated spoke cards that have our logo on them (they're called "spoke cards" because you weave them into your spokes) to buttons and t-shirts. If you carry us all the way to the finish line, we'll even give you a bicycle - built up by us, of course!

The Impact

Both the Women and Trans Bike Night and Out On The Shelf are volunteer-driven, independently-funded entities. Without the community, these places sheerly wouldn't exist. Check out our intro video to find out why these spaces are so important.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate your support in all of its forms! You can drop by Women and Trans Night (Thursdays 5pm-8pm, 620 Gordon St, Guelph ON) to work on your bicycle or just to say hi.

Please also share this campaign on Facebook, through email or twitter. Every little bit helps!

story:
Short Summary

I NEED YOUR HELP TO RAISE $1,500 FOR OUR NEXT DISABLED NASCAR DRIVING EXPERIENCE! 

 

My name is Brian Hanaford, Co-founder and President of Accessible Racing. I grew up in an auto racing family and choose a different path in life.  Running became my passion and I won the state Junior Olympic mile championship in 1978.  A car accident resulted in a Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) that changed the course of my life.  After years of recovery and emotional distress, I decided to modify a racecar to assist the physically challenged. Seeing the look on other disabled peoples’ faces when they took a ride in my NASCAR racecar was a life changing experience for me. Improving somebody’s quality of life in this way is more fulfilling then any self help book or organization I learned of in 30 years.  I want to continue sharing with others what has been a gift from God to me.

 

Here are a few videos showing how Accessible Racing has helped disabled civilians and veterans over the years:

 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_detailpage&v=V-TebTMfdak

http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_detailpage&v=kQzjdGa67UQ

http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=E91HDaLrODE

 

The Accessible Racing NASCAR driving experience provides an exciting and therapeutic experience that helps disabled individuals rediscover their capabilities.  It opens up the possibilities in their lives after an accident, illness or injury. 

 

Accessible Racing has been featured in numerous high profile news stories covering our disabled driving experiences.  SPEED Associate Producer Justin Burnett was honored with a 2012 Russ Catlin Award for his Veteran's Day 2011 feature on Accessible Racing that ran as part of the popular program, NASCAR Race Hub.  "For me, this piece crystallizes everything that makes racing, and sports in general, great", said Burnett, "Far away from the bright spotlight of a NASCAR race weekend, Accessible Racing is using their passion for racing as a vehicle for inspiration and change.”

 

What We Need and What You Get

We need $1,500 to launch our next NASCAR Disabled Driving Experience at Rockingham Speedway in February 2013.  The $1,500 will be used to publicize the event, attract disabled participants from the civilian and military veterans’ communities, and fund sponsorship efforts.   Up to 50 civilians and veterans with disabilities will have the opportunity to drive or ride in our NASCAR race car at this event.  Significant efforts are required from multiple individuals and sponsoring organizations to deliver an event of this magnitude.  Your contribution is vital to fuel our “Race to Rockingham 2013“!!!

 

Here is what you get:

$25 Membership card includes discounts on road side assistance, on-line shopping at all major retail outlets, and more!

$49 Membership card above and Accessible Racing team polo shirt.

$99 Membership card, Accessible Racing Polo Shirt, access to iRacing.com and world leading software providing incentive rewards such as driving a KART, NASCAR or INDY car at participating race courses across USA, Canada, and UK.     

$500 participate as a race team member at our NASCAR Disabled Driving Experience at Rockingham Speedway in February 2013, PLUS all of the above. 

 

What the Funds Will Be Used For

 

$500 for sponsorship sales packages (these will be used to raise approximately $10,000 in further sponsorship for transportation, fuel, food, film production, insurance, legal, accounting, etc.)

 

$1,000 for social media, PR and website advertising

 

 

Product and Services Already Committed

 

We have received substantial commitment already for our “Race to Rockingham 2013”, including:

 

Accessible Racing’s adapted NASCAR race car 

Rockingham Speedway, the home to Andy Hillenburg's Fast Track High Performance Driving School, and used extensively for NASCAR testing

Goodyear racing tires 

Penske racing shocks

 

The Impact on Disabled Driving Experience Participants

Rehabilitation professionals recognize the importance of sports and recreation in the successful rehabilitation of individuals with disabilities. When first faced with the reality of a disability, many experience a loss of confidence, depression, and believe their lives have ended. They are often alienated from family and friends because there are no shared positive experiences.  Physical and emotional rehabilitation need to begin in the recovery stage before victims dwell on the mental list of things they can no longer do.   

Sports and recreation offers the opportunity to achieve success in a very short time period; to use this success to build self-confidence and focus on possibilities instead of dwelling on what can no longer be done. The ability to participate in a sport, such as auto racing, snowmobiling, or jet skiing, to name a few, provides the opportunity to reunite with family and friends in a shared activity.

Competition improves sports skills. It allows individuals to experience the excitement of competition and the thrill of victory, as well as the agony of defeat. These experiences help prepare individuals after rehabilitation to face the adversity of a disability in their lives and to learn to bounce back in the face of challenge and change.

Accessible Racing is a media magnet and has been featured multiple times on national TV on Memorial Day Weekend and Veterans Day. Our events bring valuable awareness and media coverage to support disabled civilians and veterans.  Your contribution will help us continue this positive impact!

These experiences help prepare individuals after rehabilitation to face the adversity of a disability in their lives and to learn to bounce back in the face of challenge and change.
Accessible Racing is a media magnet and has been featured multiple times on national TV on Memorial Day Weekend and Veterans Day. Our events bring valuable awareness and media coverage to support disabled civilians and veterans.  Your contribution will help us continue this positive impact!

story: I am trying raise money for a vehicle like in this photo. I am 19 and was born with Spina Bifida. I do not;however, let that stop me from trying my hardest at being like everyone else and not let it limit me. I want to drive so I can get a job and go to school but need financial assistance with the car and responsibilities that come with it. (insurance, plates, tags, gas etc.) Until I can start to get on my feet and do it on my own. Any amount you can give would be greatly appreciated. Thank you

story:
About us

McGill Formula Electric is an engineering design team made up of over 50 motivated students from various faculties at McGill and united by the challenge of building a completely electric formula-style racecar to compete at Formula SAE competitions against universities from around the world.

How Your Donations Help

In an effort to increase reliability and performance, this year, we have opted for a shortened manufacturing schedule, thereby allowing for more testing and practice. Such a high-pace schedule brings increased manufacturing costs. Additionally, a longer testing and competition season requires large amounts of funds to finance upkeep, travel and replacement of used components such as our tires.

On top of this, building a race car from scratch requires large amounts of resources and high-tech equipment. For example, our electronics system is composed of hundreds of individual components and  requires several thousand dollars worth of component and manufacturing costs. The batteries themselves, an indispensable part of an electric vehicle, cost over $6000.

The Dream

McGill Formula Electric has a long history of building electric vehicles. McGill was the first University to build an electric snowmobile back in 2004. Over its 10 year history the McGill snowmobile has traveled the world, from carrying the Olympic Torch for the 2010 Vancouver Games, to being used for climate change research in Greenland. The team has finished 1st at the SAE Clean Snowmobile Challenge a total of 3 times. The team additionally competed in the inaugural Formula Hybrid competition in 2007. The experience gained in electric powertrain development has been the driving factor of the team’s success over the years. The McGill Hybrid car claimed 2 first place finishes in its 6 years of competing. However, trophies are not the only measure of success: we hold ourselves to a very high standard and take pride and enjoyment in the quality, efficiency and performance of our electric vehicles.

We now want to be able to live up to our past excellence with our Formula Electric vehicles and once again be one of the top contenders at all competitions. The North American Formula Electric competition is currently lagging behind the European competitions, both in the number of participants and the level of competition. Our goal is to bridge this gap and become a contender on the world stage where we can prove our excellence and passion for clean energy transportation.

General Motors Canada

This campaign was made possible thanks the generous support of General Motors Canada, which has agreed to match every dollar donated as well as provide prizes as an incentive to donate. By supporting Electric and Hybrid FSAE teams, General Motors Canada is ensuring that the next generation of students will be have both a passion and a deep understanding of sustainable transportation technologies. With their continued support of STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) initiatives, they aid in providing opportunities for students to learn, grow, and create.

story:
I'm Okami! I'm an artist!

I rely on my vehicle for everything. Getting to work. Getting to doctor's offices and medications filled to secure my livelihood. Getting food. Pretty much surviving in general. I live in an area where the public transportation system isn't great, so having a working vehicle is of the utmost importance to me. :c I don't need a fancy car. Just something that works, and is a good long-term investment.  That's what my current car was. But then a horrible string of events happened all in one day! 

This happened all in the span of 5 hours. Talk about bad luck.

What I Want to Do About This!

I need another car pronto! After a diagnosis from a mechanic, it turns out I have a blown head gasket. They could rebuild to engine or replace it altogether, but that costs a LOT more money than just replacing the car altogether. 

To prevent myself from losing a lot more than just my car, I'm turning to you guys for help! I've scoured craigslist for used cars and the like, and it seems the ballpark figure for a decent used car is $2000-$4000. 

Of course all cars are not without problems, and used cars can come with other problems, but I simply can't afford to wait this out. I have a lot at stake right now!  D:

What I am willing to do should I raise enough money to get another car is return the favor to you guys! What does this mean?

  • Free stuff from me and other artists! We work really hard to give you guys quality content, and we're willing to work even harder together to help me reach my goal! This includes awesome artists like myself, Nekophelia, Laraye, Pandacorn, Argoth, Awkturtleartist, ThatAndyGuy, MShadowy, and BarretXIII!

  • As stretch goals are met, more free stuff comes with it! If we can reach a certain stretch goal, I'll even release the next image pack COMPLETELY FREE to everyone! 

  • If i don't reach my goal, I'll work with what you guys are willing to contribute to see if I can find other transportation options in the meantime. It'll be difficult, and I don't know what will happen, but we can't say we didn't try!

What Happens if the Goal is Met?

If I am able to get another car with you guys, I will:

  • FIRST TAKE A PICTURE OF IT TO SHOW YOU GUYS IN AN UPDATE HOLY CRAP I WILL LOVE YOU FOREVER!
  • As with my previous campaign, I will work diligently to make sure all perks are met through myself and other artists as well. If anything happens, I will of course keep you guys updated!
  • I WON'T BE STRESSED OUT FOREVER AND I CAN GET TO WORK AND GO TO CONS AND SEE YOU GUYS!

As of right now, I'm stuck at home. I do have some necessities at the moment, and friends help out when and if they can, but ultimately I will need to get back on the road in another car, else I could lose a lot. ;___;

Stretch Goals!



$5000 - Okami Gets to Ride in Style!

I get a car that is awesome! Like this! Holy crap! The art pack is free, you guys vote on the theme and some characters to be included, AND there's another bonus in store that'll involve a big artist~ What is it? We'll find out! c:

$4000 - It Looks Awesome and Won't Fall Apart!

Yayyy! i won't be worried about any repairs anytime soon! Also, for us reaching this milestone, the next image pack I release will be released completely free for everyone! There will even be a SFW version! And you guys vote on the theme and some characters as well! AWESOME! It'll also feature work from some other artists as well! 

$3000 - It Runs and it Looks OK!

I can now get something like this! I will work with a mechanic buddy to make sure the car will be the best I can get for the money we've raised! Additionally, all of you guys will get to vote on the theme of the content of the next image pack and also vote for some characters you would like to see in it as well!

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

Can't contribute? That's ok! By simply sharing this campaign with others, you're still helping me! Share it on Facebook, Google+, Reddit, anywhere! Don't spam though. Spam is bad D;

Let's get me back on the road!

Here's a list of the artists that are helping me out! They are also spending some of their precious time to help me by offering rewards as a perk for helping me out! Give us all a Follow!


Okami


Nekophelia


Awkturtle


Mshadowy (18+ content)


BarretXIII (18+ content)


Pandacorn


Argoth (18+ content)


Laraye (18+ content)


ThatAndyGuy

story:
CycleBoard is the world's first stand-up electric vehicle with dual front wheels, a single rear wheel and an innovative lean-to-steer system with multiple riding styles. It’s safe, fun, functional, portable, affordable and personal. No matter your age, riding style or ability level, CycleBoard can be ridden by nearly anyone and is the most versatile stand-up electric vehicle ever created. You can even have your CycleBoard fit your own personal style with several riding decks to choose from!

           


With multiple riding styles, CycleBoard is the most versatile stand-up electric vehicle ever created.

  • If you want to ride conservatively and just cruise, then ski style is the way to go. 
  • If you're feeling a little more adventurous and want to do some smooth carving, switch to surf style.
  • Of course, if you want to get really aggressive, snowboard style offers an amazing carving experience. 

Our awesome “Woody” Deck comes standard with every CycleBoard. You can also personalize your CycleBoard with one of our other 3 deck options and you can order multiple decks for different occasions or events and just swap it out.

 ** To add additional features to your CycleBoard, see the amount next to each feature you would like and add that amount to your total pledge. At the end of the campaign, we'll send out a survey where you can specify which features you ordered **

                                    

Pre-order your CycleBoard today and experience the most revolutionary, light personal vehicle since the invention of the bicycle. 

I created the CycleBoard because I was looking for a better way for my family and I to travel and go on outings in our local area. I wanted something that was safe and fun, but also something that inspired togetherness. My wife and I have 3 kids and we all love riding. CycleBoarding has already become a household name and activity in our family, and I hope that it will in yours too! 

ABOUT CYCLEBOARD

CycleBoard was founded and created by Phil LaBonty. Based out of Newport Beach, California, CycleBoard is comprised of a team of entrepreneurs, engineers and designers, creating 3-wheeled electric devices that transform the way people travel in their local environments. CycleBoard is a remarkably intuitive, lean-to-steer electric vehicle that goes up to 20 mph and is incredibly safe and fun. CycleBoard is the first product in our line-up with more to follow.

WHY WE’RE KICKSTARTING

We have been self-funding the development of CycleBoard up until this point. Our team comes with extensive experience in product design, engineering and manufacturing. Your contribution to this campaign will allow us to open tooling and move directly into production. We appreciate your consideration and look forward to you becoming one of the very first owners of the amazing new CycleBoard. 

Not ready to buy a CycleBoard just yet? You can still get involved and help spread the world about CycleBoard and our Kickstarter campaign. Follow us to stay up to date with new features, designs, stretch goals and more.

How fast is the CycleBoard and how far will it go?

The CycleBoard can reach speeds of 20mph and travel a distance of 15-20 miles on average terrain with average size riders. Hilly terrain and heavier riders will decrease the range.

Is the CycleBoard easy to ride?

It’s remarkably easy to ride! There is virtually no learning curve and nearly anyone can ride it. It is one of the most stable platforms and steering designs of any stand-up electric vehicle in the world.

Can I ride my CycleBoard like a kick scooter?

Yes, absolutely. The CycleBoard free wheels very well so you are covered if you want to mix in some exercise or if you run out of battery.

What are the battery and charger specifications?

Each CycleBoard comes equipped with a 48v 10ah battery pack and a standard 2 amp charger with an approximate recharge time of 3-5 hours, or you can upgrade to a 3 amp charger with an approximate recharge time of 2-3 hours.

How are your batteries designed?

We are using custom-built Lithium Ion battery packs designed using only Tier 1 battery cells from Japan.

Can I take the battery out of the scooter?

The battery is protected inside the sealed aluminum chassis underneath the riding deck. It’s not meant to be removed unless the battery needs to be replaced. The battery charger is plugged into a port on the side of the chassis underneath the riding deck to charge your battery.

Can I buy an extra charger or battery?

Yes, we will provide replacement parts for your CycleBoard. An additional battery would only be needed if the original battery needed to be replaced, as they are not meant to be swapped out. However, we will make them available later on just in case. In terms of chargers, you’ll be able to purchase as many standard (2 amp) or upgraded (3 amp) chargers as you like.

How does the battery work?

To recharge your CycleBoard’s battery, simply plug it into any standard outlet. 

What is the maximum weight limit?

The maximum recommended weight limit is 250 lbs.

How high can I extend the handlebars?

The handlebars will extend to 46 inches, which will comfortably accommodate a rider as tall as 6’6”.

How do I swap the deck out?

Just unscrew the deck screws with an alan wrench, replace the deck with the new one, and screw the deck screws back in. (5 min)

What happens if my CycleBoard stops working?

We provide an owner’s manual with every purchase describing all details of the CycleBoard along with troubleshooting practices. There are 6 major mechanical and electronic components: throttle, hand brake lever, brake caliper, controller, battery and motor. All parts are easy to replace and we will send out replacement parts when necessary.

How do I turn it on and off?

Turning on your CycleBoard is as simple as pushing a button. Just push the on/off button on the throttle.

Do I need a special license to operate CycleBoard?

Each country, state and city has its own laws and restrictions. We strongly advise the use of safety equipment, such as helmets. Please review your local motor vehicle rules and laws.

How much does the full scooter weigh?

Each CycleBoard weighs approximately 42 lbs.

Is there a warranty?

We offer a 1-year manufacturer’s warranty for any design defects and on all parts.

Is the CycleBoard waterproof?

The rear hub motor is completely sealed and nearly waterproof, although we don’t suggest submerging the entire motor in water or riding through large puddles. The battery compartment is completely contained and sealed within the aluminum chassis body and is water resistant.  However, please keep in mind that the CycleBoard is an electronic device.

What if I want to clean my CycleBoard?

The CycleBoard is treated using industry leading powder coating technology and you can simply wipe it down with a wet cloth.

Does the CycleBoard come in different colors?

We are currently only offering the CycleBoard in black as of right now, but we may offer more colors in the near future.

Does the CycleBoard have a line of accessories?

In addition to the accessories listed on our Kickstarter page, we plan to offer a storage bag, a basket and off-road tires very soon.

How will you know where to ship my CycleBoard? 

We will collect all shipping addresses after the campaign ends. After we've collected your shipping address, we will calculate and add shipping costs at that time. All backers are responsible for any state or country specific duties, taxes and other fees. 

Don’t see your question here? Feel free to ask us anything!

story:
"Go ape for the retro moto cool of the Monkey Faction Capuchin pit bike." BikeRumor.com

"People like sit-down scooters because they have comfy seats, and they're easy to get on and off of. People also like suspension mountain bikes, however, because they're smooth-riding. Florida-based startup Monkey Faction has attempted to combine all of those qualities in one retro-looking bike, known as the Capuchin." New Atlas (Gizmag)

"Can't decide between a scooter and a mountain bike? Florida-based startup Monkey Faction has created a stylish mashup of both just for people like you."  Digital trends  

"If comfort and ease are priority one, this $450 ride might be the bike to look at." Gear Junkie

"Their proprietary Scooter Saddle System gives you a flat seat for a flexible riding position that’s comfortable all the time." Cool material

As Seen On:

 

Pronounced [ Kah-pooch-in]

Noun

A central and South American monkey, Cubus capiucinus, having a prehensile tail and hair on the head resembling a cowl.

Top 10 Reasons why you need a Capuchin:

Highlights of the Capuchin:

FAQ for the inquisitive:

Q:  Is the bike really comfortable with that strange seat?

A:  The bike is actually one of the most comfortable bikes you can ride! It is a foot forward design, so your feet are always in front of you. This combined with an upright handlebar position rocks you back onto your sit bones and keeps you in a much more comfortable position. 

The seat is designed for comfort, not speed. Think of a beach cruiser saddle, wide and comfortable. The seat is a very special tapered design that allows a narrower front section for smaller riders and a wider rear section for larger, taller riders. It is constructed with high density foam. This is truly one of the most comfortable bikes you will ever ride.

** In final production the seat will be 3/4" narrower in the front.  This will make it more comfortable for smaller riders and allow even easier pedaling for riders of all sizes!

It is also one the most reliable bikes you can buy. You never need to worry about your seat being stolen and If you have friends over most can ride the bike without any adjustments!

Q:  Why do you use those wide 4 inch tires?

A:  The 4.0 tires serve two purposes. First they hardly ever need air compared to a 2.0 tire, which needs to be filled up weekly. Second they roll super smooth and stay in motion very easily. If you live near the beach you can ride them on the sand as well. Less flats and more air equals more time on the bike and less time pumping and repairing!

Q:  This bike would be a cool electric bike. Any thoughts on that?

A:  Funny you should ask! The Capuchin will come with battery mounts and cable guides already  installed so that in the near future when we offer our electric motor kit the Capuchin will be 100% compatible. You will just mount the battery and install the 350W electric motor rear wheel and you will be ready to go.

 

Features on the Monkey Faction Capuchin:

The Shimano trigger shifters are easily operated with the touch of a finger. The bike is designed to be both fun and very simple to ride.

There are no bumpy roads ahead of you on the Capuchin due to the alloy, coil-spring suspension fork and 4" wide tires.

Powerful front and rear disc brakes make sure you stop safely and controlled.

The alloy frame keeps the bicycle light at 35lbs and also makes it resistant to the elements.

Simply put, this bike will take you anywhere you want to go and will make the trip the best part of your day!

SIZING: Two sizes create the perfect ride for you:

The Capuchin comes in a S/M size as well as a L/XL size. 

The S/M  size is perfect for riders between 4'8" and 5'4" tall

The L/XL size is perfect for riders between 5'5" and 6'3" tall

The foot-forward position of the pedals combined with the long scooter-style seat enables riders to adjust their position for optimal comfort and performance.

The Capuchin supports a weight of up to 350lbs for riders plus their gear.

LIFETIME FRAME WARRANTY:

Monkey Faction grants each original buyer a non-transferable warranty subject to the following limitations, terms and conditions:

Lifetime Summary Coverage (Subject to limitations, terms and additional conditions as explained below)

All Monkey Faction frames are warranted for the lifetime of the original retail buyer. If at the time of warranty, Monkey Faction does not have available an equivalent frame, the consumer may be offered a complete bike at a significantly discounted price.

One (1) Year Summary Coverage (Subject to limitations, terms and additional conditions as explained below) All Monkey Faction forks, parts and components (except wear items such as tires, grips and inner tubes) are warranted for one year from the date of purchase to the original retail buyer.   

The warranty does not cover the following:

• Improper assembly

• Improper maintenance

• Normal wear and tear

• Installation of components, parts, or accessories not originally intended for or compatible with the bicycle as sold

• Damage or failure due to accident, misuse, abuse, or neglect

• Labor charges for part replacement or changeover

• Paint/finish

Who We Are:  Team Monkey Faction

The three of us (Chris, Dave and Michael) are veterans of the bike industry. Our obsession with bikes began as kids and grew over the years as we worked in shops and for multiple bicycle companies.  We have helped build several of today's iconic cycling brands.

Many of the brands that we have worked with are primarily focused on racing and performance. While this can be very exciting, it can also be limiting as weight, aerodynamics and efficiency tend to rule every decision.

We have long dreamed of starting our own company that focuses on unique bikes designed for fun, comfort and affordability! We named the company Monkey Faction because it captures our spirit for enjoying life and being in a community of like-minded people. 

Monkey Faction wants to get more people riding bicycles and having more fun. Whether you are young or old, your health and quality of life improves by riding a bicycle.

We hope you will join us at Team Monkey Faction!

DEVELOPMENT PROCESS: Building the Capuchin

 

We have designed and sourced thousands of bikes over the years. Everything from kid's bikes to high-performance racing bikes used in the Olympics. As a result of our extensive experience, we enjoy very strong relationships with our factories. This is a key reason why we are able to create a bike as cool and unique as the Capuchin and still price it affordably.

Do not let the great price fool you! There is as much engineering in the Capuchin as there is in many high priced carbon racing bikes. In addition, the materials and attention to detail (welds, alignment, formed dropouts, etc.) on the Capuchin are noteworthy. We also perform quality checks throughout the manufacturing process to ensure the bikes are precisely manufactured to our specs. We make sure the bicycles meet the highest strength and safety standards.

COLORS:  Find the perfect one for you

 

 Monkey Faction Timeline: The evolutionary process

story:
Biking in the Big City

Do you know Hadley Robinson? Do you love Hadley Robinson? Do you realize that Hadley is one of the most fun and awesome people in the world, and that your life is hella better because she is your friend? Do you want to help out with a sweet belated birthday surprise? Also, do you like biking? 

  • Hi. My name is Bill Bowles. And Hadley is one of my best friends. 
  • Hadley was so excited about her bike, only to have it stolen after 3 months. 
  • She needs a new one. And WE CAN make that happen this week. 

$800 is all it takes.

  • I have consulted some bike-people, and they assure me that for only $800, Hadley will be able to get a sweet new bike that will make her feel like the awesome urban biker chick that she is. 
  • She will also get a sweet new bike lock. 
  • If we don't reach the $800 goal, that's cool too. She can get some bigger wheels for her Razor Scooter. 

The Impact

In a beautiful city like San Francisco, biking has become an exciting, eco-friendly, healthy, and all around awesome way to get to work. Sound familier? Yeah, I thought so. "Exciting, eco-friendly, healthy, all-around awesome". Yeah. That's Hadley. 

  • Let's help Hadley curb global warming.
  • Let's keep the streets of San Francisco sexy.
  • Let's open up a spot on BART.
  • Let's keep Bill from having to pick up the weekly CSA vegetables on foot. 

Bottom Line

Let's be honest: Let's get Hadley a bike. 

    Spread the Word

    If you can't help with the Hadley bike fun(d), please pass this on to someone who can. I'm sure you know someone who loves Hadley even more than you do.

story:
MEET THE "NO-DRIP CHAIN LUBER:"

FINALLY -  A BETTER WAY TO LUBRICATE A BIKE CHAIN.

The applicator rotates closed to prevent leaking. You don't need much lubricant - just one tick-mark. 

 

WHY THIS IS THE BEST CHAIN LUBE TOOL OUT THERE:

Drip bottles are time consuming - you've got to put a drip on each side of each link in the chain.

Spray cans are messy!

Lubricating your chain is a pain.  Until now:

MAKES LUBING YOUR CHAIN AS FAST AND EASY AS RIDING A BIKE AND AS FUN (well, almost!)

NO DRIPPING, NO OVER-SPRAY, NO MESS TO CLEAN UP

WORKS WITH ANY LOW-VISCOSITY LIQUID BIKE LUBRICANT

SAVES LUBRICANT = GOOD FOR THE ENVIRONMENT

 

CLEAN AND SIMPLE.  Fill the bottle, not quite full, with your favorite lubricant, and tightly screw on the applicator cap.  Open the applicator so it's straight-up.  With the bottle upside-down, hold the absorbent pad against the chain.  The applicator's guide ribs keep the Luber on the chain.  While backpedaling the chain, give the bottle a gentle squeeze, or two.  You don't need much lubricant.  Spin the chain a complete cycle - or two, if needed - and you're ready to ride!  Rotate the applicator down and into the cap to prevent leaking.

A "DOSAGE" SCALE ON THE LABEL SHOWS JUST HOW MUCH TO USE, so you don't use too much!  Each tick mark equals approximately one chain lubrication.  The 2-ounce bottle includes the foam-lined travel cap, but not the  lubricant.

The No-Drip Chain Luber comes with five absorbent pads in a re-usable package. (Package shown with retail label.)

ABSORBENT PADS ARE LONG-LASTING AND REPLACEABLE.  Each pad lasts for about twenty chain lubes and can be flipped over for extended wear.

Additional replacement pads are packaged twelve per pack.

PROTOTYPE DEVELOPMENT AND PATENT

It took a few prototypes for the No-Drip Chain Luber to work just right. The design is now ready for production and patent pending!

PRODUCTION PLAN

The No-Drip Chain Luber was announced at Interbike, in Las Vegas, on September 19th.  The response was overwhelmingly positive!  A lot of shops are interested and we got some great press.  Check out this report on the NDCL from PinkBike.

Injection-mold design starts this week (9/24), and I'm delighted to say that the NDCL will be 100% made in America!  The mold will take about a month to build and another two weeks to dial in.  So I plan on placing material orders in mid-November and should have product ready to ship at the beginning of December.

GREAT PRODUCTS ARE MADE BY GOOD FOLKS. The Luber is designed and made here in California and will be assembled here by the good folks at Goodwill Industries.  Goodwill employs people who would not otherwise have jobs, and trains them so they can join the workforce.  Most of the content is American made.  I partnered with a 50-year old bottle-cap manufacturer in Rhode Island.  The bottles are made in L.A., and the absorbent pads come from a company in Minnesota.  Your contribution not only helps cover our first production run, but also contributes to the community!

Using my own resources, I've developed a production prototype and have applied for a patent.  I'm also covering the cost of the applicator's plastic injection mold.  The campaign funds go into the first production run, as well as:

  • A special fixture that press-fits the applicator into the bottle-cap.
  • A semi-automatic labeling machine.
  • A stamping die to cut the absorbent pads from roll-stock.

The funding goal is set so that, if we meet our goal, 100% of the funds raised are applied to the Chain Luber's production.  In manufacturing, the more you make, the lower the cost.  Please spread the word so we can exceed our goal, increase our production run and keep the price low!

GOOD FOR YOU

GOOD FOR THE ENVIRONMENT

HELP MAKE A GREAT PRODUCT HAPPEN!

THANK YOU for checking out the No-Drip Chain Luber, and for your support.  If you like this project, then please tell your friends!

A special fixture that press-fits the applicator into the bottle-cap.
A semi-automatic labeling machine.
A stamping die to cut the absorbent pads from roll-stock.
The funding goal is set so that, if we meet our goal, 100% of the funds raised are applied to the Chain Luber's production.  In manufacturing, the more you make, the lower the cost.  Please spread the word so we can exceed our goal, increase our production run and keep the price low!
GOOD FOR YOU
GOOD FOR THE ENVIRONMENT
HELP MAKE A GREAT PRODUCT HAPPEN!
THANK YOU for checking out the No-Drip Chain Luber, and for your support.  If you like this project, then please tell your friends!

story:
Mark Coburn is cycling from 'Rome to Home'

26th May. The Rome to Home cycle to raise money for local Yes groups is complete BUT you still have time to donate.

25th May, FINAL STAGE! Today Mark cycles the 78 miles from Dumfries to Glasgow's St Enoch Square, expected at 430pm. He'll be meeting up with other cyclists at the city's Emirates Arena and they will accompany Mark to his last stop.

A lot of you have been asking for a graphic of Mark's route it's now there in the 'Gallery' tab above. Also now a new video.

Over on Facebook and Twitter Mark is uploading lots of images, cartoons and updates from his journey find the links below.

The background

Mark starts his 27 day journey on Sunday, 27 April, taking him to Pisa, Genoa, Milan, Turin, Lyon, Paris and London before arriving in Glasgow's George Square on 25 May. 

Mark Coburn, 40, said: "I'll be fulfilling two ambitions here. Ever since I was a boy I’ve always wanted to do a long distance cycle, and, I've always been a Yes voter, so the two go hand in hand. The September 18 referendum gives me the motivation and the opportunity to raise funds for the campaign’s local groups. If we are to win this referendum it'll be down to the grassroots activists. Without them there will be no Yes vote. Regarding this fundraiser what is crucial to bear in mind is that all donations will be going into the local campaigns, so in effect, all sponsors will be sponsoring themselves and their own campaigns. The more they raise, the more they can spend. 

"Since the May 2011 I had been thinking about doing something truly unique for the yes cause, and, it was while I was on holiday in Florence in 2012 that I came up with the 'Rome to Home' project."

Nominate a local Yes group

This fundraiser is for local Yes groups so when you donate remember to specify which local group you want your cash to go to. This is easily added to your name or 'anonymous' by changing your 'visibility' on the last page you come to. And remember to tick the contribution amount if you want that shown.

There are around 200 Yes groups the length and breadth of Scotland, some more active than others. Getting a comprehensive list together isn't so easy BUT here's a list pulled together by Yes Clydesdale. 

http://yesclydesdale.org/yeslinks/yes_groups.html

What NO perks?

That's correct. We want all the money raised to go to local groups, no spending on trinkets. So everything raised, minus the indiegogo fee, will be shared among the groups as per the total amount they respectively raise.  So if you have a favourite group, hankering to support a special place, memories of first holidays etc it's up to you which Yes group you choose to allocate your cash to.

Payments....Rules....

Debit/credit card payments and PayPal are available. And if you're donating from outside the UK we ask you don't exceed £500 in total as that wouldn't be a 'permissable donation'.

23 Stages

Stage 1 27/4 Roma to Monatalto di Castro - 66 miles - COMPLETED

Stage 2 28/4 Montalto di Castro to Follonica - 74 miles - COMPLETED

Stage 3 29/4 Follonica to Pisa - 70 miles - COMPLETED

30/4 Rest day/Media

Stage 4  1/05 Pisa to Borgetto di Vara - 57 miles - COMPLETED

Stage 5 2/05 Borgetto di Vara to Genoa - 53 miles - COMPLETED

Stage 6 3/05 Genoa to Pavia - 77 miles - COMPLETED

Stage 7 4/05 Pavia to Tradate - 45 miles - COMPLETED

5/05 Rest day/Media

Stage 8 06/05 Turin to Bardonecchia - 58 miles - COMPLETED

Stage 9 07/05 Mondane to Chambery - 64 miles - COMPLETED

Stage 10 08/05 Chambery to Lyon - 70 miles - COMPLETED

09/05 Rest day/media

Stage 11 10/05 Lyon to Tournus - 63 miles - COMPLETED

Stage 12 11/05 Tournus to Dijon - 65 miles - COMPLETED

Stage 13 12/05 Dijon to Avallon - 64 miles - COMPLETED

Stage 14 13/05 Avallon to Auxerre - 32 miles - COMPLETED

Stage 15 14/05 Auxerre to Nemours - 61 miles - COMPLETED

Stage 16 15/05 Nemours to Paris - 49 miles - COMPLETED

16/05 Rest day/media

17/05 Travel to London/media

Stage 17 18/05 London to Bedford - 63 miles - COMPLETED

Stage 18 19/05 Bedford to Loughborough - 63 miles - COMPLETED

Stage 19 20/05 Loughborough to Chapeltown - 63 miles - COMPLETED

21/05 Rest day/media

Stage 20 22/05 Chapeltown to Ripon - 58 miles - COMPLETED

Stage 21 23/05 Ripon to Appleby-in-Westmorland - 62 miles - COMPLETED

Stage 22 24/05 Appleby-in-Westmorland to Dumfries - 65 miles - COMPLETED

Final Stage - 25/05 Dumfries to Glasgow's St Enoch Square - 78 miles - COMPLETED

And if you're donating from outside the UK we ask you don't exceed £500 in total as that wouldn't be a 'permissable donation'.23 StagesStage 1 27/4 Roma to Monatalto di Castro - 66 miles - COMPLETEDStage 2 28/4 Montalto di Castro to Follonica - 74 miles - COMPLETEDStage 3 29/4 Follonica to Pisa - 70 miles - COMPLETED30/4 Rest day/MediaStage 4  1/05 Pisa to Borgetto di Vara - 57 miles - COMPLETEDStage 5 2/05 Borgetto di Vara to Genoa - 53 miles - COMPLETEDStage 6 3/05 Genoa to Pavia - 77 miles - COMPLETEDStage 7 4/05 Pavia to Tradate - 45 miles - COMPLETED5/05 Rest day/MediaStage 8 06/05 Turin to Bardonecchia - 58 miles - COMPLETEDStage 9 07/05 Mondane to Chambery - 64 miles - COMPLETEDStage 10 08/05 Chambery to Lyon - 70 miles - COMPLETED09/05 Rest day/mediaStage 11 10/05 Lyon to Tournus - 63 miles - COMPLETEDStage 12 11/05 Tournus to Dijon - 65 miles - COMPLETEDStage 13 12/05 Dijon to Avallon - 64 miles - COMPLETEDStage 14 13/05 Avallon to Auxerre - 32 miles - COMPLETEDStage 15 14/05 Auxerre to Nemours - 61 miles - COMPLETEDStage 16 15/05 Nemours to Paris - 49 miles - COMPLETED16/05 Rest day/media17/05 Travel to London/mediaStage 17 18/05 London to Bedford - 63 miles - COMPLETEDStage 18 19/05 Bedford to Loughborough - 63 miles - COMPLETEDStage 19 20/05 Loughborough to Chapeltown - 63 miles - COMPLETED21/05 Rest day/mediaStage 20 22/05 Chapeltown to Ripon - 58 miles - COMPLETEDStage 21 23/05 Ripon to Appleby-in-Westmorland - 62 miles - COMPLETEDStage 22 24/05 Appleby-in-Westmorland to Dumfries - 65 miles - COMPLETEDFinal Stage - 25/05 Dumfries to Glasgow's St Enoch Square - 78 miles - COMPLETED

story:
About the Company 

SPACE WARP DYNAMICS, LLC is prototyping an innovative Space Warp Drive Motor.  Laboratory experiments have demonstrated the existence of an artificially induced space warp- the bending of the fabric of space. This product will revolutionize terrestrial and space transportation. While the physics is complex, the device is uncomplicated and has been engineered to be highly reliable.  The motor currently has a registered patent pending number (61/960001). 


Research Team

David Pares has a MS and a BGS in Geography and an AS in Engineering Science. This multi-disciplinary background in science and engineering led to the design, integration and fabrication of the Space Warp Motor. Dave currently serves as Adjunct Professor at the University of Nebraska Omaha. He is also a faculty member of Metropolitan Community College, Nebraska Wesleyan, and Buena Vista College (on-line program). He regularly teaches over 65 semester hours per year in eight different subjects: Physics, Meteorology, Physical Science, Astronomy, Physical Geography (Weather and Climate) & (Soils and Landforms), Physical Geology and Statistics. Dave has written diverse course curriculum and teaches both classroom and on-line courses. A former Air Force meteorologist and numerical weather modeler, he is now the President of Space Warp Dynamics.

Matt Judah, previously a physics student at the University of Nebraska at Omaha, earned his BS in Physics with a Minor in Math and Chemistry and is currently enrolled in the PhD Physics program at Colorado State in Fort Collins. Matt won the Top Organic Physics Student Award in 2010 and the Top Physics Student Award in 2012. He is Vice President of Space Warp Dynamics, LLC and is the Associate Team Leader and Researcher for space warp development.

Keene Tiedemann has a Doctor of Management, Masters in Aerospace Science, BS in Electronics Technology and an Associate of Science in Avionics. He provides network IT support for First Data Corporation. He is a retired Air Force officer with a technical background in Electronic Warfare and has flown in B-52 and the RC-135S aircraft. Keene is Chief Test Pilot and Flight Controls Engineer for Space Warp Dynamics.

Kyle Finley is majoring in Information Assurance and Native American Studies at the University of Nebraska at Omaha. He has also worked with the Cosmic Ray Observatory Project in Nebraska. Kyle will promote and manage social media as well as develop videos for the project. He is the head of Information Technology for Space Warp Dynamics.

Christophe Massin has a BSC in Computer Science and is a Software Engineer & Aircraft Systems Designer. Had set up two companies in France in engineering and the CAD industry. He is in charge of Flight Systems Engineering for Space Warp Dynamics.

Steve Snodgrass received a BA in psychology and philosophy from the University of Nebraska in Lincoln and a MSW in social work from the University of Nebraska at Omaha. He is the head of Communication and Public Affairs for Space Warp Dynamics.



Goals for this Project

We are seeking 80,000 dollars to take the current technology to the next level which will lift our UAV off the ground.  All of our testing has achieved remarkable milestones aimed at the ultimate goal: a fully axial controlled, artificially induced space warp craft.  Full funding will allow us to proceed to the ultimate level: a full-sized pilot-controlled ship. 


Take up our offer to be a part of history! Here is your opportunity to bring the world into the 21stCentury with warp drive technology.  It is you, the public, who can bring this project to fruition- no government or non-government organization; just you.  To know that your donation will usher in a whole new economy and the opportunity for not just a few, but for the many, to experience a whole new way to travel around the world and into space, has to excite you! Think of possibilities!

There are also tangible items you can get at various contribution levels including, hats, T-shirts, mouse pads and patches.  These are only tokens, but you can say that you were part of the biggest technical revolution in the history of the human race.  We will put all contributors’ names on a small plaque on the first craft to go to space. Our company’s logo is “Wave of the Future”.  If you want to be part of the future then please join us now!

All funds will be applied to purchasing hardware to get our UAV off the ground.  If we miss our goal, it will take longer, but we will not quit. The UAV will lift off the ground and the rest will be history. Join us!


The Impact of Space Warp Technology

Our warp drive will change both terrestrial and space transportation.  Bending the fabric of space works equally well in the atmosphere as in a space environment.  The cost to transport materials into space can drop from $30,000 to less than $10.00 per pound. 

Our warp engine design is a modular configuration that will be retrofitted to existing aircraft. The fuel savings will have a tremendously positive economic impact and will reduce atmospheric pollution of the upper atmosphere.  With over seven thousand aircraft airborne at any given time, think of what it would mean to fly around the world at a cost that is reduced to the purchase of a bus ticket between Omaha and Lincoln, Nebraska.

Space warp technology will facilitate the establishment of space stations as well as the colonization of planets, moons and asteroids.  The space warp motor will provide a fast and dependable mechanism for logistical support for humans to navigate the solar system and beyond.

The Greatest Challenge

After nine years of research we have produced the technology people have dreamed about- a low powered functional warp drive.  Help us scale up the technology, lift our UAV off the ground and apply what we learn to both terrestrial and space transportation.

The main obstacle every new technology encounters are the people who cannot recognize the paradigm shift.  Tesla and Edison experienced this in the debate over Alternating Current versus Direct Current. Heavier than air flight was once thought to be impossible.  The same thing will happen with warp technology. The mainstream will only believe when they see the craft lift off the ground. When that happens the situation will change very quickly. Here is your chance to be at the forefront of the next great leap in transportation.

Once the funding is in place we will get the craft off the ground.  Next, we will market the technology, provide visual demonstrations and generate sales in order to get a craft into space!

Spread the Word on Space Warp

Please help us spread the word! Tell everyone you know about our Space Warp Project. Use the Indiegogo share tools to tell you friends, relatives and neighbors. Together, we can change the world.


Links to Official Internet Media:

Twitter: https://twitter.com/SWarpDynamics

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/SWarpDynamics

Space Warp Dynamics Website: http://swdllc.paresspacewarpresearch.org/Copyright/Copyright.htm

Additional Information: http://www.paresspacewarpresearch.org/

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCpGB9CG1rMOTLLfSw9LAAtQ/videos

story:
THE ULTIMATE UNCONVENTIONAL COMMUTER

The Buzzraw X is both unique and practical. Combining suspension with
fat tires, The Buzzraw X smooths out cobblestone roads and glides over
potholes with ease.







Origins of the Buzzraw X, Coast cycles Shares its journey towards the conceptualization of the Absolute Beast! 



 

Featuring Alex Jumelin, the Godfather of flatland BMX, Coast Cycles brand ambassador and Team rider. Introducing the Buzzraw X for the first time in Singapore.



 


We created the Buzzraw X so that you want to take them out to ride. Bringing to you not only ergonomically but also fashionably designed electric bicycles that rival bespoke designs of the best in the world. People might say that we are extreme, but it’s a simple philosophy that drives us to work hard every day.



From the drawing board to the first prototype to the final production model, we brainstorm, argue, discuss and concur only to repeat the process until we arrive at the ‘perfect’ bike. How ‘perfect’? It makes you want to get on, and ride.

After all, Everybody Needs Some Time To Coast.




 



Long and oh-so comfy. It takes two, or even three, with kiddo up front.
Who says riding is all about going solo?




Riding a regular commuter e-bike at 25km/h on cobblestoned streets in Milan can be unnerving. Due to the constant tire deflection from the uneven surfaces, even with conventional suspension forks, this trait is especially amplified under hard braking. With this in mind, we designed a Girder fork from scratch with a unique linkage geometry, allowing us to finely tune it to the Buzzraw X to work in harmony. All that resulted in a consistent trail throughout its 80mm of suspension travel even during braking, allowing the Buzzraw X to glide over road gaps and bumps with ease and comfort while maintaining full control at all times.

Designed with user serviceability and customisability in mind we decided to incorporate a conventional shock mount sizing for our rear suspension and BuzzWalker Front fork. This would allow you to choose from a wide verity of off the shelf shocks, be it a coil shock with titanium spring, rock hard steel for those heavy hits or a feathery light premium air shock we got you covered for options. So now, without the need to spend time on an arduous journey across the internet looking for that proprietary shock you could enjoy that time coasting on your bike!
 

 

Put together with ABEC industrial grade bearings, 4130 chromoly tubing, CNC'd 6061 T6 alloy Linkages with full stainless-steel hardware all work to achieve imperceptible break-away stiction, allowing the BuzzWalker fork phenomenal small bump sensitivity.
 




Dual suspension, 80mm of linear front and rear travel to perfectly smooth out cobblestone roads and glide over potholes with ease.
 

 


 


 



The Coast Cycles custom reinforced racing grade slick tires give you all the advantages of larger tires, with unbelievably low rolling resistance. The multi-purpose compound gives unmatched grip in the dry while maintaining outstanding grip levels in the wet.



The MISSION COMMAND takes racing and trail riding to the next level. With the newly updated continuous centre tread knobs, it’s now the definition of a fast rolling, excellent control fat bike tire. This new pattern offers an extremely smooth ride with plenty of grip to spare.







CLEAN, SMOOTH, SIMPLE
No lube required equals no grease stains. Sheds dirt and grime and cleaning with water is easy. Just get on it and ride. No chain equals no chain clatter. It’s spooky quiet. A Gates Carbon Drive System weighs less than a chain. Lighter weight means higher performance. The instant engagement and smooth feel are unlike anything you’ve experienced before. You’ve got to ride it to believe it.

 




Power where you need it
No complicated mid-drive, no clunky transmission, just effortless power right where you need it. First, we built a mid-drive motor but weren’t happy with the bike’s performance. We test rode some front wheel motors currently on the market and it affected steering and traction. With a rear hub motor, outputting 250/750 watts in tandem with every pedal stroke, it delivers performance directly to the rear wheel, so it’s all “grip” and “go”, no hiccups or false starts.

We give you up to 3 adjustable speed settings for your Buzzraw X and walk-assist.

3: Getting from point A to B has never been easier.

2: With 45 kilometres of range before a recharge, this mode is designed to stretch your horizons.

1: The perfect balance between power and battery life, no math required.

Walk-assist: Manoeuvre when off the bike - push a button and the bike slowly moves forward.






Don't have space or a plug in your garage? Worry not! The 48V lithium-ion battery can be locked and removed from the Buzzraw X and taken inside to charge while at home, work, or anywhere else.

 
 





Because we see merits in both hub and mid-drive motors, we have developed the Buzzraw X to accommodate both variants. From a Parisian owner who prefers a single speed belt drive hub motor for simplicity to a Swiss commuter in Lucerne that will power up the mountains in his 10-speed mid-drive motor Buzzraw X. We want our customers to have the ability to customise their own unique Buzzraw X exactly the way they want it.








 

A conservative three-pronged approach is used to verify the design integrity of the Buzzraw X. Using computerized 3D design models, variations of the frame design are subjected to a series of FEA stress simulation and continuously optimized with attention to tubing and material selection.



Frame prototypes are then welded and assembled to be mechanically tested for compliance to EN and ISO standards. After making it this far, the bike has to satisfy our team of professional butt-dynos, bike-abusers and artists in terms of ride quality, durability and sex appeal before it is considered fit for production.



 






 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

“This is probably the coolest bike I’ve ever seen. Coast has really thought differently about bike design. So, rather than have the traditional diamond shape, well it’s got something completely different, but this is a bike designed for urban environments and to be really practical. Absolute beast!"

 

“For those unfamiliar with Coast Cycles, this brand is based in Singapore and has been doing this specific frame styles way before others caught up!"

 

“Out of all of the Buzzraw styled e-bikes out there, there has never been one with full suspension. Until now.”

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



Coast Cycles was incorporated in 2012. However, it was around two years later (May 2014) when the Singapore brand opened its two-storey headquarters which comprises a design studio, showroom, workshop and office. The headquarters is in the eastern part of Singapore and it's just a 5-minute ride to the beach. Coast Cycles also has a single-storey warehousing facility that is situated at the northern part of Singapore.

Jump on, breathe in, and go. All you need is to feel the breeze. Coast Cycles designs and builds bicycles that are unpretentious, uncluttered, and uncomplicated.
 



We believe things are best kept simple. We take the fuss out of cycling so you can enjoy the feeling of the ride. We believe in bringing to you ergonomically and fashionably designed bicycles that rival bespoke designs of the best in the world. Some say that we are extreme, but we pursue excellence in design and materials so that the bicycles which you purchase from us, are the same bicycles we would gladly ride.

After all, Everybody Needs Some Time To Coast.



 


 

 


 





 




We have you covered when it comes to frame, fork, and components.  

Just like the rest of our rides, The Buzzraw X is a bike we're proud to stand behind and know that you'll be proud to own. We're confident in our construction, design, and engineering - and you'll share that confidence with our 24-month warranty on the frame and fork, as well as all the electrical components, including the battery. This is a bike that'll keep you rolling for years, and if not, we'll make it right. Ride easy, we've got your back.





We know the best part of any Indiegogo project is the day your perks for support are delivered. And while a lot of projects have kept us waiting and wondering, we’re determined not to put you in the same spot. That’s why we guarantee 2019 delivery of our Buzzraw X. Back our project and you’ll have your new e-bike, ready to roll before summer or you’ll get your money back. Simple. Just the way we like it.






As a company, we thrive on challenges. We recognize that with the design, development, and introduction of any new product there are hurdles that we’ll face but, unlike most Indiegogo projects, we’ve been developing the Buzzraw X for 2 years prior to this roll out. We’ve also successfully designed, developed and deployed over 10 completely new models since our humble beginnings as a one-model bike company including our award winning Quinn and Buzzraw.

After 7 years and all of those rollouts, we have a deep understanding of the sticking points in the process and a well-oiled machine for overcoming the obstacles that pop up along the way. We have wonderful relationships with our manufacturers, supply chain, and everybody involved in the process of bringing these bikes to fruition, so we’re confident in our ability to deliver, on time and as promised.

We’re committed to making this process as transparent as possible to our supporters, so we’ll keep you in the loop regarding any and all developments, decisions, and possible delays, and we’re committed to our guarantee that these bikes will be rolling into people’s homes this year.

We appreciate your support on this dream of ours, and we’re thrilled to have your help in making the Buzzraw X a reality.

 We have you covered when it comes to frame, fork, and components.  Just like the rest of our rides, The Buzzraw X is a bike we're proud to stand behind and know that you'll be proud to own. We're confident in our construction, design, and engineering - and you'll share that confidence with our 24-month warranty on the frame and fork, as well as all the electrical components, including the battery. This is a bike that'll keep you rolling for years, and if not, we'll make it right. Ride easy, we've got your back.We know the best part of any Indiegogo project is the day your perks for support are delivered. And while a lot of projects have kept us waiting and wondering, we’re determined not to put you in the same spot. That’s why we guarantee 2019 delivery of our Buzzraw X. Back our project and you’ll have your new e-bike, ready to roll before summer or you’ll get your money back. Simple. Just the way we like it.As a company, we thrive on challenges. We recognize that with the design, development, and introduction of any new product there are hurdles that we’ll face but, unlike most Indiegogo projects, we’ve been developing the Buzzraw X for 2 years prior to this roll out. We’ve also successfully designed, developed and deployed over 10 completely new models since our humble beginnings as a one-model bike company including our award winning Quinn and Buzzraw.After 7 years and all of those rollouts, we have a deep understanding of the sticking points in the process and a well-oiled machine for overcoming the obstacles that pop up along the way. We have wonderful relationships with our manufacturers, supply chain, and everybody involved in the process of bringing these bikes to fruition, so we’re confident in our ability to deliver, on time and as promised.We’re committed to making this process as transparent as possible to our supporters, so we’ll keep you in the loop regarding any and all developments, decisions, and possible delays, and we’re committed to our guarantee that these bikes will be rolling into people’s homes this year.We appreciate your support on this dream of ours, and we’re thrilled to have your help in making the Buzzraw X a reality.

story:
Introducing The Maxwell Stoic

A completely inconspicuous, lightweight e-bike with a minimalist classic design yet all the features you need to live life on a bike. Stoic is visually indistinguishable from an ordinary bicycle but is both a great bicycle, and a great e-bike with an exhilarating acceleration.

 

Stoic is designed with the hardcore everyday allweather bike commuter who depends on their bike to get around  month-after-month, year-after year. Still, Stoic is accessible enough for even the most casual riders who  are new to bikes just want a fun way to get around. 

 

Class I Pedal-Assist

Up to 19MPH, with a 300W Rear Hubmotor.

 

Lightweight

Easy to handle and bring anywhere. Rides like a bike should.

 

Stealth Battery Pack

Maintains an awesome classic, doesn’t attract unwanted attention when locked at the bike rack.

 

Integrated Lighting

To see and be seen, without the hassle of charging separate batteries.

Fenders

When it rains, it pours. Or snows, it snows here too.

 

Pannier Cargo Rack

Essential for those that live on their bike.

 

One Gear to Rule Them All

Single-Speed. Simple, Reliable, Ultra-Low maintenance

 

 

Included kick stand Standard

Sometimes practical stuff is awesome.

 

 

Tires For City or for Adventure

700x38C tires Kenda or Schwalbe tires with clearance for up to 42C tires. Skinny enough to be fast, wide enough to be comfortable on the widest variety of terrain. 

 

Efficiency is Freedom

Stoic is designed to pay for itself in about 2000 miles, and designed to last tens of thousands, so Stoic can be a blast to ride and offer freedom from car-dependent lifestyle. 

 

In any color you want, so long as it’s black.

 

 

 

 

Accessories

 

 

About Us

Our goal at Maxwell is to hack the way you get around. We’re passionate about offering transportation alternatives, because efficiency is freedom.

Maxwell Motorbikes was founded by Troy Rank with an obsession about efficient two wheeled travel and adventure. Troy has been designing Ebikes for 13 years. In 2014, after his riding over 4000 miles in less than a month on a world-record setting Ebike journey, he set out to create the best bikes for urban transportation and adventure touring.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Stoic is currently at the production stage but we need help to achieve volume production. We have spent over two years building and testing Stoic, and we're confident that the design is ready for everyone. Regardless, right now is a particularly challenging time in supply-chain and demand on each component is greater than ever. Rest assured, we have done a thorough job planning for these challenges and should be able to meet our current delivery targets. 

Our frames are already starting production and we can't wait to build them for you!

story: 8/20/2013 - UPDATE:  I love the rapid growth in interest we've received on this project.  It does't look like we'll hit our goal, but that's OK.  We're well on our way to Step 1 of our plan.  We need to raise only $5,000 to send our Project Engineer to Shenzhen, China and start the production cycle.  We'll raise further funding in September to complete further steps and process our order with the factory.

story:
Summary

The MARC Wreckers need your help. We have registered for the Becel Heart & Stroke Ride for Heart in support of the Heart and Stroke Foundation, and we are raising money to help Canadians live longer fuller, lives. 

Please help us reach our fundraising goal of $5000 by making a donation today! It’s fast, secure and easy to make an online gift.  There are two ways to support the team, buy a team shirt (on this site) or donate directly to the team here.   100% of the proceeds of team shirt sales will go towards the MARC Wreckers Ride for Heart fund.  Please note that for team shirt sales, no tax receipt will be issued.

With your support, the Heart and Stroke Foundation can continue to:
  • Empower Canadians to make positive changes and prevent disease
  • Save lives at the moment a health emergency strikes
  • Promote recovery, where and when it’s needed
Did you know that if things don’t change, the average Canadian will spend their last 10 years in sickness due to heart disease, stroke and other chronic conditions? Together, we can change that. 

Thank you so much for your support. Every little bit helps Canadians live longer, fuller lives.

Ride for Heart Route


What You Get

We have several different options for shirt sales:

  • $50 will get you a screen printed cotton t-shirt.
  • $100 will get you either a home or away screen printed microfibre jersey
  • $200 will get you both a home and away screen printed microfibre jerseys
  • $1000 will get you lunch with the team.
  • Sizing guide for t-shirts and jerseys
  • Once ordered, please email paul [at] bibliocommons [dot] com with your requested size.

The Impact

Every 7 minutes someone dies from heart disease and stroke in Canada. That's why our team is participating and fundraising for the Becel Heart & Stroke Ride for Heart on Sunday, June 1, 2014.

Your support will help the Heart and Stroke Foundation to achieve its 2020 goal of reducing Canadians’ rate of death from heart disease and stroke by 25%.
Your donation will directly improve the lives of Canadians through preventing disease, saving lives and promoting recovery.

Other Ways You Can Help

Instead of supporting the team here, you can donate to the MARC Wreckers team directly here.  You will receive an official tax receipt for a direct donation.

Sponsorship Credit

Many thanks to Andrew Willis for donating his time designing the MARC Wreckers logo, and to VC Ultimate for discounted shirts and screen printing.
