story:
Taga 2.0 is a bike specifically designed to address the needs of the modern family.

Many family bikes today were originally designed to carry cargo, not children. They are usually unstable, expensive and are lacking important features desired by parents and kids.

We started from scratch. For three years we turned every stone to make the most comfortable, safe, easy to ride, practical and just all around coolest family bike ever.

In Taga 2.0 the kids are sitting in the front so you can explore the world together. Taga 2.0 was carefully crafted with lots of add-ons for the entire family, to make your life easier. It’s the new way to be green and active. And if you don’t have kids and just want to use it to carry your pets or cargo, Taga 2.0 is the perfect solution.

Our first family bike, the Taga 1.0 Bike-Stroller, can be found rolling around cities all over the world. While widely loved, we knew the Taga 1.0 and other cargo/family bikes were not affordable for everybody, so we worked hard to reduce the cost, without compromising the quality or the features.

The Taga 2.0 is already in serial production. More than 3000 Taga 2.0 bikes were already delivered to backers and are used all over the world 

 

 

 

We've included pretty much anything you’d expect from a modern family bike. Take two kids facing forwards, backwards or towards each other, add a 3rd child in the back, or just one kid up to 8 years old and a water gun. Rainy? Sunny? No problem, just snap on the Royal Canopy. Your baby wants to take a nap? Recline the seat to a sleeping position. Need some help pedaling? Add our e-Bike kit!

 

 

Taga Bike was born in 2007 by an international team of parents with a shared passion for cycling and a desire for a product like this in their own lives.

In 2008 we built a production line in Taiwan and the following year launched our first product - the Taga 1.0 convertible Bike-Stroller. Over the years, we have sold our bike-strollers in over 40 countries, shipping them from our warehouses in the Netherlands, USA and Taiwan. We’ve won several design and engineering awards, including the Red Dot Design Award, the Red Herring Top 100 Award and the two most prestigious awards in the bicycle and stroller industries: Eurobike and the Kind & Jugend award.

We absolutely love the Taga 1.0, but in 2014 we were ready for our next challenge – the Taga 2.0. Our path started with our customers - getting their feedback and a better understanding of their needs. Careful attention went into every detail, giving Taga a modern style, intuitive functionality, and the flow and ease parents appreciate.  

Three years later – we’re proud to launch the Taga 2.0, the ultimate family bike.

Our Bundle Options:

story:
Vostok Titanium Components are back for Season 2019!


 

Order yours with a discount.


Vostok Titanium Components for your Brompton Bicycle

 

Why Vostok

Even with the great bicycle, there is still room for improvement! We are happy with the feedback received from the early adopters of the Vostok Rear Triangle and the Chain Tensioner. This feedback and experience producing standard OEM triangles give us the confidence to push forward and continue to offer our custom components to Brompton fans and enthusiasts worldwide. 

With the quality steel main frame and a set of titanium extremities, your Brompton bicycle will last a lifetime: the variety of drivetrains and brake sets can be interchanged to suit a particular function. Have a Rohloff or Alfine rear wheel for touring vacations and a single speed disk brake wheel for urban assault!

The Components

The titanium extremities are the fork, the rear triangle and the mini-rack. These allow installation of the disk brake set and hubs with standard over locknut distance of 135mm. In addition, we offer an aluminium Chain Tensioner to be used with a range of internal gear hubs and a Rear Derailleur Hanger for a cassette Brompton conversion. Our custom titanium fork hook makes the above setups possible even with the stock Brompton fork. 

1. The Ti Rear Triangle

Weight: 550g; Rohloff OEM dropout; Shimano Alfine/Nexus washer slot. IS disk brake mounts. M10 holes for a possible trailer situation.


Drive-side:

Non-drive-side:


2. The Front Fork

100mm OLD, IS disk brake mounts, stock mudguards fit as well as the stock rim brake. 

Right:

Left:

The Chain Tensioner V1

Vostok Chain Tensioner is designed to interface with our rear triangle. It has an adjustable chain line and a strong spring. Supplied with quality pulleys with ceramic bearings. This chain tensioner is sturdy and manufactured to last. The Chain Tensioner can be used with a new Rohloff's 58mm chain line (with supplied shortened axles) or, as standard, with Shimano hubs and other narrow chain lines.  

The Chain Tensioner V2

 

Upgraded Chain Tensioner by Vostok. We reduced weight by 40%. The pulleys are now CNC custom made and feature a deeper tooth pattern. The supported chain line is from 43.5mm to 58mm, which covers all internal hubs (from Shimano hubs to all Rohloffs - new and older). 

Chain line adjustment principle (Rohloff Speedhub pictured). Vostok is the only component manufacturer to address the problem of Rohloff's chain line on a Brompton. 

Derailleur Hanger

 

The Derailleur Hanger interfaces with the Vostok Triangle's dropout to allow Brompton cassette builds. With our titanium fork hook, there is enough clearance to fold the bicycle with a derailleur.

Vostok Mini Rack 

In two variants: stock Brompton rear triangle and the Vostok triangle. Weight: 200g; Maximum allowed carrying weight: 16 kg. Statically, the rear rack will hold a weight of 120kg (one can even stand on it), but we do not recommend you try this too often.

We believe this to be the best mini-rack for the stock Brompton, as well as the only OEM rack specific to the Vostok geometry. 

Vostok Front Cargo Ti Rack

The Vostok Front Cargo Front Rack features a 140x200mm platform, 234mm height, weighs 250g and has a carrying limit of 20kg. Best used with the Vostok Ti Front Carrier Block.

Vostok Ti Front Carrier Block

Titanium front carrier block with a set of screws.

Possible Setups

Rear Triangle Alfine 11 Di2 Build

Rear Triangle Alfine 11 Build

Full Alfine Build

Full Rohloff Speedhub Build

How to Order

There are quite a lot of bundles to choose from. Below is a detailed breakdown of everything offered in each bundle:

  1. Gagarin. Extremities: Triangle and Fork. Accessories: Chain Tensioner V2, Derailleur Hanger and Fork Hook. 
  2. Titov. Extremities: Triangle and Fork. Accessories: Derailleur Hanger and Fork Hook.
  3. Nikolayev. Extremities: Triangle only. Accessories: Chain Tensioner V2 and Fork Hook.
  4. Popovich. Extremities: Triangle only. Accessories: Derailleur Hanger, and Fork Hook.
  5. Tereshkova. Extremities: Triangle only.

All of the titanium extremities in the above bundles are in Raw Ti finish. For reference - think standard titanium Brompton parts. This is our favourite finish to show off the colour of bare titanium.

Additionally, limited edition finishes are available with both our top bundles. Due to religious beliefs, we would never paint a titanium frame. We will, however, use Titanium Carbide Coating and Titanium Nitride Coating to produce beautiful and durable finishes. 

  1. Full Satin: Gagarin and Titov. The Satin finish is polished titanium - significantly more shiny than Raw. We limit this offer to a fixed number of sets because polishing titanium is extremely labour intensive. A satin mini-rack is available to match.
  2. Black Edition: Gagarin and Titov. Our top of the line offer. Titanium Carbide coated to produce a matte black finish stronger than powder paint, with no additional weight. 
  3. Gold Edition: Gagarin and Titov. Titanium Nitride coated to produce a matte gold finish.

Please note, that the fork hooks are present in all bundles, except "Tereshkova", along with a stock calliper brake adapter, should you wish to keep the stock rim brakes. The fork hook is compatible with the stock Brompton fork as well as the Vostok fork. All Chain Tensioners offered in the bundles are version 2, except for the special bundles with limited pricing. 

Receiving Your Kit: Shipping and Taxes

After the campaign is finished, you will be contacted to confirm the shipping details and arrangements. You will also be sent a separate shipping invoice via PayPal. An approximate shipping cost of the kit to the Southeast Asia and the US is $40, and $35 to Europe, sent via EMS Post, tracked. 

Please note, that you are responsible for all relevant import taxes in your country of residence.

A common question from the European Customers is regarding VAT. While stating a lower cost on the tax declaration is illegal, there are options to use "crowdsourced delivery" services. This would be arranged at your own risk, time and expense.  

FAQ

  1. Does the bike fold with upgraded extremities? Yes, the bicycle folds and rolls as expected. The fold is wider, with added over locknut distance in the front and rear. 
  2. What are the weight savings? The total weight of the "triangle+fork+tensioner" bundle is around 1 kg.
  3. How hard is it to assemble everything together? If you are comfortable with everyday bicycle maintenance and your rear hinge does not need replacing, the work takes 2 hours.  
  4. Can I get a discount? Yes! The priced you see on the right are discounted off the retail prices. There is also a club purchase option, please write to hi@vostok.bike to purchase 5 kits or more. 
  5. Can you declare low value when you send the parcel to me? We are unable to do this, sorry. However, there is an option to use "crowdsourced delivery" services like PiggyBee and the like.

Questions? Chat with Us

Vostok on Facebook Messenger:
   

Not Ready to Buy?

Send the link to this Campaign Page to your local Brompton mod community or bicycle shop. Club purchase discounts and distributor packages are available, see the appropriate section below. 

Risks & Challenges

The main risks and challenges most new manufacturing businesses face lie within production and business operation. Usually, production is outsourced to big factories overseas, where lack of quality assurance and commitment to the product become issues that eventually lead to failure to deliver. If production is kept in-house, the funds raised do not cover the costs of getting started from scratch.  

In the case of Vostok, we are proud to be:

  1. An established local manufacturer with low operational costs
  2. A production with more than 20 years of experience making titanium bicycle frames and components with meticulousness and passion
  3. Based in Korolev, Russian Federation and working with the top welders and engineers from the industry that launched the first man into space

Our logistical partner will make sure your Components are delivered to your doorstep safely and in a timely fashion.

At the end of the successful crowdfunding campaign, the process of actually receiving the money from the crowdfunding platform may take up to one month. With this in mind, the delivery dates have been pushed forward to better manage your expectations. Periodic updates on the production process will be posted here and on Facebook.

Distribution Options, Club Purchases and Discounts

If you would like to become a distributor in your country or make a club purchase, please write to hi@vostok.bike. We will be happy to arrange this if you plan to purchase 5 or more kits.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel that this campaign can benefit from your support, please do

  • Share the campaign page on social media with Indiegogo share tools
  • Post any questions and suggestions to the appropriate section of this page

Or write to hi@vostok.bike

Thank you!

Sergey Vodwood

Vostok.bike

Tereshkova. Extremities: Triangle only.

All of the titanium extremities in the above bundles are in Raw Ti finish. For reference - think standard titanium Brompton parts. This is our favourite finish to show off the colour of bare titanium.
Additionally, limited edition finishes are available with both our top bundles. Due to religious beliefs, we would never paint a titanium frame. We will, however, use Titanium Carbide Coating and Titanium Nitride Coating to produce beautiful and durable finishes. 


Full Satin: Gagarin and Titov. The Satin finish is polished titanium - significantly more shiny than Raw. We limit this offer to a fixed number of sets because polishing titanium is extremely labour intensive. A satin mini-rack is available to match.

Black Edition: Gagarin and Titov. Our top of the line offer. Titanium Carbide coated to produce a matte black finish stronger than powder paint, with no additional weight. 

Gold Edition: Gagarin and Titov. Titanium Nitride coated to produce a matte gold finish.

Please note, that the fork hooks are present in all bundles, except "Tereshkova", along with a stock calliper brake adapter, should you wish to keep the stock rim brakes. The fork hook is compatible with the stock Brompton fork as well as the Vostok fork. All Chain Tensioners offered in the bundles are version 2, except for the special bundles with limited pricing. 
Receiving Your Kit: Shipping and Taxes
After the campaign is finished, you will be contacted to confirm the shipping details and arrangements. You will also be sent a separate shipping invoice via PayPal. An approximate shipping cost of the kit to the Southeast Asia and the US is $40, and $35 to Europe, sent via EMS Post, tracked. 
Please note, that you are responsible for all relevant import taxes in your country of residence.
A common question from the European Customers is regarding VAT. While stating a lower cost on the tax declaration is illegal, there are options to use "crowdsourced delivery" services. This would be arranged at your own risk, time and expense.  
FAQ


Does the bike fold with upgraded extremities? Yes, the bicycle folds and rolls as expected. The fold is wider, with added over locknut distance in the front and rear. 

What are the weight savings? The total weight of the "triangle+fork+tensioner" bundle is around 1 kg.


How hard is it to assemble everything together? If you are comfortable with everyday bicycle maintenance and your rear hinge does not need replacing, the work takes 2 hours.  

Can I get a discount? Yes! The priced you see on the right are discounted off the retail prices. There is also a club purchase option, please write to hi@vostok.bike to purchase 5 kits or more. 

Can you declare low value when you send the parcel to me? We are unable to do this, sorry. However, there is an option to use "crowdsourced delivery" services like PiggyBee and the like.

Questions? Chat with Us
Vostok on Facebook Messenger:   
Not Ready to Buy?
Send the link to this Campaign Page to your local Brompton mod community or bicycle shop. Club purchase discounts and distributor packages are available, see the appropriate section below. 

Risks & Challenges
The main risks and challenges most new manufacturing businesses face lie within production and business operation. Usually, production is outsourced to big factories overseas, where lack of quality assurance and commitment to the product become issues that eventually lead to failure to deliver. If production is kept in-house, the funds raised do not cover the costs of getting started from scratch.  
In the case of Vostok, we are proud to be:

An established local manufacturer with low operational costs
A production with more than 20 years of experience making titanium bicycle frames and components with meticulousness and passion
Based in Korolev, Russian Federation and working with the top welders and engineers from the industry that launched the first man into space

Our logistical partner will make sure your Components are delivered to your doorstep safely and in a timely fashion.
At the end of the successful crowdfunding campaign, the process of actually receiving the money from the crowdfunding platform may take up to one month. With this in mind, the delivery dates have been pushed forward to better manage your expectations. Periodic updates on the production process will be posted here and on Facebook.
Distribution Options, Club Purchases and Discounts
If you would like to become a distributor in your country or make a club purchase, please write to hi@vostok.bike. We will be happy to arrange this if you plan to purchase 5 or more kits.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you feel that this campaign can benefit from your support, please do

Share the campaign page on social media with Indiegogo share tools
Post any questions and suggestions to the appropriate section of this page

Or write to hi@vostok.bikeThank you!Sergey VodwoodVostok.bike

story:
We have delivered before and we will deliver again! We are committed to keep our backers happy providing 100% transparency on the manufacturing process guaranteeing delivery. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Design & Specs of the 345

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

NIGHT TIME RIDING NEVER LOOKED BETTER 

With integrated front and rear lights as standard you'll never need to worry about setting out after dark

 

SMOOTH AND POWERFUL

High quality SRAM drivetrain provides a smooth and consistent ride 

 

 

FREEDOM TO CHOOSE

Matte black, brushed chrome and hand painted limited edition designs.

 


 

These designs showcase London artist Catalina Velásquez unique style.  She uses the bike as a canvas to reflect London’s creativity and vibrancy. 

The concepts that drove the design language were Linearity & Repetition, Flexibility (Hard vs Soft) and Gradients & Movement. These were translated through colour, texture and shapes to add an extra layer of detail and elevate the original product adding a layer of bespoke customisation.

 

 

 

 

We've delivered before and we'll deliver again!

But don't just take our word for it, see what our riders are saying.

 

 

 

 

About Us

 

The 345 Model is named after the London bus route that runs between South Kensington to Peckham.  It’s a nine-mile service, and used to be our daily commute.  After countless delays and overcrowded journeys we were determined to find a more enjoyable way to get around the city. 

If you want to chat and want to know more, feel free to come down and see us in our office in East London or shoot us an email at info@newgenbikes.com.

story:
Noordung - Joy in Journey


European and global metropolises from London and Berlin to San Francisco and Copenhagen are increasingly constructing a cycling culture and infrastructure. Trends show that, in the next few years, bicycles will overtake cars when it comes to mass means of transport. Although electric cars have gained media attention, the real electrical revolution in urban transport is happening in the bicycle industry. Here and now.

We created the Noordung company because we believe that the essence of urban transportation is not just about moving from one point to the other, but about enjoying the journey. Noordung is a company that solves the issues of urban cycling with a commitment to excellence of design, user experience and service design. We have created an innovative solution that connects cycling with music and sound.

Our main product is a luxury, smart urban superbicycle of the best quality featuring a multifunctional Boombox that creates an entirely new experience of urban cycling that has never been seen before.

Noordung superbicycle has been intensively developed for the past three years and, having set up an adequate environment, we will start a small-scale production in the beginning of Q2 2019.

 

Reinventing the ride

Ride Music

Up to 100 hours of music through the state-of-the-art speakers, played from your phone.

Noordung is a pioneer in joining music with cycling. The central part of Noordung Boombox are two 20 watt RMS speakers with a frequency range of 70 Hz – 20 kHz, which are tilted at a 45 degree angle toward the rider. Needless to say, they sound amazing! The speakers wirelessly connect to the riders smartphone and play all the music and sounds played on the smartphone. You can use the Boombox while riding as well as when it's detached from the bike, turning it into an excellent portable speaker that you can enjoy while sailing, camping, lounging, etc.

 

Ride Smart

Find the cleanest routes for your daily commute and ride healthy.

The most exciting innovation inside Noordung Boombox are the PM 2.5 and PM 10 particle sensors which keep track of air pollution. Boombox is catching real time data on air quality wherever you take your Noordung bike and it can show you the actual air quality on your phone through the Noordung app. You can use this information to find the cleanest routes and really enjoy the freshest air available while on the way. With crowdsourcing, we can use the data collected and get a more accurate map of air quality around the areas frequented by cyclists and pedestrians, thus increasing awareness about the need to take care of our environment.

 

Ride Ultralight

Feel the magic of the lightest cruiser bicycle in the world.

Noordung is definitely the lightest cruiser bike in the world as well as one of the lightest urban electric bicycles at this time. It's lightness stems from the fact that its robustly designed frame is built from the manually crafted finest carbon fibres. The expert craftsmen use carbon monocoque technology, which shows in a spotless carbon finish (so called carbon look). The entire cable management runs inside the frame which weighs only 2,300 g.

 

Ride Assisted

Silent in-wheel e-motor with a 50 km range.

The electric powered Noordung bikes (Noordung Voyager in Noordung Individual) use Keyde electric motor built into the CNC machined aluminium rear wheel, which was entirely developed by Noordung engineers. The electric motor with integrated electronics, is one of the lightest of its kind in the world. It is also extremely quiet, so that it doesn't interfere with your enjoyment of music. The batteries in the Boombox enable a range of over 50 km. In hybrid mode (a combination of assisted and unassisted pedalling), which is how we feel Noordung bikes should be used, it may increase to over 100 km.

 

Ride Electrified

Charge your phone, tablet or computer via on board USB connector.

Noordung Boombox is more than just a speaker and battery powering the electric motor and bike LED lights. It's also a proper power bank on two wheels! You can use its USB outlet to charge your smartphone, tablet, computer or any other electronic device. In its essence, Noordung Boombox is an ultimate standalone device that is your trusted power source whether you're camping, sailing or just enjoying the great outdoors.

 

Tech Specs

Geometry


 

A - Seat tube: 500 mm
B - Effective top tube: 655 mm
C - Head tube: 150 mm
D - Wheel base: 1170 mm
E - Stand Over: 820 mm
F - Head tube angle: 70,5°
 

General

Frame material: Carbon fiber
Bike weight: 15 kg classic / 20 kg e-bike
Boombox weight: 2,5 kg
Speed assistance: 25km/h (EU Regulation)
Range: 50 km assist
Wheelset: Noordung Single piece Alu / Spokes
Wheels: 27,5” with Pirelli® 2.4 tires
Crankset: Doppio with internal gears / ShimanoGears: 2 (1:1,75) / 7
Brake: Shimano® hydraulic disc brake
Saddle & Grips: Brooks®
Front & rear LED light
Magnetic stem phone holder

 

Electronics

Motor: Keyde (250W)
Assist levels: 4
Battery power: 36 V, 250 Wh
Battery Cells: 20 x 18650 Li-Ion
Charging time: 4h
Speakers: 20 W RMS
Frequency range: 70 Hz - 20 kHz
Class D Amplifier
Connectivity: Wireless Audio
USB: 1 USB fast charge
PM2.5 & PM10 Dust Sensor
Arm 32-bit Processor
Mobile app (iOS & Android)

 

Our Story

Herman Potocnik - Noordung (1892 - 1929) was a Slovenian rocket engineer, a pioneer of astronautics, space flight and technologies. In his only book “The Problem of Space Travel” he developed a specific concept of a space station which also inspired Stanley Kubrick when making the movie 2001: A Space Odyssey. His book is one of the fundamental works on early space exploration.

His nickname, of which the origin is not completely clear, is supposedly a combination of two german words “No” and “Ordnung”(”No order”). We used it as an inspiration to create our bicycle. We wanted to explore cycling beyond traditional perceptions and practices. We tried to discover the very essence of cycling and have found it in one simple pleasure. The joy in journey.

We thought of our past. The time when we were still children. We thought of our first encounter with a bicycle. Until that point in time, nothing was able to make us feel as free and independent as a bicycle. We remembered the smell of fresh grass, the forests, the vast fields that we were breathing in while exploring kilometers and kilometers of uncharted territories.

Noordung is based on the café racer culture and tradition. Our goal was to create a modern day version of the cult cruiser bike and upgrade it to a smart high tech machine. The result is this unique bike that reinvents the cycling experience and takes you on the ride of your life.

 

Interview with Founder

 

"For true pleasure, it’s always important and worth it to take your time."

 

Gregor Fras is a philosopher who has been immersed in design his entire life. For over twenty years, he creates digital stories in the roles of either a creative, architect or designer of user experiences and user interfaces for some of the most challenging digital products. He is the founder of one of the first digital agencies in Slovenia and recipient of multiple design awards. A happily married father of two sons let us inside his mind and shared his views on cycling, music, life, its pleasures and of course – Noordung.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

How did it all begin? Where did you get the idea to create Noordung?

At some point in my life, I rented a design studio that was at an ideal biking distance from my home. The only bike I had until then was a mountain bike, but never a city bike, hence I bought myself one. Just a plain ordinary city bike. Despite my general enthusiasm, something was bothering me. The bike I rode to work every day, was essentially a product based on a century old technology. I am a huge technology freak, so one day I told myself: »Let’s see what a modern city bike looks like.« So I started googling and ...

...and you got thousands of hits?

No, that’s the point. The more I researched, the more I started to realize that it’s impossible to find a bike that I would actually like. Simply put, I couldn’t find a bike that was both beautiful by design and high-tech. There were tons of high-tech recreational bikes, both road and mountain, but city bikes looked and felt mostly identical to the ones from one hundred years ago.

And that pushed you into starting this company?

Not immediately. At first, when I was still being reasonable, I only wanted to build a custom bike for myself. But as I was delving deeper and deeper into creating my »perfect bike«, I started to realize that the whole process is becoming way too complicated to be only treated as a »side project«, so 3 years ago, I decided to start a company and invested some of my own money in it. I quickly got a few friends on board, who started helping me developing (now) our product. I joke that I probably came up with the most convoluted excuse to persuade my wife that I need an expensive bike.

Is Noordung an electric bike?

Noordung is a family of four bike models. The first two models – Noordung Pure and Noordung Music – are classic, non-electric, bikes with spoked rims and seven gears. They are built around Noordung carbon frame which is ready for any potential upgrades in the future. Noordung is the lightest cruiser bike in the world, thus offering you swift and effortless movement around the urban jungles. Noordung Music is the entry point into our beautiful new world of combining music with cycling, as it comes with the Noordung Boombox, that plays music from your smartphone.

The top two models from the Noordung family are Noordung Voyager and Noordung Individual, which are electric bikes with a maximum speed of 25 km/h as per EU regulation. Electric bikes are definitely the next big thing in the biking industry, especially in the segment of city bikes where, in contrast to recreational bikes, sweating is an unwanted side effect of its use (riding to work, meetings, etc.)

What I find even more appealing is that Noordung is also – a traditional bike. In my opinion, the biggest drawback of urban electric bikes is their weight, which renders them practically useless once the battery runs out, or when the rider just wants to – ride. That’s why we at Noordung tried to build as light a bike as possible, therefore we chose to build the frame out of carbon fiber. By the way, Noordung is the only cruiser bike in the world with a carbon fiber frame! In this respect, we wanted to build an ideal hybrid bike, where human effort may or may not be joined by electric assistance. It depends. While riding to a meeting, electric assistance can help us arrive there sweat free. On the other hand, we may want to sweat out some of the stress while riding home from work, so we can afford to refrain from using electric assistance.

After numerous test kilometers, I realized that I only use electric assistance about half of the time. During the other half, I really like to feel my legs being more active. One of the core values of Noordung is to encourage its clients to lead and promote a healthy lifestyle.

Electric drive seems to be ubiquitous in urban cycling, but music is definitely something new. How did music come into the picture?

Music is without a doubt one of the most important things in my life. I love good music, it’s with me everywhere I go. Honestly, I came up with the idea while studying electric bikes and realized how all the manufacturers are treating the battery as an unwanted accessory. From a design perspective, that is. To me, the battery, as a source of energy, represented the heart of the bike, which deserved to be put on display. I found an ideal spot on top of the bike frame, where you can usually find a gasoline tank on motorcycles.

Once I made the battery the centerpiece of the frame, I started to wonder what other functionalities this tool could provide. I quickly came up with the idea of installing two speakers to which you can connect your smart phone and listen to music. Until then, I used headphones, which seriously limit your awareness around you and can be outright dangerous. That’s also the reason why many countries have banned them while biking. And that’s how our Boombox came to life.

Although some beg to differ, I feel that listening to music while riding is one of the best experiences ever! Music adds a whole new dimension to bike traveling and renders it even more beautiful. One of our test riders said it best after he came back from his test ride. With a big smile on his face, he said: »I felt like I was in a movie!«

Noordung bike and music are two components of one great idea, that’s why we called it: Superbicycle for music lovers.

Although the Boombox is not your only association with music. You’ve recently formed your own music group, haven’t you?

You are correct. Along with a torrent of creative individuals, a few outstanding, academically trained musicians joined our movement. As a music group, they will independently create original music. We have just recorded our first single titled »Traveling Light« and made a wonderful video that pictures the joys of riding a bike and the beautiful nature of Slovenia – a country where we come from and which we love. Traveling Light is the first song from the coming album »Joy in Journey«. We are currently working on the second song which will be punchier and will take place in an urban setting.

The female vocalist in the group is your wife, Eva Hren, who you say is the inspiration behind this whole project?

Eva is an academically trained musician in jazz singing and classical guitar. She is one of the leading jazz and ethnic music performers in Slovenia. Life with her is an incredible journey and I am very grateful that she brought so much music to my life, home and family. Eva has a very broad taste in music and she has introduced me to its many different facets.

The most fascinating uniqueness of music is how it touches you emotionally; good music goes straight to the heart and, as we say, touches your soul. In this respect, it is similar to outstanding design that transcends the functional appeal of a product and opens up so many other levels. It can calm you down. It can encourage your curiosity. It can awake yearning, love, sadness, joy. It can break with the status quo and start a revolution!

Noordung band is an experiment where we want to introduce the creation of music to the process of creating a bike, connect the creative energies and broadcast our values to the general public, even through the means of music – from joy in journey to respecting our environment.

Let’s go back to the bike. Music isn’t its only outstanding feature?

Our most revolutionary innovation is that we added a particulate matter sensor into the Boombox, which measures the presence of harmful particles P2.5 and P10 in the air while the bike is in use. The sensor connects to a smartphone and shows the biker real time information on the air quality along his route. Hence it’s giving the biker the means and motivation to find the cleanest route possible.

I’m excited by the thought what our innovation might bring to urban areas by crowd-sourcing and mapping of this data. The official measuring stations in cities are fixed which means they can only provide accurate information for the micro location where they’re placed. Once we have these sensors on bikes, which are mobile and are usually ridden where pedestrians move, we can get a much more accurate and dispersed map of air quality on locations most frequented by people. In other words, with our solution we might actually get an accurate picture of how polluted urban centers and bike paths actually are. In addition, we’re also increasing the awareness of pollution levels and we encourage people to start thinking more green. Environmental responsibility is one of the core values of Noordung and we intend to build on it even further.

Design also seems to be a special value at Noordung...

When we created Noordung, we’ve set ourselves a goal to create “the most beautiful urban bike in the world”. It sounded like a pretentious goal, one that perfectly fits into the category of the usual overhyped startup promises. Nevertheless, I really do think that we came close. Based on the responses we’re getting from everyone who see it, there’s not a person that’s left cold after they set their eyes on Noordung. I am a strong fan of Scandinavian, minimalist design, where every line has its place, where functionality and beauty are seamlessly intertwined. Noordung’s design is obviously inspired by the café racer culture and classic cruiser bikes. However, I believe that we managed to pay tribute to this tradition while also infusing some contemporary and high-tech spirit into it.

Aleksander Praper, an exceptional industrial designer, has been a part of this project from its very inception and is also one of the partners in the company. He created this breathtaking carbon frame, with its subliminal curves that is a work of art on its own. Alekdander compares these lines to a female body as a representation of organic perfection of proportions and curves.

But your background is in digital production, how did you end up in industrial design?

I love making digital products; It’s a game of interactions, storytelling at the content, design and technology levels. I have to admit that the whole ephemeral nature of digital products was causing me quite some frustration. Things change so fast that the technology and the user interface get replaced ever quicker, effectively making your product to history.

I come from a family of architects, A good building lasts 100 years or longer, outstanding architecture can remain relevant practically forever. I wanted to build something that will stand the test of time.

I wouldn’t be so bold at this point and say that the design of our bike will last forever but it does seem to me that it’s a worthwhile goal to strive to.

Are there any essential differences between creating digital and physical products?

Endless. Someone once told me that industrial design is great, the only thing that’s missing is the undo button. That’s probably the most obvious difference between a digital and a physical product. The iterations in the digital world are a lot less painful, both from a financial and time perspectives.

I learned this the hard way. At the same time, I feel that this so called “digital background” gave me a unique, fresh and less constrained view of the biking industry, which I sometimes find dull and unimaginative, especially in the field of urban bikes.

Where does your study of philosophy fit in?

There’s a branch of philosophy called ontology. Ontology is the philosophical study of being. Why something is rather than isn’t. It’s a deductive philosophical method, it explores the essence of things, events, phenomena. To me, this always seemed similar to design; to find that minimum that makes something something. In this respect, we at Noordung are looking for the essence of a bike, the essence of cycling. Which we find in joy in journey.

Let’s go back to music, before we finish. You said that it’s an important part of your life. What are you listening to lately?

It may be slightly atypical for my general taste in music, but I recently stumbled upon a jazz standard “Every Time We Say Goodbye” by Chet Baker. It’s a 7 minute masterpiece of a beautiful melancholic emotion that we feel when we’re saying our goodbyes. I’m fascinated how people used to be able to take their time for good melodies, which is practically impossible in this day and age.

But one of the most important lessons I learned while building the story of Noordung, is that for true pleasure, it’s always important and worth it to take your time. And that getting there will take its time too.

His book is one of the fundamental works on early space exploration.

His nickname, of which the origin is not completely clear, is supposedly a combination of two german words “No” and “Ordnung”(”No order”). We used it as an inspiration to create our bicycle. We wanted to explore cycling beyond traditional perceptions and practices. We tried to discover the very essence of cycling and have found it in one simple pleasure. The joy in journey.

We thought of our past. The time when we were still children. We thought of our first encounter with a bicycle. Until that point in time, nothing was able to make us feel as free and independent as a bicycle. We remembered the smell of fresh grass, the forests, the vast fields that we were breathing in while exploring kilometers and kilometers of uncharted territories.

Noordung is based on the café racer culture and tradition. Our goal was to create a modern day version of the cult cruiser bike and upgrade it to a smart high tech machine. The result is this unique bike that reinvents the cycling experience and takes you on the ride of your life.
 
Interview with Founder

 
"For true pleasure, it’s always important and worth it to take your time."
 
Gregor Fras is a philosopher who has been immersed in design his entire life. For over twenty years, he creates digital stories in the roles of either a creative, architect or designer of user experiences and user interfaces for some of the most challenging digital products. He is the founder of one of the first digital agencies in Slovenia and recipient of multiple design awards. A happily married father of two sons let us inside his mind and shared his views on cycling, music, life, its pleasures and of course – Noordung.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
How did it all begin? Where did you get the idea to create Noordung?
At some point in my life, I rented a design studio that was at an ideal biking distance from my home. The only bike I had until then was a mountain bike, but never a city bike, hence I bought myself one. Just a plain ordinary city bike. Despite my general enthusiasm, something was bothering me. The bike I rode to work every day, was essentially a product based on a century old technology. I am a huge technology freak, so one day I told myself: »Let’s see what a modern city bike looks like.« So I started googling and ...
...and you got thousands of hits?
No, that’s the point. The more I researched, the more I started to realize that it’s impossible to find a bike that I would actually like. Simply put, I couldn’t find a bike that was both beautiful by design and high-tech. There were tons of high-tech recreational bikes, both road and mountain, but city bikes looked and felt mostly identical to the ones from one hundred years ago.
And that pushed you into starting this company?
Not immediately. At first, when I was still being reasonable, I only wanted to build a custom bike for myself. But as I was delving deeper and deeper into creating my »perfect bike«, I started to realize that the whole process is becoming way too complicated to be only treated as a »side project«, so 3 years ago, I decided to start a company and invested some of my own money in it. I quickly got a few friends on board, who started helping me developing (now) our product. I joke that I probably came up with the most convoluted excuse to persuade my wife that I need an expensive bike.
Is Noordung an electric bike?
Noordung is a family of four bike models. The first two models – Noordung Pure and Noordung Music – are classic, non-electric, bikes with spoked rims and seven gears. They are built around Noordung carbon frame which is ready for any potential upgrades in the future. Noordung is the lightest cruiser bike in the world, thus offering you swift and effortless movement around the urban jungles. Noordung Music is the entry point into our beautiful new world of combining music with cycling, as it comes with the Noordung Boombox, that plays music from your smartphone.
The top two models from the Noordung family are Noordung Voyager and Noordung Individual, which are electric bikes with a maximum speed of 25 km/h as per EU regulation. Electric bikes are definitely the next big thing in the biking industry, especially in the segment of city bikes where, in contrast to recreational bikes, sweating is an unwanted side effect of its use (riding to work, meetings, etc.)
What I find even more appealing is that Noordung is also – a traditional bike. In my opinion, the biggest drawback of urban electric bikes is their weight, which renders them practically useless once the battery runs out, or when the rider just wants to – ride. That’s why we at Noordung tried to build as light a bike as possible, therefore we chose to build the frame out of carbon fiber. By the way, Noordung is the only cruiser bike in the world with a carbon fiber frame! In this respect, we wanted to build an ideal hybrid bike, where human effort may or may not be joined by electric assistance. It depends. While riding to a meeting, electric assistance can help us arrive there sweat free. On the other hand, we may want to sweat out some of the stress while riding home from work, so we can afford to refrain from using electric assistance.
After numerous test kilometers, I realized that I only use electric assistance about half of the time. During the other half, I really like to feel my legs being more active. One of the core values of Noordung is to encourage its clients to lead and promote a healthy lifestyle.

Electric drive seems to be ubiquitous in urban cycling, but music is definitely something new. How did music come into the picture?
Music is without a doubt one of the most important things in my life. I love good music, it’s with me everywhere I go. Honestly, I came up with the idea while studying electric bikes and realized how all the manufacturers are treating the battery as an unwanted accessory. From a design perspective, that is. To me, the battery, as a source of energy, represented the heart of the bike, which deserved to be put on display. I found an ideal spot on top of the bike frame, where you can usually find a gasoline tank on motorcycles.
Once I made the battery the centerpiece of the frame, I started to wonder what other functionalities this tool could provide. I quickly came up with the idea of installing two speakers to which you can connect your smart phone and listen to music. Until then, I used headphones, which seriously limit your awareness around you and can be outright dangerous. That’s also the reason why many countries have banned them while biking. And that’s how our Boombox came to life.
Although some beg to differ, I feel that listening to music while riding is one of the best experiences ever! Music adds a whole new dimension to bike traveling and renders it even more beautiful. One of our test riders said it best after he came back from his test ride. With a big smile on his face, he said: »I felt like I was in a movie!«
Noordung bike and music are two components of one great idea, that’s why we called it: Superbicycle for music lovers.
Although the Boombox is not your only association with music. You’ve recently formed your own music group, haven’t you?
You are correct. Along with a torrent of creative individuals, a few outstanding, academically trained musicians joined our movement. As a music group, they will independently create original music. We have just recorded our first single titled »Traveling Light« and made a wonderful video that pictures the joys of riding a bike and the beautiful nature of Slovenia – a country where we come from and which we love. Traveling Light is the first song from the coming album »Joy in Journey«. We are currently working on the second song which will be punchier and will take place in an urban setting.
The female vocalist in the group is your wife, Eva Hren, who you say is the inspiration behind this whole project?
Eva is an academically trained musician in jazz singing and classical guitar. She is one of the leading jazz and ethnic music performers in Slovenia. Life with her is an incredible journey and I am very grateful that she brought so much music to my life, home and family. Eva has a very broad taste in music and she has introduced me to its many different facets.
The most fascinating uniqueness of music is how it touches you emotionally; good music goes straight to the heart and, as we say, touches your soul. In this respect, it is similar to outstanding design that transcends the functional appeal of a product and opens up so many other levels. It can calm you down. It can encourage your curiosity. It can awake yearning, love, sadness, joy. It can break with the status quo and start a revolution!
Noordung band is an experiment where we want to introduce the creation of music to the process of creating a bike, connect the creative energies and broadcast our values to the general public, even through the means of music – from joy in journey to respecting our environment.

Let’s go back to the bike. Music isn’t its only outstanding feature?
Our most revolutionary innovation is that we added a particulate matter sensor into the Boombox, which measures the presence of harmful particles P2.5 and P10 in the air while the bike is in use. The sensor connects to a smartphone and shows the biker real time information on the air quality along his route. Hence it’s giving the biker the means and motivation to find the cleanest route possible.
I’m excited by the thought what our innovation might bring to urban areas by crowd-sourcing and mapping of this data. The official measuring stations in cities are fixed which means they can only provide accurate information for the micro location where they’re placed. Once we have these sensors on bikes, which are mobile and are usually ridden where pedestrians move, we can get a much more accurate and dispersed map of air quality on locations most frequented by people. In other words, with our solution we might actually get an accurate picture of how polluted urban centers and bike paths actually are. In addition, we’re also increasing the awareness of pollution levels and we encourage people to start thinking more green. Environmental responsibility is one of the core values of Noordung and we intend to build on it even further.
Design also seems to be a special value at Noordung...
When we created Noordung, we’ve set ourselves a goal to create “the most beautiful urban bike in the world”. It sounded like a pretentious goal, one that perfectly fits into the category of the usual overhyped startup promises. Nevertheless, I really do think that we came close. Based on the responses we’re getting from everyone who see it, there’s not a person that’s left cold after they set their eyes on Noordung. I am a strong fan of Scandinavian, minimalist design, where every line has its place, where functionality and beauty are seamlessly intertwined. Noordung’s design is obviously inspired by the café racer culture and classic cruiser bikes. However, I believe that we managed to pay tribute to this tradition while also infusing some contemporary and high-tech spirit into it.
Aleksander Praper, an exceptional industrial designer, has been a part of this project from its very inception and is also one of the partners in the company. He created this breathtaking carbon frame, with its subliminal curves that is a work of art on its own. Alekdander compares these lines to a female body as a representation of organic perfection of proportions and curves.
But your background is in digital production, how did you end up in industrial design?
I love making digital products; It’s a game of interactions, storytelling at the content, design and technology levels. I have to admit that the whole ephemeral nature of digital products was causing me quite some frustration. Things change so fast that the technology and the user interface get replaced ever quicker, effectively making your product to history.
I come from a family of architects, A good building lasts 100 years or longer, outstanding architecture can remain relevant practically forever. I wanted to build something that will stand the test of time.
I wouldn’t be so bold at this point and say that the design of our bike will last forever but it does seem to me that it’s a worthwhile goal to strive to.

Are there any essential differences between creating digital and physical products?
Endless. Someone once told me that industrial design is great, the only thing that’s missing is the undo button. That’s probably the most obvious difference between a digital and a physical product. The iterations in the digital world are a lot less painful, both from a financial and time perspectives.
I learned this the hard way. At the same time, I feel that this so called “digital background” gave me a unique, fresh and less constrained view of the biking industry, which I sometimes find dull and unimaginative, especially in the field of urban bikes.
Where does your study of philosophy fit in?
There’s a branch of philosophy called ontology. Ontology is the philosophical study of being. Why something is rather than isn’t. It’s a deductive philosophical method, it explores the essence of things, events, phenomena. To me, this always seemed similar to design; to find that minimum that makes something something. In this respect, we at Noordung are looking for the essence of a bike, the essence of cycling. Which we find in joy in journey.
Let’s go back to music, before we finish. You said that it’s an important part of your life. What are you listening to lately?
It may be slightly atypical for my general taste in music, but I recently stumbled upon a jazz standard “Every Time We Say Goodbye” by Chet Baker. It’s a 7 minute masterpiece of a beautiful melancholic emotion that we feel when we’re saying our goodbyes. I’m fascinated how people used to be able to take their time for good melodies, which is practically impossible in this day and age.
But one of the most important lessons I learned while building the story of Noordung, is that for true pleasure, it’s always important and worth it to take your time. And that getting there will take its time too.

story:
THE WHAT

My name is John Heiland. I am an Arizona native and undergraduate student at Loyola Marymount University in Los Angeles. As many of you know, I am the proud owner of an iconic 1971 Volkswagen bus, known to some as "Roxanne," "Monkey Business," and "The Frat-Wagon."  This 43 year old slice of Americana came into my life in 2012.  I worked two full-time summer jobs that year, and added my entire life savings and then some to call her mine.

Since then, this fine piece of precision German engineering served faithfully as my trusty steed. I give her more time, love, and care than I should admit to and is probably the reason why things don't always work out with me and girlfriends. But at the end of the day, good ol' Roxanne got me from point A to point B in style…not very fast, but in style.

In our cherished time together, Roxanne has taught me many life lessons. After living most of my young adult life according to the words of Ricky Bobby who once said "I wanna go fast," I learned that life in the slow lane isn't half bad. I learned to appreciate the gas station conversations about buses in the good old days with every washed up hippy west of the Mississippi. I also learned that one simply cannot spell "Volkswagen" without "swag." If that doesn't shatter your entire universe, I don't know what will.

THE WHY

Just a few weeks ago, I was bumpin' some tunes and burnin' some rubber on the 405 northbound in the always beautiful OC when Roxie’s engine seized up, leaving me heartbroken and stranded on the side of one of California's busiest freeways.  Roxie was towed back to Loyola Marymount where she sat a few weeks while I was in utter despair. The experience was traumatic, and left me wondering if I would ever be able to feel joy again in this cold, cruel world.

Once the tears stopped and my $2,000 tax return was in my bank account, I had her towed to the trusted German Motor Works in Garden Grove, thinking I would have enough for the repair.  The autopsy revealed that Roxie’s oil pump had malfunctioned and stopped pumping this lubricated life-blood through the 4 cylinders of my bulletproof air-cooled motor.  The results were not pretty.  The engine had burnt to a crisp and was not salvageable in any way.  My worst nightmare had come true.

THE HOW MUCH

Greg, a master mechanic who hails from Deutschland (and who actually rebuilt this engine 15 years ago for the previous owner) delivered the bad news that it will cost a whopping $4,520.40 for a complete new motor build from the ground up (see invoice attached in image gallery). 

I have been assured Roxie is worth every penny from an investment perspective, but as a starving college student this type of money ain't exactly chump change. My tax return is probably money I should be saving for life after college when I can't find a job and need to subsist off of ramen noodles. However, I don't know how much longer I can stand to see Roxanne sit in a garage in pieces before I have the doctor pull the plug on her for good, so I intend to put this and everything else I can back into the bus.

In the next 2 weeks, with your help, I am hoping to raise $2,500 in order to supplement my funds and resurrect Roxie from the grave.  I know that money is tight and there are probably more gallant, world changing causes that you could donate to.  But if you've ever enjoyed a ride in my bus, ever want to enjoy a ride in my bus in the future, or simply want to continue to see the road graced by such an aesthetically pleasing piece of machinery, I will be forever indebted to whatever you can spare to help me get Roxanne back on the road and turning heads once again. I know crowd-funding for an old VW bus is a little crazy, but crazy is all I've got at this point.

Anything and everything helps!  Please check out my "perks" of giving section to see how you will be rewarded.  In all seriousness, thank you for your generosity from the bottom of my heart (and Roxie’s too!).

Sincerely,

John Heiland

story:
My Birthday Bike Wish

I have a dear friend -who loves being active - Running, hiking, yoga, tennis. It’s her outlet, her way to de-stress, her place of zen.  Earlier this year my friend was diagnosed with type 2-diabetes last year due to genetic pre-disposition.   In Type-2 Diabetics life expectancy is shortened by 15 years (according to the National Institute of Health).  Exercise can keep the ticking clock at bay, significantly.  So, for my dear friend, staying active is not just a matter of joy, it is a matter of life and death.

Sadly, last month my friend hurt her knee - in a way that she she will no longer do a lot of the active things that she loves. But... she can bike.

My friend is shy about her condition, and she doesn't want too many people to know about it.   That's why you won't see any pictures, videos, or even her name up here. Also I want this to be a surprise, so I am keeping her identity anonymous. I hope you will understand.

I'd like my dear friend to be on this planet for as many years as possible.  For my birthday wish - I'd like to buy her a bike.

 

What We Need 

I've set the fundraising goal to $3000 to buy my friend a good quality bike that she can travel long distances on, which she can race if she gets into it (which she probably will as she's super-competitive), and which will last her for years.  The more miles/years she can bike the healthier she can be.  The top recommended bikes (according to the internets) run at least $3000, so I've set the goal here.  Hopefully this is a realistic goal that we can meet.   

The bike that I buy will depend on the amount of money raised. If we reach our goal, then the plan is to purchase and present my friend with a carbon/racing style bike and a helmet (again, to keep her on the planet longer).  Any and all money that is raised that exceeds the purchase price of the bike will be donated to a non-profit that helps urban youth build/own bikes.   

 

What You Get

1- Smiles! Hugs!  More Smiles!

2 - I've been doing a fair amount of cooking lately - so - as you'll see on the right you have options to get some home-cooked goodies mailed or hand-delivered to you.

3 - Finally, if you are able to give a more significant amount - you'll get this nifty "bike!" t-shirt, in your size and in a color of your choosing. (if the images don't show up below you can view them in the gallery section of this campaign).

 

 

The Impact

This is my 30th birthday (oh dear me I'm old!).  If 100 people can contribute $30 each we can reach our goal.

So that is my birthday bike wish - to see my friend's smile in my life for as many years as possible.     

 

Everything Helps

I know donating money is hard - and I completely understand if you are not in a place to do so right now.  If you can't donate, but know other people who might be able to help out, please pass my birthday wish along.

story:
We created this mobile vehicle marketing tool when we realized the ugly orange and black for sale sign had run it's course.  There has got to be a more informative and professional way to market your vehicle.  We call it CellARide!

The top 5 questions we asked ourselves...

1. What the hell does the tiny handwriting say in the white space? Stop trying to cram a novel in the white space!

2. What does the CARFAX report say? Well... Not only does CellARide "show you the CARFAX", we actually coerced the founder of CARFAX to join our company. 

3. I have absolutely no idea what questions I need to ask when calling a stranger about their vehicle? Awkward! CellARide provides the information without the awkward conversation.

4. What is the good, the bad and the ugly about your vehicle? We're from Missouri! Don't just tell me, SHOW ME the good, bad and ugly with photos and video.

5. Okay, I have a sign in my window, but I have no idea who is looking at it? We got you covered.  Every time a potential buyer inquires about your vehicle, you can receive an email or text with their cell phone number.

Below is a really cool video that shows the 3 steps to start selling your ride with CellARide.


We have HUGE plans to make CellARide the "Go-To" when selling your vehicle. We have a great team of developers and key industry advisers to make CellARide a reality, but we are just now entering the beta phase and our biggest challenge is creating the needed buzz and funding to finish developing, testing and rolling it out on a mass scale.  

With your backing and more importantly your voice, we believe it is possible to meet our goal and become the standard when selling your car, truck, boat, scooter, motorcycle, or RIDE of any kind.

story:
Dear Friends,


The Turlock Certified Farmers Market is in need of a Storage Trailer. We have been expanding and growing since we re-opened six seasons ago. We are looking forward to a wonderful 6th season full of great community, local produce and products, and events. Due to our new day and location (Main & Center) we are facing a bit of hardship storing our essentials. These are items we all enjoy while we are at the market: tables, chairs and umbrellas where we can sit to eat yummy food or just rest our feet after shopping. We also need a place to store our Road Closure signs. The market must store these items year round, and a trailer would solve this issue. We have been utilizing temporary storage during the off-season, but desperately need a permanent solution. Also, autility trailer like the one shown, would make a huge difference when it comes to setting up and breaking down the market each week. We are reaching out to the community to raise the funds for a storage trailer and any help would be greatly appreciated. Donations are tax-deductable, and you would have the knowledge that you helped to make the Turlock Certified Farmers Market sustainable for the future.  If you cannot donate, perhaps you could help by sharing this campaign.

Thank you so much!

Due to our new day and location (Main & Center) we are facing a bit of hardship storing our essentials. These are items we all enjoy while we are at the market: tables, chairs and umbrellas where we can sit to eat yummy food or just rest our feet after shopping. We also need a place to store our Road Closure signs. The market must store these items year round, and a trailer would solve this issue. We have been utilizing temporary storage during the off-season, but desperately need a permanent solution. Also, autility trailer like the one shown, would make a huge difference when it comes to setting up and breaking down the market each week. We are reaching out to the community to raise the funds for a storage trailer and any help would be greatly appreciated. Donations are tax-deductable, and you would have the knowledge that you helped to make the Turlock Certified Farmers Market sustainable for the future.  If you cannot donate, perhaps you could help by sharing this campaign.Thank you so much!

story:
PODIUM PRO SUMMARY

We appreciate you taking the time to check out our project! 

Background: I'm Sean Evangelista, active duty Navy guy, married for 19yrs to the same awesome wife, father of 2 teenagers and dog owner! Our friend  Steve Swisher, from essentialchurch here in Virginia Beach and I have been working on this project for several months and are 3/4 finished.  We started development on this with my personal savings and are looking for a little help to get this great product into the hands of students, pastors, public speakers and startups that need to practice their pitches. Here is what were building. We added some pretty sweet NEW PERKS as well! Thanks for your time! 

Here is what we are building:

  • Document creation and last minute editing

  • Dropbox sync

  • Color timer bar and clock

  • Keynote and PowerPoint slide control

  • Present mode to hide menus and keyboard

SHARE THIS WITH OTHER GREAT PEOPLE! IT MIGHT GET YOU A LIMITED EDITION STARTUP SWAG T-SHIRT!

story: I'm happily married Oregon farmer with 2 children and a huge Tampa Bay Buccaneers fan. I have been wanting to go to Tampa for a long time. Stumbled on to the Bucs Uncensored podcast recently and realized I wasn't alone in my fandom. When Justin the Commish announced he was going to be throwing a draft party in April I was STOKED!!! I thought "how awesome would be to be able to go?". I can't afford to make the trip though. I'm no charity case but I'm not rich either. After talking to Lou I thought "hey, I could start a crowdfunding campaign" and see if my fellow Buc fans from the podcast would be willing to contribute to my cause. So here it is I'm giving it a shot. What will be will be. I do hope to meet you all very soon. God Bless.

story:
Friends, Family, People of the Internet...

This is a story of joy, sadness, and with your help, redemption!

The Joy:

As some of you know I am officially a bike commuter.  I have been riding my bike to and from work daily for some time now.  I do share a car with my lovely girlfriend Sam, but we work in different locations, do things on different schedules, so two modes of transportation only seems right. So for Christmas this year Sam surprised me with a bike and I haven't gotten off since.  Riding my bike keeps me healthy, happy, and where I need to be.  I couldn't explain the feeling I have when riding my bike, but its somewhere between the greatest feeling you could ever have and some feeling slightly greater than that.

The Sadness:

Sadly last night someone stole that joy.  Yes my bicycle was stolen right off of my friends porch while we were inside.  Tragedy. When I walked outside to hop on my bike and I saw it was not where I placed it my heart sank. I felt angry that this would happen, I felt sad that my joy had been taken from me like it was just a toy.  I also felt terrible because I know this bike not only brought me joy, but I could tell how happy it made Sam that she got me a Christmas gift that I literaly use every single day. She was as proud of that bike as I was. I know first question, yes it was locked. Second question, yes I have attempted to file a police report, but APD has there hands tied up with people shooting and whatnot.  So...

The Redemption:

I have started this campaign to help raise funds for a new bike! I'm sure everyone can understand unexpected nature of crime and I hope you can both empathize and support me in this! I will be using the funds to purchase a new bike (Not sure if you all have tried buying a bicycle lately, but a quality bike that gets daily use sure ain't cheap) as well as top notch securtiy for the bike.  I have a few bike models in mind, as well as new chains/u-locks, but if you all have any sugguestions to pair with your donations I will surely take heed.

 

Thank You for your help it is greatly appreciated!

Quinn
