story:
FLAUNT offers over 20 features and two different models, Vicko & Atticus.

                             

How is FLAUNT different from other eBikes on the market? 
For starters, we have one of the best & safest stock batteries in our class, a 36 Volt 15.6 Amp Samsung Lithium Battery pack, that allows you to get over 560 true Watt Hours!  Also, our eBikes look, sound, and feel like normal bicycles. 
FLAUNT Electric Bicycles ride very smooth, without vibrations, and are super silent.Our eBikes offer 6 different levels of pedal assist, and you don’t have to fumble around with buttons or change settings to switch from pedal assist to throttle. On our eBikes, you can switch seamlessly between the two!  
We offer a powerful 500 Watt (geared) Motor.  Geared motors are great for hills, and allow us to incorporate a free-wheel within the motor, so when you pedal, there’s no resistance from the motor like on an electric bike with a direct drive motor.  
Our eBikes also come with integrated headlights, tail, and brake lights.  FLAUNT’s beautiful LCD Display is one of the best looking and most functional displays on the market today….it also lights up! 



                                                          
              COLORS: Matte Blue, Matte Gray, Matte Red, Matte Black
                                                            Order Atticus here. 


                      COLORS: Matte Aqua, Matte Black, Glossy White                                                                             Order Vicko here.




How long does the battery stay charged?

This is different for every ride, and rider.  Your FLAUNT Electric Bicycle boasts a larger battery than most, and therefore you can achieve higher range than most eBikes on the market today.  For a 160lb rider, on flat ground, you should be able to reach 40+ miles without needing a recharge.  Variables that can affect these results are: wind, terrain, hills, weight of rider, pedal power. Extra Battery Charger and Extra Battery available for purchase.



 

What is Walk Assist?

Walk Assist is a function that we have implemented to help people walk their eBikes should they ever want, or need to.  This feature is most beneficial when trying to walk your eBike up a steep hill, or through rough terrain. Simply turn on your FLAUNT Electric Bicycle, and then press the [ + ] on the thumb controller for 5 seconds. Your eBike will enter into “Walk Assist” mode, and begin to travel at 5mph, so all you have to do is hold on!


 

Are headlights and rear lights included when I purchase the eBike?

Yes. When the eBike is powered on, the brake light will illuminate when the brake lever is squeezed, notifying people and cars behind you, that you are slowing down.  When the bike is powered on, one tap of the power button on the thumb controller will illuminate the Front Headlight, the Rear Brake Light, as well as the LCD Display.







What is Advanced Sine Wave Technology?

Sine Wave Technology, utilized in Sine Wave Controllers (like the controllers on FLAUNT Electric Bicycles), exhibit a more smooth and rounded signal than a “Square Wave Controller” (like found on electric bikes with direct drive motors).  Square Wave Controllers send their signal more abruptly, similar to an on-off switch, where as a Sine Wave Controller is a smoother transition of the electric signals, providing for a much quieter ride!   



 






                         
                                "I really loved it, it was so easy and fast!" 

                               "I got it up to 25mph no problem... LOVE IT!"


"It was very easy to use... I've never been on an electric bike, but now I want one."


                                        "The pedal assist...insane!"  


             "It goes as fast as I drive (in Los Angeles)... I'll save on gas!"



When we first started out, we had a business connection to an electric vehicle supplier overseas and worked with them around the clock on creating a sample product. Once we imported these sample products and tested them, we realized that our supplier was not making the best quality products. If we were going to build a business, and be proud to put our name behind our products, we would have to scrap our personal connection and start all over.  So we did just that and found new suppliers that helped us create a product that sets the bar in the market.

Although it may have been very stressful at times, we are happy that we had to overcome so many obstacles, because it has allowed us to take the necessary steps, and time, to create some of the best (and safest) electric bicycles on the market today.  We are very proud of our products, and we are looking forward to continuing our hard work. We realize that obstacles appear every day for other companies, and we are certainly not immune to that.  At FLAUNT Electric Vehicles we believe it is how you overcome these obstacles, learn and grow from them, to make yourself, your employees, your company, and your products the best that you possibly can.  This is an everyday cycle, that we signed up for, and we welcome it with open arms.

Sincerely,
Kevin Mount
Co-Founder & Chief Operating Officer
FLAUNT Electric Vehicles, Inc.

                                                         Order Atticus here. 

                                                   Order Vicko here.

                                                           
                                                    

Kevin Mount
Co-founder & COO of FLAUNT Electric Vehicles 

Kevin grew up surfing and spending many days and nights on the beach. Because of that, caring about the environment was a natural extension of the lifestyle -- and when he looked into starting a company of his own, eco-friendly transportation made absolute sense. Bringing together his love of innovation, his eco-first philosophy, and more than 10 years of strong sales management experience at companies like JM Eagle, ISCO Industries, and Tradepro, Inc., FLAUNT was born. Kevin steered FLAUNT to exceed industry standards: 3rd-party safety testing, highest levels of customer service, better battery quality, an internal service center, and more. In addition, he is personally certified to train people in becoming Light Electric Vehicle Technicians. FLAUNT is the accumulation of his passions, and he continues to lead them in striving for the evolution of eco-friendly technologies.

                                             

                                                    

Todd Hilton
Technical Director at FLAUNT Electric Vehicles

Technical Director at Flaunt grew up in the Central Florida area with a love for the outdoors and a mechanical mind, the eBike industry is a great fit. With a 20 year background in metal fabrication and knowledge of mechanical and electrical components, and is also trained by LEVA. 


                                         
                              

Can I ride my eBike like a regular bicycle if I choose to?

Of course, actually there are a couple of ways to do this.  The easiest way would be to keep the eBike powered off, hop on, and pedal away!  However, if you’d like to have the power on, maybe for the lights, simply press the [-] button on the thumb controller, until the pedal assist level reads “0” (zero) on the LCD Display

Can I go off-road with my eBike and use it for outdoor recreation?

Yes, of course.  Our eBikes are made for the every day rider, so light off road trails are not a problem. Just don’t attempt any cliff jumps, we do not advise that!

-Are there add-ons for purchase (ie. accessories, extra batteries, helmets, etc)?

Yes, please view the perks listed here on our Indiegogo page:

-Extra Battery Charger
-Extra Battery

Can I return my eBike during the campaign?

You can return your eBike during the campaign if the box is unopened. There
will be a 15% restocking fee + must pay for the return shipping cost.

Can't contribute today? All good. FLAUNT it far & wide by sharing it with your friends on social media. Word of mouth is just as helpful!
story_txt:
FLAUNT offers over 20 features and two different models, Vicko & Atticus.



                             



How is FLAUNT different from other eBikes on the market? 
For starters, we have one of the best & safest stock batteries in our class, a 36 Volt 15.6 Amp Samsung Lithium Battery pack, that allows you to get over 560 true Watt Hours!  Also, our eBikes look, sound, and feel like normal bicycles. 

FLAUNT Electric Bicycles ride very smooth, without vibrations, and are super silent.Our eBikes offer 6 different levels of pedal assist, and you don’t have to fumble around with buttons or change settings to switch from pedal assist to throttle. On our eBikes, you can switch seamlessly between the two!  
We offer a powerful 500 Watt (geared) Motor.  Geared motors are great for hills, and allow us to incorporate a free-wheel within the motor, so when you pedal, there’s no resistance from the motor like on an electric bike with a direct drive motor.  
Our eBikes also come with integrated headlights, tail, and brake lights.  FLAUNT’s beautiful LCD Display is one of the best looking and most functional displays on the market today….it also lights up! 


                                                                        COLORS: Matte Blue, Matte Gray, Matte Red, Matte Black                                                             Order Atticus here. 



                      COLORS: Matte Aqua, Matte Black, Glossy White                                                                             Order Vicko here.





How long does the battery stay charged?
This is different for every ride, and rider.  Your FLAUNT Electric Bicycle boasts a larger battery than most, and therefore you can achieve higher range than most eBikes on the market today.  For a 160lb rider, on flat ground, you should be able to reach 40+ miles without needing a recharge.  Variables that can affect these results are: wind, terrain, hills, weight of rider, pedal power. Extra Battery Charger and Extra Battery available for purchase.
 
What is Walk Assist?
Walk Assist is a function that we have implemented to help people walk their eBikes should they ever want, or need to.  This feature is most beneficial when trying to walk your eBike up a steep hill, or through rough terrain. Simply turn on your FLAUNT Electric Bicycle, and then press the [ + ] on the thumb controller for 5 seconds. Your eBike will enter into “Walk Assist” mode, and begin to travel at 5mph, so all you have to do is hold on!


  
Are headlights and rear lights included when I purchase the eBike?
Yes. When the eBike is powered on, the brake light will illuminate when the brake lever is squeezed, notifying people and cars behind you, that you are slowing down.  When the bike is powered on, one tap of the power button on the thumb controller will illuminate the Front Headlight, the Rear Brake Light, as well as the LCD Display.

 



 


What is Advanced Sine Wave Technology?
Sine Wave Technology, utilized in Sine Wave Controllers (like the controllers on FLAUNT Electric Bicycles), exhibit a more smooth and rounded signal than a “Square Wave Controller” (like found on electric bikes with direct drive motors).  Square Wave Controllers send their signal more abruptly, similar to an on-off switch, where as a Sine Wave Controller is a smoother transition of the electric signals, providing for a much quieter ride!   

 

 









                                                          "I really loved it, it was so easy and fast!" 
                               "I got it up to 25mph no problem... LOVE IT!"
"It was very easy to use... I've never been on an electric bike, but now I want one."

                                        "The pedal assist...insane!"  

             "It goes as fast as I drive (in Los Angeles)... I'll save on gas!"



    

 




    
  When we first started out, we had a business connection to an electric vehicle supplier overseas and worked with them around the clock on creating a sample product. Once we imported these sample products and tested them, we realized that our supplier was not making the best quality products. If we were going to build a business, and be proud to put our name behind our products, we would have to scrap our personal connection and start all over.  So we did just that and found new suppliers that helped us create a product that sets the bar in the market.Although it may have been very stressful at times, we are happy that we had to overcome so many obstacles, because it has allowed us to take the necessary steps, and time, to create some of the best (and safest) electric bicycles on the market today.  We are very proud of our products, and we are looking forward to continuing our hard work. We realize that obstacles appear every day for other companies, and we are certainly not immune to that.  At FLAUNT Electric Vehicles we believe it is how you overcome these obstacles, learn and grow from them, to make yourself, your employees, your company, and your products the best that you possibly can.  This is an everyday cycle, that we signed up for, and we welcome it with open arms.Sincerely,Kevin MountCo-Founder & Chief Operating OfficerFLAUNT Electric Vehicles, Inc.












                                                         Order Atticus here. 




                                                   Order Vicko here.



                                                                                                               
Kevin MountCo-founder & COO of FLAUNT Electric Vehicles 
Kevin grew up surfing and spending many days and nights on the beach. Because of that, caring about the environment was a natural extension of the lifestyle -- and when he looked into starting a company of his own, eco-friendly transportation made absolute sense. Bringing together his love of innovation, his eco-first philosophy, and more than 10 years of strong sales management experience at companies like JM Eagle, ISCO Industries, and Tradepro, Inc., FLAUNT was born. Kevin steered FLAUNT to exceed industry standards: 3rd-party safety testing, highest levels of customer service, better battery quality, an internal service center, and more. In addition, he is personally certified to train people in becoming Light Electric Vehicle Technicians. FLAUNT is the accumulation of his passions, and he continues to lead them in striving for the evolution of eco-friendly technologies.
                                             
                                                    
Todd HiltonTechnical Director at FLAUNT Electric Vehicles
Technical Director at Flaunt grew up in the Central Florida area with a love for the outdoors and a mechanical mind, the eBike industry is a great fit. With a 20 year background in metal fabrication and knowledge of mechanical and electrical components, and is also trained by LEVA.

Of course, actually
there are a couple of ways to do this. 
The easiest way would be to keep the eBike powered off, hop on, and
pedal away!  However, if you’d like to
have the power on, maybe for the lights, simply press the [-] button on the
thumb controller, until the pedal assist level reads “0” (zero) on the LCD
Display
Can
I go off-road with my eBike and use it for outdoor recreation?
Yes, of course.  Our eBikes are made for the every day rider,
so light off road trails are not a problem. Just don’t attempt any cliff jumps,
we do not advise that!

batteries, helmets, etc)?
Yes, please view the
perks listed here on our Indiegogo page:


-Extra Battery Charger-Extra Battery

story:
Who I am

My name is Jose Ramirez. I am a senior at Lighthouse Community Charter School in Oakland, California. I am fascinated by cars and how humans are finding different ways to make them more efficient. This year for my Senior Project, I am turning a gas pick-up truck into an electric truck.

What I've done so far:

Went to Santa Cruz on a Sunday to pick up an electric conversion kit (3 hours and for $2000)

Contacted over 20 people and looked at three cars before finding the white pick-up truck pictured ($725)

Went to the DMV to complete auto registration ($80)

Removed the engine, exhaust, and gas tank (8 hours)

Fundraising Needs

Now I am fundraising because we need more money to make this interest of mine a reality. We will need at least $15,000 to make our car work and to be presentable as my senior project as well as my Maker Faire project. In addition to the costs above, with the money we raise from contributors I will buy:

Batterypack - $5,000

Suspension parts (leaf springs) - $500

Metal (to build the structure to hold the battery) - $300

Additional tools (a welder and an engine hoist) - $500

Brakes - $150

Car repairs (paint, bodywork, broken door hinges, damaged seats) - $2,000

Adapter plate (connects the electric motor to the transmission) - $1,100

Charger - $2,000

Carport tent (for rainy days) - $200

Impact

If you help fund this project, you will make a huge impact on me. Your support will give me motivation and allow me to prove to myself that I can have a career in automotive industry and to prove to people that there are many opportunities in Oakland to help students succeed. You'll also help me prove the sterotypes about Oakland wrong -- many great people can come from where they're least expected. If I succeed in this project, I might start my own company for car conversions and help make our community more environmentally-friendly. 

If we raise more money than our goal, we will give the funds to the school's Robotics Class so that they can also think big like me and see their projects succeed. 

Thank you!

 

**Special thanks to mentor KO and Editor Zachary Shahan of CleanTechnica.org for this feature on my project! http://cleantechnica.com/2013/02/28/ev-conversion-project-for-high-schoolers-help-a-brother-out **

story:
“1bike2stories is a project that invites people to share their story on my tandem bicycle while raising funds for charity.”
Sharing stories to improve the world 

I will be cycling on a tandem bicycle through South East Asia, visit different charities and invite volunteers to share their story on my bicycle. On the road I will find out what items they need and set these as a goal to sponsor for. Read more about me and the project.

What is the goal?

The first goal is to collect money for the actual tandem bicycle and its transport to Asia. This allows me to literally ride the toward its goal and donate it to the Aidstemple in Lopburi province Thailand. At this temple they do great work to support people living with AIDS/HIV. I visited the temple in 2007 and was truly concerned about the fate of the people that were treated there at the time. AIDS is a widespread problem around South East Asia and unfortunately, many people get rejected by their families because of widespread ignorance about the disease and how to treat it. Dutch readers should consider reading the blog of Huub Beckers who is a frequent volunteer at the temple. His stories give great insights about the factual life inside the temple.

How can you help?

It is easy as easy as 1-2-3 for you to help me reaching the goal by making a donation. Besides the unbeatable feeling of contributing to a better world, you will also receive remarkable perks depending on the degree of your involvement! It's up to you to wander, run or ride with me!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to help me through a funding, you can still help me by spreading the word! You can connect through Twitter and Facebook.

story:
Meet the Riptide R1 Electric Skateboard.

Order Now on Our Website!

Massive Power on a Compact Deck

We took the power (and features) of a premium electric longboard and packed them into a conveniently-sized deck, that's perfect for travel. Welcome to Riptide.

Order now on our website!

What People Are Saying

 

"The R1 is fast out of the gate, with the maneuverability of a standard-size deck. So far, it's come closest to what I've been looking for on all fronts: size, price and power."- Engadget

"Say Hi to one of the best electric skateboards we've ever used." -TechnoBuffalo

On the Boosted hitting those railroad tracks is rough. This thing is super nimble... Taking this hill like a boss, no problem! - Press Reset

The brakes work really well. No jerkiness or grab to it. Its nice and smooth with strong braking power. - NYC EBoarding Club Member

 

How it Compares

The Riptide is the first board to pack the power and top speed of a premium board into a compact package. Thus, the specifications are closer to that of a $1299 board than to other affordable options.

View this graphic in full size on our website

See how the Riptide compares to the industry leading, $1299 Boosted Board

How it Works

Simply grab the wireless hand controller and roll your thumb forward to accelerate. Roll it downward to brake. Flip a switch to toggle between beginner and advanced modes. Tap a button to engage reverse functionality.

 

 

The R1 vs. the R1 Elite

Our product line includes two Models: The R1 and the R1 Elite.

Both boards come with <99Wh airline-friendly batteries. R1E wheels provided by ABEC11. R1E lights provided by Shredlights. Power is the peak power rating.

Both boards will recharge in approximately 3.5 hours. We also offer a fast charger that will recharge the battery in as little as 90 mins.

Order now on our website!

Use Cases

Built by Riders, for Riders

The Riptide was built by boarders with other boarders in mind. First timers will enjoy the board as well (likely in beginner mode) and individuals with past boarding experience (whether its surfing, snowboarding, skateboard, wakeboarding, etc) will appreciate the raw power right away, and will recognize how the nuances including the kicktail, wheel, and truck selection, really contribute to the ride quality.

 

Perfect for Students On Campus

The Riptide's high power and affordable price make it perfect for riding around campus, and its small size mean you can slide it under a desk without headache. 

 

Urban Commuting Just Got Easier

The Riptide's compact deck and handles make it easy bring on a train or to throw into the trunk of an Uber. The large, soft wheels make the board perfect for poor city pavement. And lastly, the inclusion of headlights and tail lights will help other drivers, pedestrians, and bicyclists see you at busy intersections at low light.

 

Traveling? Bring your Riptide

The Riptide comes with a precisely engineered battery capacity that is within the range of TSA guidelines. Once you're past security the small size and handles make the R1 a breeze to transport through the terminal or to check into the overhead compartment.

 

The Perfect Addition to Your Electric Skateboard Quiver

Everyone who rides an electric skateboard knows it more fun to ride with friends (or your wife / husband / kid / grandma / etc). With a Riptide as your second board now you've got something they can ride at a competitive price that can actually keep up with more premium boards.

Order now on our website!

 

Features

A Serious Drive Train 

The R1's 1800W dual belt drive train means it can scream off the line up to the top speed of 20 mph and power up hills unlike any other board its size.

 

Unrivaled Portability

At only 13 lbs with a 31" deck, dual handles, and an airline-friendly, and <99Wh battery, you can easily bring the R1 wherever your travels take you.

 

Premium Longboard Components

With the R1 our goal was a fast, fun ride while maintaining portability and we didn't mind adding a pound or two getting there. Thus the board has 245mm wide trucks and comes with the large diameter, soft urethane wheels by ABEC 11, a top-of-the-line wheel manufacturer.

 

Ride for Miles and Miles

With up-to-an 8 miles of range in real world conditions and an optional fast charger that recharges the board in just 90 mins, you'll be able to park your car for the weekend and not touch it til Monday.

 

Ride All Night

Optional Headlights and Tail Lights provided by Shredlights can be set to "On," "Blink," or "High Beam," meaning you can ride all night and be seen by everyone around you.

 

Perks

Our campaign perks include two models of the Riptide R1 Electric Skateboard. Our base model - the R1 - packs major power into a compact package. Our premium model - the R1 Elite - offers increased speed and range while adding premium headlights / tail lights along with soft-riding ABEC 11 wheels.

The Riptide R1 Electric Skateboard

$599

Order now on our website.

Note: The R1 does not come with headlights, tail lights, or our ABEC 11 wheel upgrade.

The Riptide R1 Elite Electric Skateboard

$729 

Order now on our website!

The R1 Elite comes with ShredLights Head and Tail Lights, and 90mm ABEC 11 Flywheels.

Charge Time: 3.5 hrs (see Fast Charger below for 1.5 hr charging)

 

Fast Charger

$99

Both the Riptide and the Riptide R1 come with our standard, 3.5 hour charger. We also offer this "Fast Charger" that will recharge your board in as little as 90 mins. This is not an upgrade, this is a standalone charger. If you back for both a board and the Fast Charger, you will receive two chargers so you can leave one at home and one at work.

 

Manufacturing Timeline

Use of Funds

Battery Box Injection Molding

The Riptide has a custom battery box, designed and prototyped in California. Several rounds of design, 3D printing, and CNC were completed to ensure proper fitment of the battery and controller, gasket and grommet seals to keep water out, structural strength, heat dissipation, and ideal placement of power switch, charge port, and our custom battery meter.

The design is now complete. Some of your funds will go towards the plastic injection molds necessary to produce our battery box and lid in high volumes.

 

Battery Certification

The R1's battery uses UL-certified lithium ion cells in a 6S3P arrangement, with all standard safety protection plus cell balancing.  Running high-discharge cells in a 3P configuration gives the Riptide more amperage output capability than other boards on the market to handle heavy loads when it needs it.

The design is now finalized. Funds from our Indiegogo project will go towards certifications to verify that the board fits TSA and other guidelines for air travel, sea freight, etc.

 

Factory Minimums

The R1 will be produced by our partners in Shenzhen, CN. We considered several potential manufacturers and selected our partner through many rounds of sampling and after checking several references. Indiegogo funds will go towards hitting our factory minimums. 

 

 

Thank Yous

We're honored to be working with wheels from ABEC 11, one of the most respected wheel companies in the world. If you've ridden ABECs then you know that nothing else compares!

We want to give a special thanks to everyone who has ever supported Shredlights as those customers lent a lot of inspiration for Riptide. We would like to personally thank each and every one of you for believing in our products as much as we have and joining the movement. Whether you've bought a set, come to a group ride, or helped build a batch, we're forever grateful.

 

Thanks to the Lavin Entrepreneurship Center at SDSU for their support of Shredlights and Riptide.

 

Thanks to Tishawn and the NYC EBoarding Crew for leading an amazing ride. Can't wait to get back!

And finally, a thanks to the teams at Boosted, Evolve, Inboard, ZBoard, Enertion, Acton, Carvon, Arc, Koowheel, and many more for building this industry and to your customers that we've gotten the opportunity to meet and ride with.

 

Frequently Asked Questions

How much is shipping?

We offer free US shipping. International shipping depends on the country and will be calculated in the cart.

 

Do you ship Internationally?

To start we’ll be shipping to US, MX, Canda, Europe, Singapore, and Australia. We'll be expanding this list as time goes on. If you are interested in a Riptide R1 and your country is not on this list please sign up for this newsletter and we'll let you know when we begin shipping to your country.

 

What features does the Riptide's hand controller have?

  • Two Rider Modes - Beginner and Advanced - are selectable on-the-fly
  • Reverse with Smart Activation
  • Regenerative and Active Braking
  • Soft-start for smooth acceleration off the line
  • Low Battery ramp to reduce voltage sag, and low battery braking enabled

The remote is independently FCC certified, 16-channel (2402-2480 MHz) Bluetooth connected with auto-binding, and an effective range of 14 meters with no interference. 

The remote charges with the included micro-USB cable.

 

Can I take the Riptide on an airplane?

The Riptide comes with a 97Wh battery. Its UN-38.3 approved and airline friendly. We can’t guarantee it can go on any flight as every airline has their own rules, but the battery and board do fit in with the general TSA regulations to bring as a carry on.

 


What kind of battery does the Riptide have?

The current battery is 6S3P (21.6v nominal / 25.2v max, 4.5Ah total) lithium ion 18650 rated at 8C max continuous discharge.  BMS is currently 30A continuous / 60A peak, with all standard safety protection plus cell balancing.  Running high-discharge cells in a 3P configuration gives the Riptide enough amperage to handle heavy loads when it needs it.

 

What type of motors does the Riptide have?

The Riptide has dual belt drive motors with 1800 watts of peak power. These are brushless sensorless DC motors, similar to what you’d find on a DJI drone, but bigger. We picked belt drive over hub motors because our thesis with the Riptide is all about maximum performance in a small package, and belts drives allow for better torque delivery to maximize acceleration and hill climbing. It’s true that belts will wear down over time but it’s a quick 5 minute replacement and we felt that it was worth it. 

 

Is the Riptide waterproof?

The board is not waterproof. We’ve made a lot of design decisions to make it as water resistant as possible, though. You can ride through irrigation runoff or the occasional puddle, but we don’t recommend riding in wet conditions - not when it’s raining or right after it has rained - as you may damage the electronics and rust the bearings. Also it’s extremely dangerous to ride in conditions with reduced traction, both for your board AND because of the cars around you.

The battery box is fully sealed, and partitioned to seal battery compartment and motor controller compartments independently. We chose sensorless motors to further reduce susceptibility to water, and made many components easily serviceable for regular maintenance.

 

Does the Riptide have regenerative braking?

The Riptide employs multiple types of braking technologies that allow it to smoothly and quickly slow down and come to a complete stop.  This includes integrating both regenerative braking and active braking, similar to technolgies seen in the Mellow Drive and ZBoard.    

The Riptide also has variable braking strength, which means that you have more dynamic control over braking speed than an on-or-off pre-programmed braking curve used by some other brands.

And when the battery is fully depleted, braking is still possible.

 

What is the weight limit?

250 lbs.

 

If your question is not answered here, please reach out to us at info@rideriptide.com and we'll add it to the list.

See how the Riptide compares to the industry leading, $1299 Boosted Board

How it Works

Simply grab the wireless hand controller and roll your thumb forward to accelerate. Roll it downward to brake. Flip a switch to toggle between beginner and advanced modes. Tap a button to engage reverse functionality.
 

 

The R1 vs. the R1 Elite

Our product line includes two Models: The R1 and the R1 Elite.

Both boards come with <99Wh airline-friendly batteries. R1E wheels provided by ABEC11. R1E lights provided by Shredlights. Power is the peak power rating.
Both boards will recharge in approximately 3.5 hours. We also offer a fast charger that will recharge the battery in as little as 90 mins.
Order now on our website!

Use Cases

Built by Riders, for Riders
The Riptide was built by boarders with other boarders in mind. First timers will enjoy the board as well (likely in beginner mode) and individuals with past boarding experience (whether its surfing, snowboarding, skateboard, wakeboarding, etc) will appreciate the raw power right away, and will recognize how the nuances including the kicktail, wheel, and truck selection, really contribute to the ride quality.

 
Perfect for Students On Campus
The Riptide's high power and affordable price make it perfect for riding around campus, and its small size mean you can slide it under a desk without headache. 

 
Urban Commuting Just Got Easier
The Riptide's compact deck and handles make it easy bring on a train or to throw into the trunk of an Uber. The large, soft wheels make the board perfect for poor city pavement. And lastly, the inclusion of headlights and tail lights will help other drivers, pedestrians, and bicyclists see you at busy intersections at low light.

 
Traveling? Bring your Riptide
The Riptide comes with a precisely engineered battery capacity that is within the range of TSA guidelines. Once you're past security the small size and handles make the R1 a breeze to transport through the terminal or to check into the overhead compartment.

 
The Perfect Addition to Your Electric Skateboard Quiver
Everyone who rides an electric skateboard knows it more fun to ride with friends (or your wife / husband / kid / grandma / etc). With a Riptide as your second board now you've got something they can ride at a competitive price that can actually keep up with more premium boards.

Order now on our website!
 

Features

A Serious Drive Train 
The R1's 1800W dual belt drive train means it can scream off the line up to the top speed of 20 mph and power up hills unlike any other board its size.

 
Unrivaled Portability
At only 13 lbs with a 31" deck, dual handles, and an airline-friendly, and <99Wh battery, you can easily bring the R1 wherever your travels take you.

 
Premium Longboard Components
With the R1 our goal was a fast, fun ride while maintaining portability and we didn't mind adding a pound or two getting there. Thus the board has 245mm wide trucks and comes with the large diameter, soft urethane wheels by ABEC 11, a top-of-the-line wheel manufacturer.

 
Ride for Miles and Miles
With up-to-an 8 miles of range in real world conditions and an optional fast charger that recharges the board in just 90 mins, you'll be able to park your car for the weekend and not touch it til Monday.

 
Ride All Night
Optional Headlights and Tail Lights provided by Shredlights can be set to "On," "Blink," or "High Beam," meaning you can ride all night and be seen by everyone around you.

 

Perks

Our campaign perks include two models of the Riptide R1 Electric Skateboard. Our base model - the R1 - packs major power into a compact package. Our premium model - the R1 Elite - offers increased speed and range while adding premium headlights / tail lights along with soft-riding ABEC 11 wheels.

The Riptide R1 Electric Skateboard


$599
Order now on our website.
Note: The R1 does not come with headlights, tail lights, or our ABEC 11 wheel upgrade.

The Riptide R1 Elite Electric Skateboard


$729 
Order now on our website!
The R1 Elite comes with ShredLights Head and Tail Lights, and 90mm ABEC 11 Flywheels.
Charge Time: 3.5 hrs (see Fast Charger below for 1.5 hr charging)
 

Fast Charger


$99
Both the Riptide and the Riptide R1 come with our standard, 3.5 hour charger. We also offer this "Fast Charger" that will recharge your board in as little as 90 mins. This is not an upgrade, this is a standalone charger. If you back for both a board and the Fast Charger, you will receive two chargers so you can leave one at home and one at work.
 

Manufacturing Timeline



Use of Funds

Battery Box Injection Molding
The Riptide has a custom battery box, designed and prototyped in California. Several rounds of design, 3D printing, and CNC were completed to ensure proper fitment of the battery and controller, gasket and grommet seals to keep water out, structural strength, heat dissipation, and ideal placement of power switch, charge port, and our custom battery meter.
The design is now complete. Some of your funds will go towards the plastic injection molds necessary to produce our battery box and lid in high volumes.
 
Battery Certification
The R1's battery uses UL-certified lithium ion cells in a 6S3P arrangement, with all standard safety protection plus cell balancing.  Running high-discharge cells in a 3P configuration gives the Riptide more amperage output capability than other boards on the market to handle heavy loads when it needs it.
The design is now finalized. Funds from our Indiegogo project will go towards certifications to verify that the board fits TSA and other guidelines for air travel, sea freight, etc.
 
Factory Minimums
The R1 will be produced by our partners in Shenzhen, CN. We considered several potential manufacturers and selected our partner through many rounds of sampling and after checking several references. Indiegogo funds will go towards hitting our factory minimums. 
 
 

Thank Yous

We're honored to be working with wheels from ABEC 11, one of the most respected wheel companies in the world. If you've ridden ABECs then you know that nothing else compares!

We want to give a special thanks to everyone who has ever supported Shredlights as those customers lent a lot of inspiration for Riptide. We would like to personally thank each and every one of you for believing in our products as much as we have and joining the movement. Whether you've bought a set, come to a group ride, or helped build a batch, we're forever grateful.
 

Thanks to the Lavin Entrepreneurship Center at SDSU for their support of Shredlights and Riptide.
 

Thanks to Tishawn and the NYC EBoarding Crew for leading an amazing ride. Can't wait to get back!
And finally, a thanks to the teams at Boosted, Evolve, Inboard, ZBoard, Enertion, Acton, Carvon, Arc, Koowheel, and many more for building this industry and to your customers that we've gotten the opportunity to meet and ride with.
 


Frequently Asked Questions

How much is shipping?We offer free US shipping. International shipping depends on the country and will be calculated in the cart.
 
Do you ship Internationally?
To start we’ll be shipping to US, MX, Canda, Europe, Singapore, and Australia. We'll be expanding this list as time goes on. If you are interested in a Riptide R1 and your country is not on this list please sign up for this newsletter and we'll let you know when we begin shipping to your country.
 
What features does the Riptide's hand controller have?

Two Rider Modes - Beginner and Advanced - are selectable on-the-fly
Reverse with Smart Activation
Regenerative and Active Braking
Soft-start for smooth acceleration off the line
Low Battery ramp to reduce voltage sag, and low battery braking enabled

The remote is independently FCC certified, 16-channel (2402-2480 MHz) Bluetooth connected with auto-binding, and an effective range of 14 meters with no interference. 
The remote charges with the included micro-USB cable.
 
Can I take the Riptide on an airplane?
The Riptide comes with a 97Wh battery. Its UN-38.3 approved and airline friendly. We can’t guarantee it can go on any flight as every airline has their own rules, but the battery and board do fit in with the general TSA regulations to bring as a carry on.
 
What kind of battery does the Riptide have?
The current battery is 6S3P (21.6v nominal / 25.2v max, 4.5Ah total) lithium ion 18650 rated at 8C max continuous discharge.  BMS is currently 30A continuous / 60A peak, with all standard safety protection plus cell balancing.  Running high-discharge cells in a 3P configuration gives the Riptide enough amperage to handle heavy loads when it needs it.
 
What type of motors does the Riptide have?
The Riptide has dual belt drive motors with 1800 watts of peak power. These are brushless sensorless DC motors, similar to what you’d find on a DJI drone, but bigger. We picked belt drive over hub motors because our thesis with the Riptide is all about maximum performance in a small package, and belts drives allow for better torque delivery to maximize acceleration and hill climbing. It’s true that belts will wear down over time but it’s a quick 5 minute replacement and we felt that it was worth it. 
 
Is the Riptide waterproof?
The board is not waterproof. We’ve made a lot of design decisions to make it as water resistant as possible, though. You can ride through irrigation runoff or the occasional puddle, but we don’t recommend riding in wet conditions - not when it’s raining or right after it has rained - as you may damage the electronics and rust the bearings. Also it’s extremely dangerous to ride in conditions with reduced traction, both for your board AND because of the cars around you.
The battery box is fully sealed, and partitioned to seal battery compartment and motor controller compartments independently. We chose sensorless motors to further reduce susceptibility to water, and made many components easily serviceable for regular maintenance.
 
Does the Riptide have regenerative braking?
The Riptide employs multiple types of braking technologies that allow it to smoothly and quickly slow down and come to a complete stop.  This includes integrating both regenerative braking and active braking, similar to technolgies seen in the Mellow Drive and ZBoard.    
The Riptide also has variable braking strength, which means that you have more dynamic control over braking speed than an on-or-off pre-programmed braking curve used by some other brands.
And when the battery is fully depleted, braking is still possible.
 
What is the weight limit?
250 lbs.
 
If your question is not answered here, please reach out to us at info@rideriptide.com and we'll add it to the list.

story:
Why you contribution is needed

SF Tweed is completely volunteer run. While some of our costs are sponsored or donated, many are not and are paid for out-of-pocket by our volunteers. Some of our past participants have expressed interest in helping defray the costs of producing the event so we created this Indiegogo page.

 

Where does my money go?

Your donation will help pay for photography, food, printing costs for advertising and a memento of the event for all participants.

If you cannot donate, don't fret. The ride is still free and it will still happen but donations can help make the experience so much better!
