story:
The Alex eRoadster is a fully composite built, lightweight, long - range, futuristic electric car with all the features you would expect from today's cars.  While it is something of a niche car it will however help to change people's perceptions of what an electric car should be.

It is fun, fashionable, fast and functional and with a carbon fibre chassis, under the floor batteries and powerful motors powering the wheels it has impressive performance also.

The future of conventionally powered cars is generally accepted to be coming to an end due to the international movement away from the use of fossil-fuels. Innovation in car propulsion systems is now focused heavily on electric power.

The general  perception of electric cars is that they are small, sluggish, and generally lacking in utility; for example, so called range anxiety (will I get to my destination?) has been a major factor in the slow uptake of electric cars. Most of the current electric cars available are built using standard manufacturing processes. They are essentially petrol/diesel cars converted to battery power.

Facts & Figures

O-100Kph                        5 Seconds

Top Speed                       140 Kph

Range                               500 kms

Weight                              1,100 Kgs

Chassis                             Carbon Fibre

Batteries                          Advanced Lithium Ion

Motors                              Twin AC Motors with dual controls

Charging                           Fast charging available 25-30 minutes

Seats                                 2

Doors                                 Clamshell opening canopy doors/roof unit

Cost                                   €65,000

We have been working for many years on design and development to reach this point and most of the groundwork is already done

We do have the drive, the knowledge, the experience and the people to make this project a success.

We are however missing one thing- You - our partner in this great adventure. Together we can change the perception of the electric car from being a dull, non-performing, troublesome form of transport into a functional, fun, fast and fashionable 'want to have' necessity.

 

Our Team

Mike Keane - Lead Engineer is a highly experienced automotive engineer having been head of engineering at Williams Engineering (Williams F1).  These are just some of the ground breaking projects he has been involved in.

Mike was lead engineer on a project to built 5 Jaguar C-X75s stunt cars for the James Bond movie Spectre (pictured above). He headed the engineering team for the development of the Nissan Bladeglider an amazing concept car, showcased at the Rio Olympics.  Mike also managed the Williams Advanced Engineering technical team who delivered the first working Aston Martin Rapide-E electric car (pictured above) shortly to go into production.

Tom Finnegan- CEO is the project leader.  He has spent many years in the green energy sector. He is very familiar with car builds himself having built in his spare time a working electric sports car based on the Lotus 7 model.  This is a pre-prototype of the current car and was used to research lightweighting techniques.

Robbie Thornton  is the Suspension and Drivetrain design engineer. He is highly skilled with years of experience working on performance and race car suspension setup and design with his company TDP.  His knowledge of steering systems, braking and drivetrains is second to none.

John Corrigan is the carbon fibre chassis and composites design engineer.  Currently also working with Renault Sport/Lotus F1 he has a wealth of experience at the very forefront of composite technology to bring to Fintos Electric Cars.  

Vedran Martinek  is an innovative designer who pushes the boundaries of what can be achieved.  He has a keen eye for what is aesthetically pleasing and his attention to detail is extraordinary.  His no holds barred attitude to design is apparent in everything he does.

Branimir Sostaric is the is the strategic planning executive.  He sets goals and deadlines for the team.  Branimir ensures that we are organised and working well together as a team.

 

How will we use your money

  • Complete the initial design and development of the chassis prototype and build the first working prototype car.
  • Secure and fit out premises including the purchase of required plant and equipment. Our small team will be expanded
  • We anticipate making some use of external consultancy expertise. This stage will also include the preparation of comprehensive plans for the subsequent full roll out of the production model. 
  • We will seek further investment in order to fund the production scale-up. These plans will also provide for the development of an extensive global marketing programme required to bring the car to market including the establishment of dealer and other retail distribution relationships.

Competitive Edge

Cars today come off a production line of thousands.  There is a certain sameness about all cars. We aim to change that!  Why should we all drive more or less the same cars produced in the same way.  From the clamshell lifting doors/roof (weight saving and fun) to the intelligent energy recovery systems this car has all and more.

We are based in Ireland.  We have been working on the project for many years.  Originally part funded by the EU but largely with the help of many people working for free, who truly believe in this project, We have designed what we feel is sure to be a winning formula.  Our market research tells us so.  We have the people with the skills to make it happen.

We need €100,000 seed funding to make it happen.  It will enable us to build and test our first prototype. This is a first essential step that will enable us to follow on into production.  We want you to be a part of our success story!!

Major accomplishments this far

  • 2009 work began on a pre-prototype 2 seater electric car based on the much copied Lotus 7 type by companies such as Westfield and Caterham.  It took 5 years to make the working pre-prototype. With the goal of achieving as light an overall weight as possible this pre-prototype used aluminium honeycomb composite coupled with box steel to make a semi space-frame chassis. The end result was an electric car with a high power to weight ratio.
  • November 2014 based on pre-prototype achievements we applied for and were the beneficiaries of Interreg EU grant aid administered by the Vital program, which was a collaboration between Invent Dublin City University, Queen’s University Belfast and Dundalk IT.
  • February 2015 the team began the design of a new electric car with Design House BigSmall in Belfast following on from a feasibility study conducted by analysts Ross Boyd.
  • August 2016 Mike Keane ex Williams Engineering (Williams F1) joined the business as lead engineer and director and he is focused on the work of sourcing the components and materials needed for the project.
  • 2016/2017 Interest has come from dealers in Ireland, UK, the US and Australia without us having actually as yet started to build a network of dealers.
  • January 2017 Marketing company TeamBDS were engaged to update market research completed earlier.

Our Collaborators and Partners

We would like to thank all those who have worked with us so far on this project.

The Impact

This car will help change the perception of electric cars worldwide by being fun and yet functional.  It will help to change public attitude to electric vehicles.  It will help show that you don't need multi- billions to produce quality cars on a small scale.

We can do this together with your help.  We have the people with the skills and proven track record to make these cars.

It is your car - a car of the people, not a produce of a giant corporation .  Come and help us build it!

Risks & Challenges

A car as we all know is a very complicated piece of technology. Starting on a project like this and being able to carry it through takes a lot of effort and persistence.  It does need people with experience, know how and above all the will to succeed.  We have all those attributes in abundance in our team.  Because you are reading this you too are part of our team. 

Come join us on this adventure!!

Other ways you can be part of our team

Please get the word out about our campaign.  Together we can make a difference.  Share this with your friends in the pub, your work, your school and on social media.  It may not seem like a lot but it means a lot to us!

Perks/Rewards

When you support us in addition to getting the perk or reward listed on the right you are helping us also by automatically going on our order book.

N.B Pre-production test drives may only take place in one or two countries (to be decided).

Fulfillment of merchandise rewards/perks will take place following the campaign.  Estimated date of delivery before end December 2017.
story_txt:
The Alex eRoadster is a fully composite built, lightweight, long - range, futuristic electric car with all the features you would expect from today's cars.  While it is something of a niche car it will however help to change people's perceptions of what an electric car should be.It is fun, fashionable, fast and functional and with a carbon fibre chassis, under the floor batteries and powerful motors powering the wheels it has impressive performance also.The future of conventionally powered cars is generally accepted to be coming to an end due to the international movement away from the use of fossil-fuels. Innovation in car propulsion systems is now focused heavily on electric power.The general  perception of electric cars is that they are small, sluggish, and generally lacking in utility; for example, so called range anxiety (will I get to my destination?) has been a major factor in the slow uptake of electric cars. Most of the current electric cars available are built using standard manufacturing processes. They are essentially petrol/diesel cars converted to battery power.Facts & FiguresO-100Kph                        5 SecondsTop Speed                       140 KphRange                               500 kmsWeight                              1,100 KgsChassis                             Carbon FibreBatteries                          Advanced Lithium IonMotors                              Twin AC Motors with dual controlsCharging                           Fast charging available 25-30 minutesSeats                                 2Doors                                 Clamshell opening canopy doors/roof unitCost                                   €65,000We have been working for many years on design and development to reach this point and most of the groundwork is already doneWe do have the drive, the knowledge, the experience and the people to make this project a success.We are however missing one thing- You - our partner in this great adventure. Together we can change the perception of the electric car from being a dull, non-performing, troublesome form of transport into a functional, fun, fast and fashionable 'want to have' necessity. Our TeamMike Keane - Lead Engineer is a highly experienced automotive engineer having been head of engineering at Williams Engineering (Williams F1).  These are just some of the ground breaking projects he has been involved in.Mike was lead engineer on a project to built 5 Jaguar C-X75s stunt cars for the James Bond movie Spectre (pictured above). He headed the engineering team for the development of the Nissan Bladeglider an amazing concept car, showcased at the Rio Olympics.  Mike also managed the Williams Advanced Engineering technical team who delivered the first working Aston Martin Rapide-E electric car (pictured above) shortly to go into production.Tom Finnegan- CEO is the project leader.  He has spent many years in the green energy sector. He is very familiar with car builds himself having built in his spare time a working electric sports car based on the Lotus 7 model.  This is a pre-prototype of the current car and was used to research lightweighting techniques.Robbie Thornton  is the Suspension and Drivetrain design engineer. He is highly skilled with years of experience working on performance and race car suspension setup and design with his company TDP.  His knowledge of steering systems, braking and drivetrains is second to none.John Corrigan is the carbon fibre chassis and composites design engineer.  Currently also working with Renault Sport/Lotus F1 he has a wealth of experience at the very forefront of composite technology to bring to Fintos Electric Cars.  Vedran Martinek  is an innovative designer who pushes the boundaries of what can be achieved.  He has a keen eye for what is aesthetically pleasing and his attention to detail is extraordinary.  His no holds barred attitude to design is apparent in everything he does.Branimir Sostaric is the is the strategic planning executive.  He sets goals and deadlines for the team.  Branimir ensures that we are organised and working well together as a team. How will we use your money
Complete the initial design and development of the chassis prototype and build the first working prototype car.
Secure and fit out premises including the purchase of required plant and equipment. Our small team will be expanded
We anticipate making some use of external consultancy expertise. This stage will also include the preparation of comprehensive plans for the subsequent full roll out of the production model. 
We will seek further investment in order to fund the production scale-up. These plans will also provide for the development of an extensive global marketing programme required to bring the car to market including the establishment of dealer and other retail distribution relationships.
Competitive EdgeCars today come off a production line of thousands.  There is a certain sameness about all cars. We aim to change that!  Why should we all drive more or less the same cars produced in the same way.  From the clamshell lifting doors/roof (weight saving and fun) to the intelligent energy recovery systems this car has all and more.We are based in Ireland.  We have been working on the project for many years.  Originally part funded by the EU but largely with the help of many people working for free, who truly believe in this project, We have designed what we feel is sure to be a winning formula.  Our market research tells us so.  We have the people with the skills to make it happen.We need €100,000 seed funding to make it happen.  It will enable us to build and test our first prototype. This is a first essential step that will enable us to follow on into production.  We want you to be a part of our success story!!Major accomplishments this far

2009 work began on a pre-prototype 2 seater electric car based on the much copied Lotus 7 type by companies such as Westfield and Caterham.  It took 5 years to make the working pre-prototype. With the goal of achieving as light an overall weight as possible this pre-prototype used aluminium honeycomb composite coupled with box steel to make a semi space-frame chassis. The end result was an electric car with a high power to weight ratio.

November 2014 based on pre-prototype achievements we applied for and were the beneficiaries of Interreg EU grant aid administered by the Vital program, which was a collaboration between Invent Dublin City University, Queen’s University Belfast and Dundalk IT.

February 2015 the team began the design of a new electric car with Design House BigSmall in Belfast following on from a feasibility study conducted by analysts Ross Boyd.


August 2016 Mike Keane ex Williams Engineering (Williams F1) joined the business as lead engineer and director and he is focused on the work of sourcing the components and materials needed for the project.

2016/2017 Interest has come from dealers in Ireland, UK, the US and Australia without us having actually as yet started to build a network of dealers.

January 2017 Marketing company TeamBDS were engaged to update market research completed earlier.
Our Collaborators and PartnersWe would like to thank all those who have worked with us so far on this project.The ImpactThis car will help change the perception of electric cars worldwide by being fun and yet functional.  It will help to change public attitude to electric vehicles.  It will help show that you don't need multi- billions to produce quality cars on a small scale.We can do this together with your help.  We have the people with the skills and proven track record to make these cars.It is your car - a car of the people, not a produce of a giant corporation .  Come and help us build it!Risks & ChallengesA car as we all know is a very complicated piece of technology. Starting on a project like this and being able to carry it through takes a lot of effort and persistence.  It does need people with experience, know how and above all the will to succeed.  We have all those attributes in abundance in our team.  Because you are reading this you too are part of our team. Come join us on this adventure!!Other ways you can be part of our teamPlease get the word out about our campaign.  Together we can make a difference.  Share this with your friends in the pub, your work, your school and on social media.  It may not seem like a lot but it means a lot to us!Perks/RewardsWhen you support us in addition to getting the perk or reward listed on the right you are helping us also by automatically going on our order book.N.B Pre-production test drives may only take place in one or two countries (to be decided).Fulfillment of merchandise rewards/perks will take place following the campaign.  Estimated date of delivery before end December 2017.

story:
I’m Ken Harper, from Mountain View, CA here to tell you about the game-changing Genesis Aerodynamic System – a classic example of American Ingenuity.

What It Does

  • Improves safety and stability
  • Reduces greenhouse gas emissions
  • Increases fuel efficiency and lowers fuel cost
  • Generates growth in several sectors of the economy

KEY FEATURES

  •  Durable modular construction, self-powered, fully automatic, weatherproof, low-maintenance.
  • Top-mounted array of deflector panels regulate airflow around the back of a vehicle to reduce drag and improve fuel efficiency.
  • Built-in sensors detect surrounding conditions, CPU converts data into command signals interfacing with robotics controller to extend and swivel the deflectors in real time.

THE GAS STORY

In June 2010 I became intrigued with the trucking industry, considering that the auto industry everywhere was making great strides in technology and design. Deeply interested in what the industry was doing I learned that a variety of things were being accomplished with the help of the Federal Super Truck Programs to improve the fuel efficiency of large vehicles, especially Heavy Duty Class 8 tractor-trailers trucks, better known as semis.

There were improvement in tractor design, diesel engines, power systems, drive trains, tire technology, and overall aerodynamic potential on these large box-shaped vehicles wherever they could. One area of concern with the subject of aerodynamics caught my attention — the Base.

Looking at studies going back to the 50s, it is agreed that on Class 8 semi-trucks there are 4 major areas that contribute to the aerodynamic drag of the vehicle. Included are the front of the tractor, the area between the tractor and trailer where it articulates, the area under the trailer, and the Base, which is the area at the very back end where all the displaced air comes back together in an aerodynamic phenomenon known as the Trailing Vortex.

The most viable products designed to address the trailing vortex were called Trailer Extension Panels (TEP).  This tail-piece attachment was adopted for the base on the Super Truck, a new prototype vehicle developed within the Super Truck Program. With all the combined improvements this new truck would reach over 12 mpg, twice the average mileage of most semis on the road today.

Examples of Conventional Trailer Extension Panels:

The TEP  helped but it had severe limitations including:

  • Invariable function, non- adjustable to real world driving conditions
  • Bulky, awkward, and cumbersome, flimsy construction subject to damage
  • Use limited to a small fraction of the tens of millions of large trucks on the road today

Some other variations of drag reduction accessories:

The Solution

Scaled-down models of the Genesis Aerodynamic System:

The GAS is a standardized modular design — compatible with all large vehicles.

GAS technology can also be applied to other modes of transportation.

We can be part of the solution instead of part of the problem

We all rely on trucks to deliver everything we buy, so we are all part of the problem. The cumulative effect of many years of consumption multiplied by millions of consumers presents a moral imperative. Since this mass commerce culture in essence crowdfunded the climate change crisis, this campaign intends to reverse that trend and crowdfund a solution.

What We Need

$26,550 for a combination of patents including:

  • Trademark
  • Non-Provisional Patent
  • International Cooperation Patent

The following Fee Schedule was provided by the Carr/Farrell Law Firm in Menlo Park, CA.

Strategic IP Participation Fee: $3,500 per session.*

A. Includes graphics preparation and IP Cluster Map 2 Patents

B. Patent preparation and filing: $15,000, plus USPTO (United States Patent Office) filing fees and costs (about $750 for a small entity)**

C. Assignment of patent ownership: $575  Prosecution (correspondence with the USPTO) is billed hourly.

(Total cost of issued U.S. patent is approximately $25,000-$45,000, over a period of three years)

Other:  Patent search: $2,500 (as needed)

D. Other documents filed with USPTO: $450 minimum

E. Foreign patent (PCT) application preparation and filing: $4,500 plus official filing fees of approximately $3,000

  •  Trademark application, - $1,600 - $2300 + official fees+++

________________________

*Additional attorney consultation outside the scope of the Strategy Session is available on an hourly basis, as are additional Strategy Sessions.

** One-half of the fee is collected as a retainer at the beginning of the Application  process; the balance is billed upon Application filing. Application drafts not returned by the client within four weeks are deemed complete and billed in full. Subsequent revisions to these Applications are billed hourly.

+2018 Fees; USPTO fees and disbursements are extra.

++This amount does not include expenses for duplication, postage and telephone, or fees for preparation of computer source code deposits.

+++Prosecution (correspondence with the USPTO) is billed hourly.

***

In the event that this campaign fails to reach the maximum $26,550. goal, I will launch another crowdfunding campaign to raise the funds for the remaining patents. If the campaign exceeds the the goal, the extra funds will help pay for travel and other expenses involved with the patent process and consulting with university officials in regard to feasibility studies.

The patents will move GAS to the next stage of development involving feasibility studies at a leading California academic institution. Engineers can run the design specifications through a virtual simulation software program that mimics real world conditions. These tests measure precise details about how well the apparatus reacts to the trailing vortex to achieve maximum drag reduction.

This procedure will ascertain the feasibility of the GAS design. It will identify minor deficiencies in the process, so engineers can recalculate the parameters and dial in revisions until a fully functional model qualifies for construction. The current GAS design is a beta version.

The Step-By-Step Development of the GAS:

The Following Academic Institutions will be considered for the feasibility studies:

  • University of California Berkeley
  • University of California Los Angeles
  • University of California San Diego
  • University of Southern California
  • California Polytechnic State University
  • California Institute of Technology
  • Stanford University

What You Get

Join the crowd and be part of a historical movement.

Backers of this campaign deserve full credit and their visionary support should be recorded in the annals of technological history. So I'm offering the following perks to fulfill that obligation:

  • Certificate of Recognition
  • GAS Journals in eBook form
  • GAS documentary film on DVD

Backers will be acknowledged in the book and listed in the DVD credits.

The Impact

GAS is a textbook example of a classic crowdfunding campaign — a grassroots effort by one concerned citizen with a novel idea for a practical proposal to address the existential threat of global warming. The concept utilizes the latest technology built into a device designed to optimize the aerodynamic efficiency of large vehicles, thereby reducing fuel consumption and emissions that pollute the air, land, and water across the planet.

This control system would be the most significant aerodynamic accessory ever invented for large vehicles. It can also be adapted to streamline other types of vehicles, including small trailers and trains. Beyond transportation GAS technology (AI, sensors, robotics, etc.) can be applied in context to a broad scope of other operations. The birth of my brainchild begins a burgeoning industry with economic advantages increasing exponentially far into the future.

*****

The eventual adaption of GAS is inevitable, but right now the climate change challenge demands an urgent need for immediate action. With so many benefits this is a campaign everyone can and should support. Due diligence was done in the concept development for the design plans to be patented, and I’m determined to follow through until a feasible prototype is built.

Gadgets come and go. The GAS is here to stay.
Be part of this momentous movement and make history happen.
If this campaign can overcome the obstacles of apathy and ignorance, it will inspire the emergence of a crowdfunding cultural renaissance for everyone.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Since the very beginning this project it has been a risk and challenge. I risked a major investment of time, and struggled to overcome the myriad technical and logistical challenges along the way.  By my steadfast commitment to the cause I overcame these hurdles.  Despite the obstacles there were a lot of lucky breaks and positive indications that I was on the right track.

I never expected it to be easy. As the stakes get higher I'm taking extra care to ensure everything is done with the utmost caution. To that end I continue to reach out to industry professionals for their technical expertise. The consensus so far is that the GAS is viable.
Throughout the campaign I'm available to share more information with anyone interested.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any help you can offer is greatly appreciated, including your advice, referrals, comments, and criticism.  I welcome your feedback and input. Please contact me anytime. Thank you!

KEN HARPER

415-794-9109

ibharpo@yahoo.com

story:
Our Story

Our plan is to Manufacture and Deliver minimum of 100 Cargo Lifter Cradle Units. These lifter cradles can be attached to existing popular drones 3DR IRIS, DJI Phantom 1, 2, and 3’s. Not to mention that it cannot be adapted to other makes and models.

This project will provide us enough capital to design and build two Industrial Strength 25kg (33lb) Agile Flex-I Lifters for Cargo, and Lifeguard Applications.

If the contributions surpass our expectations, it will be spent on application development as outlined on our website: http://agiledrones.com 

Ian Cardoza, and I (Harjit Sethi), we have designed, built and tested numerous drones. With our combined 40+ background in Aerospace and Telecommunication Engineering, we thought to Design and Manufacture our own Drone which can carry out most of the Industrial and Commercial Applications under the FAA Drone law. But before we undertook that, we decided to test out applications including this one using existing drones. Our websites lists in details our proposed undertakings.

 Ian Cardoza, Telecommunication Engineer

 Harjit Sethi, Aerospace, Production Engineer

History

It all started from KICKSTARTER’S “OpenGrab hardware Electro-Permanent cargo gripper” project by Andreas Jochum in December, 2012 in the Technology Section.

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/412473553/opengrab-open-hardware-electro-permanent-cargo-gri/description

The above item also appeared on DIYDRONES blogs:

http://diydrones.com/profiles/blogs/electro-permanent-magnet-for-reliable-cargo-lifting-on-a-quad?xg_source=activity

Current Situation

Concept of magnetic power and material handling is not new, but the technology for picking up and delivering materials using drones is. This idea has been recently floated on various forums and blogs including the inventor Andreas Jochum with its potential application. We have been in touch with him throughout our prototype build up, and hopefully continue to work with him.

While doing this project, we thought of introducing new ideas in the market place-

1.  Standardization of Cargo Boxes

2.  Areas- designated size and location of containments for pick-up and delivery.

3.  Possible redundant cargo latching or securing

4.  Spur an open source competition on the above subjects

5.  Provide practical solutions to the regulatory agencies.

Purpose of the Project

We have tried to address some of the above points with the following design.

1.  Rigid Lifting Cradle

2.  Tough Cargo Box

3.  Maintain FPV Visuals from Ground Station

4.  Safer Landing/ Lifting Areas

Eliminate Human Intervention attaching/removing the hardware

First Prototype Details

Prototype Unit Actual Assembly

Pre-requisites and Instructions for IRIS and DJI Phantom

We intend to provide hook up instructions for both models, which may be extended to other makes and models.

The user must have 8 or more Channels available on their Transmitters and Receivers. We used SpektrumDX8 Tx/Rx which came with the purchase of 3DRobotics

http://copter.ardupilot.com/wiki/common-electro-permanent-magnet-gripper/

FPV Kit (Optional)

Since, 3DRobotics IRIS will exceed its lifting capacity, we replaced the gimbal and the Hero’s GoPro camera, and replaced it with a small Sony Camera to the lifter plate looking straight down aiming to find the cargo platform.

Users may decide not to use it, in lieu keep everything in sight (FAA Rule).

Progress Production Units

·  Award Long Lead Magnetic Grabbers  10/30/2015

·  Design for Assembly    11/15/2015

·  Electrical Schematic  11/15/2015

·  Request for Quotes  11/15/2015

·  Selection of Hardware  11/15/2015

·  Award Fabrication Detail Contract  11/30/2015

·  Receive Magnetic Grabber Assemblies  12/15/2015

·  Print Hats and T-Shirts  12/30/2015

·  Receive detail Fabricated & Buy parts  12/30/2015

·  Assemble, Troubleshoot, and Rework  01/15/2016

·  Start Shipping  01/17/2016

Current Perceived Issues and Mitigation

·  The design of the Magnetic Gripper is changing for better grip performance, including dimensions. This prompts minor redesign.

·  Sample Cargo Boxes on order to determine and mitigate dimensional variances

Risks and Challenges

·  Long lead hard to get items

a.  Magnetic Assy. From Managua, Nicaragua  In negotiation w/ supplier

b.  Toughened molded plastic boxes from China  In negotiation w/ supplier

·  Normal production run issues  Will get daily status

·  Rework  Equipped. To be done in House

·  Running out of funds  Adequate personal funds available

We have combined 45 years of experience in the Industry. We are proactive, the design of Detail Components and the Assembly is complete. Over 20 Request for Quotes has been received. The first delivery of Components will be three weeks from award of contract to a supplier. We are negotiating with the long lead key component supplier as of now. All leads are verifiable. We see no reason for failure.

If
the contributions surpass our expectations, it will be spent on application
development as outlined on our website: http://agiledrones.com Ian Cardoza, and I (Harjit Sethi), we have designed, built and tested numerous drones. With our combined 40+ background in Aerospace and Telecommunication Engineering, we thought to Design and Manufacture our own Drone which can carry out most of the Industrial and Commercial Applications under the FAA Drone law. But before we undertook that, we decided to test out applications including this one using existing drones. Our websites lists in details our proposed undertakings. Ian Cardoza, Telecommunication Engineer Harjit Sethi, Aerospace, Production EngineerHistory 
It
all started from KICKSTARTER’S “OpenGrab hardware Electro-Permanent cargo
gripper” project by Andreas Jochum in December, 2012 in the Technology Section.
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/412473553/opengrab-open-hardware-electro-permanent-cargo-gri/description
The
above item also appeared on DIYDRONES blogs: 
http://diydrones.com/profiles/blogs/electro-permanent-magnet-for-reliable-cargo-lifting-on-a-quad?xg_source=activityCurrent Situation
Concept
of magnetic power and material handling is not new, but the technology for
picking up and delivering materials using drones is. This idea has been
recently floated on various forums and blogs including the inventor Andreas
Jochum with its potential application. We have been in touch with him
throughout our prototype build up, and hopefully continue to work with him.
While
doing this project, we thought of introducing new ideas in the market place-
1. 
Standardization of Cargo Boxes
2. 
Areas- designated size and location of
containments for pick-up and delivery.
3. 
Possible redundant cargo latching or
securing
4. 
Spur an open source competition on the
above subjects
5. 
Provide practical solutions to the
regulatory agencies.Purpose
of the Project 
We have tried to address some of the above points
with the following design.
1.  Rigid Lifting Cradle
2.  Tough Cargo Box
3.  Maintain FPV Visuals from Ground
Station
4.  Safer Landing/ Lifting Areas
Eliminate Human Intervention attaching/removing
the hardware
First
Prototype Details


Prototype Unit Actual
Assembly

Pre-requisites and
Instructions for IRIS and DJI Phantom 
We
intend to provide hook up instructions for both models, which may be extended to
other makes and models.
The
user must have 8 or more Channels available on their Transmitters and Receivers.
We used SpektrumDX8 Tx/Rx which came with the purchase of 3DRobotics
http://copter.ardupilot.com/wiki/common-electro-permanent-magnet-gripper/

FPV Kit (Optional)
Since,
3DRobotics IRIS will exceed its lifting capacity, we replaced the gimbal and
the Hero’s GoPro camera, and replaced it with a small Sony Camera to the lifter
plate looking straight down aiming to find the cargo platform.

Users may decide not to use
it, in lieu keep everything in sight (FAA Rule).

Progress Production Units
· 
Award Long Lead Magnetic Grabbers  10/30/2015
· 
Design for
Assembly    11/15/2015
· 
Electrical Schematic  11/15/2015

· 
Request for Quotes  11/15/2015
· 
Selection of Hardware  11/15/2015
· 
Award Fabrication Detail Contract  11/30/2015
· 
Receive Magnetic Grabber Assemblies  12/15/2015
· 
Print Hats and T-Shirts  12/30/2015
· 
Receive detail Fabricated & Buy
parts  12/30/2015
· 
Assemble, Troubleshoot, and Rework  01/15/2016
· 
Start Shipping  01/17/2016
Current Perceived
Issues and Mitigation
· 
The design of the Magnetic Gripper is
changing for better grip performance, including dimensions. This prompts minor
redesign.
· 
Sample Cargo Boxes on order to
determine and mitigate dimensional variances


Risks
and Challenges

· 
Long lead hard to get items
a. 
Magnetic Assy. From Managua, Nicaragua  In negotiation w/ supplier
b. 
Toughened molded plastic boxes from
China  In negotiation w/ supplier
· 
Normal production run issues  Will
get daily status
· 
Rework  Equipped.
To be done in House
· 
Running out of funds  Adequate
personal funds available
We
have combined 45 years of experience in the Industry. We are proactive, the
design of Detail Components and the Assembly is complete. Over 20 Request for
Quotes has been received. The first delivery of Components will be three weeks
from award of contract to a supplier. We are negotiating with the long lead key
component supplier as of now. All leads are verifiable. We see no reason for
failure.

story:
VisionQuest:  The ceremony of the vision quest is one of the most universal and ancient means to find spiritual guidance and purpose. In practicing cultures, a vision quest is said to provide deep understanding of one's life purpose.

WHY? I went to school, played sports, pretty much stayed out of trouble, went to college, got my degree, tried to play along with the cookie-cutter that society hands us....and couldnt do it...

So in 2000, I ditched everything and moved to Key  West, FL to live simply, "the island life."  Successfully, more or less, and even went to Maui for a few years in the middle.  But then I came back to Key West, closer to my family, and I thought I would enjoy the "more-party" environment...but no, I have grown older and more simple...so I long to go back to Maui....

But my friends asked me what I want to do when I get there, and frankly I dont know....so I am going to take a VisionQuest, a month-long ride across the USA to reconnect with people, tap into their vision, and let the real ME percolate to the top again.....

I will stop often, as I do not have a deadline, and I will blog along the way, but I need your help..because running out of money ruins the whole purpose.

story:
We believe we can change the world by changing the way we drive and GOFAR does this beautifully.

- Intuitive feedback keeps you in your car's efficiency sweet-spot.

- Complete driving log.  Great for tax and expenses.

- Monitor your car's health from your phone.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

GREAT CUSTOMER FEEDBACK TOO

 

 

 

 

 

Driving in the sweet spot saves fuel - which saves money and cuts emissions. But unless you are part of a Formula 1 race team it’s difficult to find.  This is where GOFAR helps.

 

 

 

 

 

GOFAR.  GO GREEN.

 

 

 

 

In May 2016 we were awarded a prestigious Good Design Award winning alongside industry giants such as Oculus Rift, Microsoft and Google.  It's our fifth major award (and shows you don't always need massive budgets to make an impact with thoughtful, effective design).

 

 

 

We’ve put a lot of thought into the design, exploring hundreds of possibilities, so that GOFAR can work effectively and safely in your peripheral vision with a low cognitive load.

 

 

 

 

 

  • 6 axis motion sensors: 3 accelerometers and 3 gyroscopes allow GOFAR to precisely track your car's motion in 3 dimensions - central to our energy tracking tech. 
  • Trends: track how your driving changes with time.  We monitor Distance, Time in traffic, Fuel fill ups, Speed, Economy, Fuel costs and more
  • Trip tagging:  run experiments or just log your work trip for expenses
  • Offline trip storage: Flash memory in GOFAR stores your trips even when your phone is dead or not in the car.  
  • Connect to cloud: Sends your car data to the cloud. 
  • Ambient light sensor: Automatically adjusts the display to ensure perfect brightness 
  • RGB LED display: Nine full RGB LEDs provide GOFAR's gorgeous glow
  • Bluetooth low energy: Provides an easy data connection to your smartphone to sync your trip data and driver stats 
  • Multi OBD protocol support: Supports four major OBD protocols (J-1850, CAN, ISO, KWP).
  • No batteries needed: Powered by the car so it just works
  • Future Proof: Updatable over the air via phone so your car gets smarter!  At least one update a month so far

 

 

 

We have worked at 3M, GE, Nestle and IBM and amongst the team we have an aerospace engineer who was selected as one of two Australians to attend NASA space camp, a data scientist who got the second highest score in India’s national Maths Olympiad, an Oxford graduate, a budding lawyer who came in the top 0.01% in the country and a design guru who also has a 1st in Mechatronic Engineering.
story_txt:
We believe we can change the world by changing the way we drive and GOFAR does this beautifully.- Intuitive feedback keeps you in your car's efficiency sweet-spot.- Complete driving log.  Great for tax and expenses.- Monitor your car's health from your phone.      EVERYONE LOVES GOFAR Considered one of the top 10 coolest thing in the world by GQ, we've already produced over 3,500 high quality GOFAR devices and shipped to 37 countries around the world.  In fact GOFAR devices have covered over two million kilometres in the last few months, with great feedback from the press.      GREAT CUSTOMER FEEDBACK TOO  GOFAR - KNOWLEDGE IS POWER! Cars are our most expensive cost after a house and groceries, yet most of us have little or no information on our driving.  Knowledge is power though, so with GOFAR you're in control.   You can track fuel costs adding up, how much time different routes take, when to leave for work, average speeds, braking and acceleration scores and more.  It's great for logging expenses too.    FUEL IS MONEY - DON'T WASTE EITHER. Most governments estimate we waste 20-25% of the fuel we pay for through inefficient driving styles.  It's not much on one trip but over a month, a year, a lifetime, why burn literally thousands of dollars if you don't need to? GOFAR logs all your car's driving and makes you the expert.   And in urban and suburban trials it's been shown to save over 20% on fuel costs without increasing journey time - that sounds like free money!   STAY SAFE.  NO STRESS. And whether you're a lumberjack or an accountant, driving to work is probably one of the most dangerous and stressful things you do. Driving with GOFAR keeps things calmer in the car.  Harsh braking and aggressive acceleration are considered risky driving behaviours by insurance companies but tests show driving with GOFAR reduces harsh braking by 25%.    WHO IS GOFAR FOR? 

Driving TO work - make your commute calmer and cheaper

Driving FOR work - never miss out on expenses with GOFAR

Learners - enjoy consistent, objective feedback and score each drive

Parents - help learners learn the right habits right from the start.

Data hounds - explore and optimise your driving

Eco enthusiasts - cut emissions down whilst you save for a Tesla!

Fleets - it's nice to save on one car but it's great to save on lots. 
  THE SCIENCE BEHIND GOFAR Every engine speed has a sweet spot - an optimum position that maximises your power and minimises your fuel consumption. It's where your car runs best. Driving in the sweet spot saves fuel - which saves money and cuts emissions. But unless you are part of a Formula 1 race team it’s difficult to find.  This is where GOFAR helps. 

 
 
  
 
GETTING GOFAR IN YOUR CAR IS EASY GOFAR is compatible with all petrol, hybrid and diesel cars built since 2006.  These cars have an "OBD-II data port" which hides away under the steering wheel.  It's a treasure trove of data and GOFAR just plugs into that.  Simple. **If your car was made between 1996 and 2006 it might still be compatible too - we will personally check your car's compatibility - try our fast online assesment.
We guarantee compatibility or your money back if you complete our online check and we tell you your car is compatible.


GOFAR.  GO GREEN.
 GOFAR monitors gasoline flow rate and combustion conditions and calculates emissions for every trip, making your emissions visible.  Adapting your driving behaviour has the best and quickest pay off of anything you can do to reduce emissions and GOFAR's real-time feedback makes this easy. 
 
HOW GOOD IS YOUR DRIVING? 82% of drivers think they are above average! Now with GOFAR, you can prove you’re the best.  Get scores for braking and acceleration on every trip.  Compete in leagues for your make and model, challenge friends, or just beat your personal best. 

 



MULTI-AWARD WINNING DESIGN In May 2016 we were awarded a prestigious Good Design Award winning alongside industry giants such as Oculus Rift, Microsoft and Google.  It's our fifth major award (and shows you don't always need massive budgets to make an impact with thoughtful, effective design).
 
  
We’ve put a lot of thought into the design, exploring hundreds of possibilities, so that GOFAR can work effectively and safely in your peripheral vision with a low cognitive load.

 

 
 
 
 
Other features

6 axis motion sensors: 3 accelerometers and 3 gyroscopes allow GOFAR to precisely track your car's motion in 3 dimensions - central to our energy tracking tech. 

Trends: track how your driving changes with time.  We monitor Distance, Time in traffic, Fuel fill ups, Speed, Economy, Fuel costs and more

Trip tagging:  run experiments or just log your work trip for expenses

Offline trip storage: Flash memory in GOFAR stores your trips even when your phone is dead or not in the car.  

Connect to cloud: Sends your car data to the cloud. 

Ambient light sensor: Automatically adjusts the display to ensure perfect brightness 

RGB LED display: Nine full RGB LEDs provide GOFAR's gorgeous glow

Bluetooth low energy: Provides an easy data connection to your smartphone to sync your trip data and driver stats 

Multi OBD protocol support: Supports four major OBD protocols (J-1850, CAN, ISO, KWP).

No batteries needed: Powered by the car so it just works

Future Proof: Updatable over the air via phone so your car gets smarter!  At least one update a month so far

 
 
 
OUR STORYGOFAR started in Sydney, Australia when our rocket-scientist founder, Danny, realised how real-time feedback on his driving changed and improved his driving style cutting his emissions (and in turn saving him money). It's the same principle that racing teams use to improve car efficiency but Danny set out to make a beautiful and affordable version for every car. The team now comes from every corner of the world including Poland, Brazil, Vietnam, India, UK, China, Finland, Israel and of course USA and Australia and we're all dedicated to making driving cheaper, greener, safer and more fun. We have worked at 3M, GE, Nestle and IBM and amongst the team we have an aerospace engineer who was selected as one of two Australians to attend NASA space camp, a data scientist who got the second highest score in India’s national Maths Olympiad, an Oxford graduate, a budding lawyer who came in the top 0.01% in the country and a design guru who also has a 1st in Mechatronic Engineering.
 
  FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS How much can I save?The biggest improvement we've seen is 28% but it depends on how much you improve and how good you were before!  If you're saving 10% on fuel then over the 10 year life of a car, you might save $2,000 - $4000 depending on how much you drive.  Not bad for the cost of GOFAR, plus your car will benefit from less wear and tear. Will it work in my car? In the USA, GOFAR works in all petrol cars built since 1996 as these have the OBD2 port that we use to connect to the car's hidden treasure trove of data.  In Europe, GOFAR works in all petrol cars built since 2001 and all diesel cars since 2004.In Australia and the rest of the world, GOFAR works with nearly all petrol and diesel cars since 2006.If you are unsure about your car, please visit us for a fast, personal assessment. Will it work with my iOS Apple iPhone?YES.  GOFAR supports iPhone 4s, 5, 5C, 5S, 6, 6+You can also set up GOFAR with an iPod Touch 5 or a connected recent iPad. 
Will it work with my Android phone?YES. We support Android devices which support Bluetooth Low Energy running Android OS v4.3 or newer such as:
Samsung Galaxy S3 and newer
Google Nexus 4 and newer
HTC One M7 and newer
Sony Xperia Z1 and newer

Please contact us if you have questions about Android support telling us your device.Will GOFAR make me drive happy?Our drivers tell us that having a simple mission whilst driving - to keep GOFAR blue - insulates them the moods and road rage of other drivers.  Keeping calm in the car makes driving more enjoyable.   What comes in the box from GOFAR?When we send you your GOFAR, you will get the following
1 * ultra slim GOFAR dongle to plug into your car
1 * award winning "Ray" display 
1 * connecting cable
1 * alcohol wipe 
2 * non-marking, moveable 3M adhesive patches to secure the Ray   
Download the app FIRST for set up instructions.Anything I need to know about shipping?Yes.  First, we will contact you for your phone number (as it makes delivery much easier).  Second, we'll aim to ship orders received within 24-48 hours.  Third, we're shipping from Australia so expect to wait around three weeks typically.  If customs in your country are slow it has taken up to six weeks on some occasions (not often).Fourth, in some countries imported items bought online, like GOFAR, are subject to import duties.  Sometimes these charges are imposed (especially in Europe and Scandinavia) and sometimes they are not.  Unfortunately, there is no way we can influence the import taxes or handling fees as national governments choose to impose these.

story:
Short Summary

Hello! I'm Lisa Nelson and on March 2, 2014, I intend to marry Steel Spokes, my beloved bicycle!  We’ve been together for over 15 years now we are going to make it official AND depart for 6 months on our “Bicycling Honeymoon” to accomplish a variety of ambitious goals that lead to even bigger dreams!  

You will be helping to fund our “Bicycling Honeymoon.”  The goal is to create, connect, and build community while on bicycle over the course of six months.  The ultimate dream is to launch a university program, *Semester on Cycle.   In order to do so, I shall reduce my already shoestring budget, and attempt to finish my degree, and test a bunch of stuff from the road.  This is all about “getting by [a ride] with a little help from your friends” as the song goes.  Can it be done?  We think so!  We have lots to get done!  The specific goals are listed below.

My darling husband and I shall begin by riding down the coast of California, and let fate take its course as to our particular destinations…the world is our oyster (and I like oysters)!  I have my passport charged up!   

What We Need & What You Gets

  •  Your generous funds shall go towards getting my beloved Steel Spoke (bicycle) set up for the expedition, and purchasing camping gear and clothing items (primarily used) that we still need.  Some minor technical website modifications need to be made.  Also, funds will help support my darling and I, and the various projects that we intend to experiment with, on the road for the next 4-6 months.  Our goal is to raise $6000.  The length of the “honeymoon” will depend upon whether our funding goal is met.  

  • Any money received beyond our funding goal will go towards a scholarship to fund economically disadvantaged students on the *Semester on Cycle program!  If by chance Semester on Cycle does not happen, the money will be publically donated to an inspired cycling program(s).  I promise!

  • In return, you will receive one-of-a-kind perks related to the adventure.  From live virtual participation in "Spokes Interview Unique Folks" talk show to original art work, we have unique fun gifts to offer at every support level. 

  • You will not be funding the wedding!  Our Hawaiian-themed bicycle wedding will be a simple, inexpensive, wacky little affair –but we will take lots of photos and film it to share with everyone.  Nor will you be funding hotels or fine dining.  We intend to camp, Couch Surf, and stay with old and new friends along the way.  Our budget is $20 a day for lodging and food.  Anything fancier than that will only be by way of kind donations along the way.  

The Impact

The goal is to accomplish all of the goals below so as to be in an opportune place to launch the **“Semester on Cycle” program.  People who are already interested in the world around them seek out good resources in a community.  Unfortunately, those who most need to be inspired, encouraged, and connected to resources are the least likely to know about and take advantage of the resources around them.  That is why I am aiming to ultimately create a model Semester on Cycle program, that can be initiated, launched, and travel to where it is needed most.  Passion Begets Passion!

**Semester on Cycle is a proposed model university education program that not only provides an exceptional experience for the cycling participants, but also offers effective methods of connecting with community members and assisting people in need (Read more details at: http://questforzest.org/mission/).

 

Here are some of the specific goals of our “Honeymoon”:

  •  Experiment with collaborative art and music projects.
  •  Connect with community and people through service.
  • Test bike and camping equipment and gear .
  •  Complete the “Semester on Cycle” program model & work out kinks.
  • Connect with people via a blog and other online media to share our “Honeymoon” experience.
  •  Finish writing my (Lisa) dissertation for my Ph.D. in Higher Education Administration (this way I’ve got the goofy credentials universities seem to want to teach students and take them on impactful excursions in the US & throughout the world).
  •  Advance my Spanish language skills.
  • Complete an educational “Service Learning” book I (Lisa) started.

Why together, Steel & I can pull this off!

Believe it or not, all of these plans are a serious culmination of my personal and professional experiences, and there is a dreamy, but practical, end goal in mind.  I have had the good fortune to work with students from high school (delinquent to privileged youth) to college age leading adventure and service experiences in the United States and abroad for a non-profit organization, for-profit tour companies, and through a university. 

I am no spring chicken!  I spent 15 years in the non-profit and legal world working with troubled families and children.  After years of feeling like I was simply putting Band-Aids on problems, I shifted gears to go into an academic setting in the hopes of working with students to find real world solutions to some major problems that plague disadvantaged communities throughout the U.S.  Also, I am not new to bicycle touring.  I just have not done it in any a major way in over 15 years.  The last time I led a group of students on bicycles was pre-internet, pre-cell phone, pre-GPS, pre-portable computer…and certainly pre-solar and bike-generator power potential.  Holy! I know I can figure it out.  I just need the opportunity to experiment, finish my writing, and share what I learn to others.  

Why cycling?

As a young adult, I never rode a bike more than 5 miles nor grew up playing any sort of sports.  I started riding a bike through working at an exceptional non-profit program that focused on turning delinquent youth on to positive programing…such as biking. It turned not only the kids, but me, on to bicycling.  I think travel on bicycle is the perfect speed to take in surroundings.  It’s “green” and good for our carbon footprint.  Plus, it is great exercise, presents unique challenges, and inevitably provides a memorable adventure.  Most anyone can ride a bike, and if I can cycle long distances…I know that anyone can!  

Why music, arts and service?

I believe that the success of Semester on Cycle will be dependent upon how quickly and effectively the student participants can connect and develop a level of trust with the people in the communities that are visited.  Interactive music, art and service projects are all effective ways to connect with people, and share an experience and create a moment –regardless of your economic mean, color, education, age, sex, sexual preference, or heritage.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone is in a great financial spot to help us with such a project.  So besides money, here's some other ways you could help:

  • Spread the word! If you like what we're up to, please pass this along to others!!  We only have a month!  You get the best reward for that…good karma!!  
  • Another way to spread the word is through the use of the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Donation items! On our blog (http://questforzest.org/wish-list/), we’ll keep an updated list of needed items, so if you happen to have or know of someone who has such things, we would most appreciate it.    

Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!

of sports.  I started riding a bike
through working at an exceptional non-profit program that focused on turning
delinquent youth on to positive programing…such as biking. It turned not only
the kids, but me, on to bicycling.  I think travel on bicycle is the perfect
speed to take in surroundings.  It’s “green” and good for our carbon
footprint.  Plus, it is great exercise,
presents unique challenges, and inevitably provides a memorable adventure.  Most anyone can ride a bike, and if I can
cycle long distances…I know that anyone can!  
Why music, arts and service? 
I
believe that the success of Semester on
Cycle will be dependent upon how quickly and effectively the student participants
can connect and develop a level of trust with the people in the communities
that are visited.  Interactive music, art
and service projects are all effective ways to connect with people, and share
an experience and create a moment –regardless of your economic mean, color,
education, age, sex, sexual preference, or heritage.Other Ways You Can HelpI understand that not everyone is in a great financial spot to help us with such a project.  So besides money, here's some other ways you could help:

Spread the word! If you like what we're up to, please pass this along to others!!  We only have a month!  You get the best reward for that…good karma!!  


Another way to spread the word is through the use of the Indiegogo share tools!

Donation items! On our blog (http://questforzest.org/wish-list/),
we’ll keep an updated list of needed items, so if you happen to have or know of
someone who has such things, we would most appreciate it.    

Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!

story:
New Materials For Space Exploration

Picture: simulated cosmic rays hitting earth's atmosphere

Radiation is the most dangerous aspect of space travel. Humanity is actively returning to space:
A moon mission, a journey to Mars, a space gateway, … Becoming a multi-planetary species requires technologies that are not available today. New materials technologies are needed to shield spacecraft's from cosmic radiations. 

We research applications for space, air and earth-based systems that are sensitive to radiation.

Subscribe to our newsletter to receive updates

Picture: conceptual representation of a possible research outcome

Our materials research falls into three categories:

  • Improvement of computational models.  
  • Development of multifunctional material properties for use in system optimization procedures.  
  • Design of optimum radiation protective materials to finish out deficiencies in the shield design at minimum mass and costs.

Our R&D Approach

The development of earth independence will extend human presence beyond low Earth orbit and cislunar space and onto Mars. The radiation exposures in deep space are largely from galactic cosmic rays or GCR. Among the types of radiation, the high energies associated with GCR have the most important biological effects.

Today, no effective direct ionizing radiation shielding is designed or implemented on the most advanced human spacecraft for deep-space missions. New technologies need being developed to increase crew mission duration in the space radiation environment. 

Particularly, which novel advanced research methods can be applied to design and manufacture advanced materials or combination of materials to lower the radiation level, inside a spacecraft, down to a level known “as low as reasonably achievable”?

Reach out to learn more about our approach

Our Credentials

EmTDLab was invited to pitch this project during the Global Space and Technology Conference (GSTC) in Singapore.

Picture: GSTC Judges Panel

Our project was selected among a limited number of participants to be presented to space agencies and investors.

You can watch the entire live pitch on our YouTube Channel.

We received media coverage during a "knowledge explainer" interview realised by btcn.asia, a media dedicated to innovative technologies in Asia.

Picture: Media coverage during GSTC, Cedric Thiry, EmTDLab CEO interview

You can watch the full interview and Radiation Knowledge Explainer here.

Our Goal: Start-up capital to escalate

The initial phase of the project has been covered by self-financing. This allowed EmTDLab to complete the basic research. Now, we need HK$ 790,000 fresh financing to elaborate our technology concept and formulate the application of our Space Radiation Protection Technologies - In other currencies this rounds up to: Euros: 95k or Singapore$: 145k or US$: 100k.

How do we use the funds? 

Click here: Detailed use of funds

Ask A Specific Question

    Your Impact? Advancing the future of space exploration.

    Your contribution will help to advance the future of space exploration. As of May 2020, 565 people have been in space (FAI definition). This was over a period of 59 years (1961-2020). By 2060, only 40 years from now, Mars only could be home to a self-sustaining colony of a million people (Bobby Braun, former NASA CTO, now Georgia Tech Professor).

    Picture: Scientific Moonbase (credit SpaceX) shuttled by 100 passengers Starship

    By backing our project you create immediate impact. Every dollar in the funding goes to  research and development of new advanced materials for space radiation protection. This has never been done by any private venture before.

    Beyond Low Earth Orbit (LEO), across the Van Allen Belts and en route to the Moon, Mars and beyond, astronauts need to be protected from radiation. Within the next  10 years (2020-2030), there will be plenty of exciting moments of space travel, planetary research, and even colonization: SpaceX Dragon Demo-2 to ISS (2020), NASA Mars Rover Launch Toward Mars (2020), ExoMars Reaches the Martian Surface (2021), Roscosmos Begins Offering Space Tours (2021), India Enters Crewed Spaceflight (2021-2022), SpaceX Launches a Mission to Mars (2022), China Launches a Third Space Station (2022), ESA Creates an Asteroid Insurance Policy (2023), SpaceX's First Moon Tourism Trip (2023), OSIRIS-REx's Asteroid Sample Return (2023), NASA's Artemis Mission To The Moon (2024), JAXA's Takes a Trip to the Martian Moons (2025), The U.S. Habitat Arrives at the Lunar Gateway (2025), NASA's Mission to Titan (2026), ESA's JUICE Explorer Arrives at Jupiter (2029), NASA Mission to Mars (2030s).

    Space exploration is our ultimate goal. However, we know by experience that, during that journey we will make discoveries that will lead to applications closer to our daily concerns: new materials for airplanes and materials for radiation protection on earth. 

    What You Get?

    For every contribution you make, you will receive exclusive perks that make you part of a unique space exploration program. Based on your degree of involvement you will benefit from rewards that display your name as an early contributor, receive fashionable apparel, display your company name as sponsor, get branded outdoor equipment and be able to test for radiation levels at home. Check our detailed list of perks on this campaign page.

    Picture: Overview of our branded perks

    Who are we?

    In the last 15 years our founder has seen multiple technology start-up fail. At EmTDLab, we build our story using all these lessons learned. 

    Picture: Our founder's career track

    This project is built on solid foundations and relying on the founder’s experience in similar ventures. The adequate organisational model has been designed to sustain a progressive development of the venture, meaning at every step of the development stage, the organisation will grow to support the progress.

    Be part of something unique

    Joining our team of early stage backers will make you part of a unique project that will allow deep space exploration and planet colonization a realistic success: we are advancing the future of space exploration by supporting human travel to space.

    Read more about our mission

    EmTDLab is the sole privately owned, non academic, non military venture with European roots based in South East Asia that conducts research and development in that field.

    Ask A Specific Question

    Learn more about our organization

    Other Ways You Can Help

    You can contribute for a small amount, or for another amount you choose by yourself.

    If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help: get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. You know a friend who is passionate about space exploration? Share our project with him. Do you find interesting posts on our social media platforms? Leave a comment, make a like or share the updates. That will have a significant impact on our campaign as well.

    Finally, remember you can use the Indiegogo share tools!


     

    Subscribe to our newsletter to receive updates

    NOW, YOU ARE ADVANCING THE FUTURE OF SPACE EXPLORATION
