The smelly chemicals are confined and permanently sealed within a secure hollow chamber throughout the lock.  The only way you may expose the chemicals is by trying to cut through it with an angle grinder (even then it wouldn’t be easy).
SKUNKLOCK is STRONG - stronger than the highest quality U-Locks on the market.  The lock is made from hardened medium-carbon steel that exceeds 450 brinell.  The difference is that if a thief cuts far enough through to puncture the seal, the lock will release smelly chemicals stopping the thief in their tracks.
SKUNKLOCK is LEGAL - We have taken the necessary precautions to ensure that the SkunkLock is legal and compliant with US laws and regulations.  On March 2016, we conducted a survey of state laws within the United States regarding the sale and ownership of SkunkLock products.  We have identified that there are some possible limitations of shipping the SkunkLock to certain states within the US due to the fact that some versions of the SkunkLock may contain capsaicin compounds. We know that these regulations were enacted with pepper spray in mind. Although the SkunkLock is not strictly a pepper spray product, in order to ensure compliance, we may initially reserve our right to refuse directly selling and shipping our SkunkLock product to certain states or countries. However, we also reserve the right to ship SkunkLock products that contain our alternative formula that does not utilize capsaicin as a primary irritant; thus, ensuring our compliance in those states. Please visit our website for further information and our latest stance on legal compliance and check with your local and State laws as these may differ from state to state and country by country.

 

 



 


Is the SkunkLock guaranteed to prevent theft?
No lock can guarantee someone will not go the extra mile to steal your bike or motorcycle, especially if it’s expensive and worth the risk (and discomfort in our case).  However, the SkunkLock does provide you the best chance of deterring theft by being the least attractive lock to compromise on your block.  Thieves will generally take a slightly less profitable bike if the risk is significantly less.  If a thief compromises the SkunkLock, not only are they exposing themselves to chemicals, someone nearby may be asking what that smell is.
Note: the SkunkLock won't work if you don't lock your bike properly, or fail to lock your bike completely.  For example, if you only use one SkunkLock on your back wheel and frame (the two most expensive parts of your bike), then your front wheel may still be stolen.
Can't a thief just wear a mask or protection?
Technically, yes.  Will it help them steal your bike? Probably not.  The formula that we've developed is detectable through even some of the most robust gas masks (unfortunately, we learned this the hard way!).  More importantly, we aren't strictly relying on chemicals incapacitating the thief to prevent the theft.  There is no technology that can guarantee theft prevention; however, we do believe SKUNKLOCK is the best lock on the market to deter theft.  Not only does an attack on the SKUNKLOCK release chemicals onto the thief that create a scene that makes people take notice, it also has economic implications for the thief.  Our formula irreversibly ruins the clothes worn by the thief or any of the protection they may be wearing, and replacing these items is likely more expensive than the resale value of your stolen bike (generally only 1/10 of the retail price).  You don't need to be perfect, you just have to be the best protected on your block.  So more than likely, a thief will attack a more hassle free bike parked nearby than your bike.
How durable is the SkunkLock?
The SkunkLock is made from the strongest materials we could find.  We’ve developed a comprehensive testing process to test for extreme wear and tear and are confident that it can be used for many years without any problems.
What if I lose my key?
Each SkunkLock comes with an industry standard unique code which you may use to request additional keys.  Keys will have the option for overnight mail in order to ensure you receive replacements as soon as possible.
Is SkunkLock a "Smart Lock"?
No, and for good reason! Smart Locks (think those with fingerprint readers, GPS trackers, alarms, or are app enabled) are actually pretty dumb when it comes to preventing your bike from being stolen. We've tried and tested many new Smart enabled locks that have become available on the market.  Each lock was just as easy to cut through with an angle grinder (if not easier) or was easily disabled.  But worse, the technology in each lock created more vulnerabilities than security.  For these reasons, SkunkLock is a purely mechanical and chemical solution to deterring theft. READ THIS SUMMARY for more information.
 


 

The primary risks for getting SKUNKLOCK in your hands are:
• Scaling: We believe SKUNKLOCK is the best lock on the market, but it's undoubtedly more complex than a simple U-Lock to manufacture.  This is why we have set realistic benchmarks for distribution and have already created relationships with manufacturers with the ability to scale in the event we receive higher than expected demand.  We also developed a comprehensive plan to engage partnering manufacturers as we reach demand milestones to scale faster.  
• Legal Compliance: Each and every Country and State has its own rules and regulations.  As a result, we took initiative and conducted comprehensive surveys in each State in the U.S. and are conducting additional risk assessments to ensure your SKUNKLOCK is compliant prior to shipment. 
 

On behalf of the SKUNKLOCK Team, we want to thank all of our supporters, backers, partners, friends, and evangelists that have helped us get here!  We couldn't have done it without your support!
We want to especially thank the hundreds of bicyclists and motorcyclists that have contributed their feedback to help make the SKUNKLOCK as good as it can be, and our friends at Monday Motorbikes for their continued support and believing in the potential the SKUNKLOCK has to impact theft in a positive way.  
 

www.skunklock.com
support@skunklock.com

story:
This is Ampler – the cleanest-looking electric bike

Ampler is a smart electric bike for the urban commuter that gets you further without breaking a sweat. Riding Ampler is simple – you simply cycle. The smart electronics fitted within the frame measure the power you apply and simply match it, making pedalling lighter and getting places quicker. With a range of up to 100 km (62 mi), you’ll never have to worry about the range either. Starting at 14 kg (31 lbs), Ampler is just as light as a normal bicycle and 35% lighter than the average electric bike. 

 
Buying an Ampler is hassle free - all bikes are assembled in Europe and delivered to your door free of charge. That's right - no hidden costs. All shipping fees and taxes in the EU are already taken care of.
 

Key features


 

Here's what's been said about Ampler Bikes so far: 

"Someday all bikes will be like the electric Ampler Hawk" – Thomas Ricker, The Verge

"Practical, stylish, and powerful" – Derek Markham, TreeHugger

 

"Ampler has designed, perhaps, one of the best electric bikes for urban commuting.” - Madan, damngeeky.com

 

"Ampler has made a major design change to accommodate electrical systems” - Kote Puerto, xataka.com

"The company has introduced smart sensors and intelligent assist built-in features that will measure the road condition and surround area so riders do not have to accelerate manually by twisting a grip." – Hoai Bac Le, Arctic Startup

“Ampler is a brand of e-bikes that I could really imagine riding” – Antje, welovetobike.de

"Commuter electric bikes that are designed to look stylish" – Christiane Rauscher, ElektroBIKE Magazine

 

How Ampler came to be

We’ve been building electric bikes for nearly 3 years now. Our initial goal was simple – getting from point A to B on a bicycle in an effortless and fun fashion. We put together our first prototypes with the intention of making a practical yet beautiful electric bike. After building different prototypes, we managed to come up with a frame design that allowed us to fit the battery and electronics inside the frame, making the final result look exactly like a regular good-looking bicycle would. By using premium parts and clever design, we’ve managed to keep the bicycle light.

With your support on Indiegogo, we will bring these bikes into production. By backing Ampler, you will be part of creating a shift in the world of electric bikes, where all bikes are practical, great-looking and built with quality in mind.
 

PhD in Electric Assist

What makes Ampler’s electric bikes special is the way that they assist you. Simply put, the smart microchips constantly measure the torque you apply when you pedal. This information is passed on to the motor which applies the same amount of electric assist.

 

When you first receive the bike, the default maximum power output will be 250W, which gives you extra oomph till the speed of 25 km/h (15,5 mph). The power output and speed are user-configurable with the Ampler smartphone app, developed specifically for Ampler Bikes by coModule. 
 

So why do I need the app again?

 

 

Actually, you don’t need it to ride Ampler bikes. The app simply lets you customize your riding experience. In the smartphone app, you can adjust:

  • Motor power – increase or decrease your acceleration

  • Max assist speed – the speed at which the assist stops helping you

  • Assist level – how much the motor assists you in proportion to your input
On top of configuring all this, our app lets you see how much range in kilometers you have left in your battery. It also helps navigate with the built in maps capability, share your rides on social networks, receive updates to your bike’s electronics (that’s right, Ampler is that smart) and directly contact Ampler Bikes. We respond within 24 hours on all weekdays. 
The app is available for both Android and iOS.
 

Charge the streets like a bull

 

 

You’ll reach every place you need with one charge – hell, you probably make it through the week with one charge with an average battery assisted range of 60 km (43 mi). If you run out of juice, you simply pedal on like you would on a regular bike. Charging the battery from drained to full takes just 3 hours.

The charger connects to the bike with a weather-proof magnetic plug. And why is it magnetic? Because the charger and the person stay safe in case someone trips over the charging cable. It simply snaps away without breaking anything or anyone.

The charger is compatible both with EU and US electrical voltage and plug.

 

B is for Battery, E is for Electronics, D is for Durable

We’ve designed our own battery and electronics which are hidden deep within the frame. This keeps the looks minimalist while also hiding both from the elements and other external factors. The batteries are so durable that even after cycling for 30,000 km (18,640 mi), you still have 70% of the original capacity left. 

Should you still want to change your battery, we’ve designed the frame and the battery in such a way that every professional bike shop could easily remove the old battery and attach the new one in under an hour. Spare battery can be purchased from us directly.

During 2 years of warranty we will send you new one with instructions to change it. After the warranty period the new battery will cost around 350 EUR.
 

 

Frame – where classic design meets modern build technology

The custom-designed frame is built with great looks and practicality in mind, so that people in all shapes and sizes could go places in style. The modern build technology keeps the aluminium frame light yet sturdy and comfortable. It’s also rust-proof, which means that salt and water leave no marks on your bike. The frames come in two shapes – step through and diamond, as well as two sizes, which cover heights of 155 - 200 cm (5.1 ft - 6.6 ft). 

 

 

 

Perks and Models – Hawk

 

Hawk – like the name suggests – is a fast, light and sporty aggressive-looking urban commuter, designed with speed and agility in mind. It features a carbon racing fork, and a simple and reliable single-speed drivetrain. Integrated electronics and light componentry create the aggressive feel and looks, which make the riding experience equally exciting. The aluminium frame makes the bike rust-proof and sturdy while keeping the weight down to a minimum.  

You can choose the frame cut and frame size in the simple survey we will send you via email directly after you’ve selected your perk and backed our campaign.

 

Key features

  • Lightweight at 14 kg (31 lbs)

  • All electronics fitted within the frame

  • Average range of 70 km (43 mi) on one charge

  • Charges in 3 hours

  • Smooth and quiet pedal assist

  • Comfortable saddle and grips

  • Customizable ride experience with the smartphone app built by coModule

There are no hidden costs - all shipping fees and taxes in EU, US and Canada have already been taken care of.


Colors available: Hawk

 

Perks and Models – Bilberry

 

Bilberry is an elegant and comfortable town bike that combines a great ride with a classic look. It’s a trustworthy companion for your daily rides, making them something to look forward to. The aluminium frame is built to be sturdy and rust-proof yet keeping the bike light enough to lift and carry.

You can choose the frame cut and frame size in the simple survey we will send you via email directly after you’ve selected your perk and backed our campaign.
 

Key features

  • Upright riding position

  • Lightweight at 17 kg (37 lbs)

  • All electronics fitted within the frame

  • Average range of 70 km (43 mi) on one charge

  • Charges in 3 hours

  • Smooth and quiet pedal assist

  • Comfortable saddle and grips

  • Customizable ride experience with the smartphone app built by coModule

There are no hidden costs - all shipping fees and taxes in EU, US and Canada have already been taken care of.

 

Colors available: Bilberry

 

Perks and Models – T-Shirt with Ampler Bikes logo

 

Love Ampler Bikes? Get our branded and super comfy t-shirt and support the smartest electric bike by repping it everywhere you go. The t-shirt comes in all sizes for both Men’s and Women’s cuts.

 

How the bikes get to your hands and feet

We have an already established supply chain which will make sure that the bikes will be delivered on time.
 

How you win with Indiegogo

 

Team

Hannes Laar
Hannes is a passionate bicycle enthusiast, BMX rider and engineering student with years of experience in bicycle mechanics and componentry. Hannes takes care of bicycle design, components and assembly.

Ardo Kaurit 
Ardo is former professional motocross racer who’s been working with technology since childhood. Some years later with a degree in mechatronics, Ardo is now responsible for developing the frames and the electronics of all Ampler bikes. Additionally, Ardo takes care of administering the business side of things at Ampler. 

Rait Udumäe
Rait is an experienced engineer and an active entrepreneur. Having good knowledge of CAD and CAM software, Rait is responsible for mechanical design.

Mathias Lindholm
Mathias is a senior designer with extensive experience in the fields of branding, typography, graphic design and user interface design. Mathias is responsible for the brand identity and most of the design material.

Ott Ilves
Ott takes care of marketing at Ampler, focusing on nailing the messaging about Ampler and getting the word about the bikes out and about.

Melissa Sepp
Melissa is marketing and advertising enthusiast with experience in video production and advertising campaigns. Melissa helps Ampler to produce audiovisual content and actively manage the campaign.

Kristen Gilden
Kristen is a web developer by trade and he’s the chief suspect of developing Ampler’s handsome website.

 

Why we need your support

We've been working on Ampler bikes for two and a half years by this point, and we are now at the point where we need your help to kickstart the production of the bikes. Each contribution means a lot to us and helps us get closer to our goal. 

The funds raised will be used for:

  • Establishing a solid production line

  • Establishing a direct-to-consumer distribution chain

And here’s what's in it for you guys:

  • You'll be the first to get an Ampler bike

  • You’ll get the bike cheaper than the regular price

  • We guarantee you’ll get an unforgettable augmented cycling experience that will bring a smile to your face

 

Frequently Asked Questions

In short, the two bikes have very different personalities. Hawk is sporty while Bilberry is elegant. Hawk features a single-speed drivetrain while Bilberry has a 9-speed drivetrain. Hawk is also a little lighter at 14 kg (31 lbs) compared to Bilberry’s 17 kg (37 lbs). However, Bilberry has other comfort-oriented perks, such as the upright riding position, a wider seat and full fenders to combat rain.

  1. Where’s the battery?
    All electronics and the battery are hidden within the frames. This keeps the looks minimalist while also hiding both from the elements and other external factors.
     
  2. What’s the difference between Hawk and Bilberry?
  3. How much do the bikes weigh?
    Hawk weighs 14 kg (31 lbs) and Bilberry weighs 17 kg (37 lbs)
     

  4. How often do I have to charge the battery? 
    The average range of the electric assist is 70 km (43 mi), and if you run out of juice, you simply pedal on like you would on a regular bike. Charging the battery from drained to full takes only 3 hours. You can connect your charger to any regular power outlet.

  5. What happens when the battery dies?
    After running out of battery power or turning off the assist, you can still ride with Ampler as you would do with a regular bicycle.

  6. Can I charge the battery by pedalling?
    No, the batteries in Ampler bikes can only be charged with the charger that’s provided with the bike upon purchase. However, if you run out of battery power, you can pedal on like you would on a regular bicycle.

  7. Can the battery be removed?
    Yes. The frame and the battery are designed in such a way that every professional bike shop could remove the battery, and if needed, replace it with a new one in under one hour.

  8. How do I take care of the bikes?
    Maintenance is carried out as on a regular bicycle and every professional bike shop will be able to maintain our bikes.

  9. How are the bikes delivered?
    Bikes are safely packed in a box and require minimal assembling.

  10.  

    How much does the shipping cost? 
    Nothing.  All Ampler bikes are delivered to your door free of charge. Additionally, all shippings fees and taxes in EU, US and Canada have already been taken care of.

  11. How to assemble the bike when delivered to my door?
    Assembling the bike is super simple. We include the instructions with the bike. You can do it yourself or, if you prefer, take it to a local bike shop.

  12. Do you offer warranty?  
    Yes. All Ampler bikes are covered for 2 years. However, the normal wear of tires, brake pads, chainrings, chain, and bearings is an inevitable part of cycling thus not covered.

  13. Do you sell bike accessories?
    Not yet, but we are soon planning to add fenders, rear racks, lights, baskets and bells to our accessories. Stay tuned for more information.

  14. Where can I buy repair parts and components?
    The battery is custom-made for us, so you will be able to buy it only from us. We will send you a replacement battery and instructions for the procedure needed. Other, more common bike components can be bought either from us or from any professional bike shop.

  15. Are the bikes street legal?
    Yes. Our bikes are capable of a top speed of 35km/h (21,7 mph) but by default are limited according to EN15194 to the top speed of 25 km/h (15,5 mph). This means that the motor will only help you up to 25km/h. You can change these settings from the smartphone app.

  16. What happens if you don’t reach your goal?
    We have an already established supply chain which will make sure that you will get your bike even if we don’t reach our goal on Indiegogo.

  17. Can I test ride the bikes?
    You can test ride the bikes in the following locations and dates:

  • Berlin, Germany: 16.04 - 17.04 at Velo Berlin

  • Helsinki, Finland: 24.04 at Länsiväyläjuoksu, Espoo

  • Tallinn, Estonia: 07.05 at Vabaduse Väljak 

  • Helsinginkatu, Helsinki, Finland: 14.05 at Hesari Juhli (Postponed to 28.05)

  • Tallinn, Estonia: 21.05 - 22.05 at Kalamaja Päevad

  • Tallinn, Estonia – Every day in our studio at Paldiski mnt 25 B. Please contact us beforehand to make sure we're in the studio.

How much does the shipping cost? Nothing.  All Ampler bikes are delivered to your door free of charge. Additionally, all shippings fees and taxes in EU, US and Canada have already been taken care of.

How to assemble the bike when delivered to my door?Assembling the bike is super simple. We include the instructions with the bike. You can do it yourself or, if you prefer, take it to a local bike shop.
Do you offer warranty?  Yes. All Ampler bikes are covered for 2 years. However, the normal wear of tires, brake pads, chainrings, chain, and bearings is an inevitable part of cycling thus not covered.
Do you sell bike accessories? Not yet, but we are soon planning to add fenders, rear racks, lights, baskets and bells to our accessories. Stay tuned for more information. 
Where can I buy repair parts and components? The battery is custom-made for us, so you will be able to buy it only from us. We will send you a replacement battery and instructions for the procedure needed. Other, more common bike components can be bought either from us or from any professional bike shop.
Are the bikes street legal?Yes. Our bikes are capable of a top speed of 35km/h (21,7 mph) but by default are limited according to EN15194 to the top speed of 25 km/h (15,5 mph). This means that the motor will only help you up to 25km/h. You can change these settings from the smartphone app.
What happens if you don’t reach your goal?We have an already established supply chain which will make sure that you will get your bike even if we don’t reach our goal on Indiegogo.
Can I test ride the bikes?You can test ride the bikes in the following locations and dates:


Berlin, Germany: 16.04 - 17.04 at Velo Berlin
Helsinki, Finland: 24.04 at Länsiväyläjuoksu, Espoo
Tallinn, Estonia: 07.05 at Vabaduse Väljak 
Helsinginkatu, Helsinki, Finland: 14.05 at Hesari Juhli (Postponed to 28.05)
Tallinn, Estonia: 21.05 - 22.05 at Kalamaja Päevad
Tallinn, Estonia – Every day in our studio at Paldiski mnt 25 B. Please contact us beforehand to make sure we're in the studio.

story:
Matt Hendrix has been racing dirt bike since 2008. He started out on a 85cc and then moved to an 85cc super mini. A super mini is an advanced version of the bike. He raced for a couple years and then under very unfortunate circumstances he had to sell his bike and stop racing. Then due to family support he was able to buy a used Yamaha 250cc, four stroke. The top end needs to be fixed and the suspension needs work. We are doing this fundraiser to get Matt's bike fixed and to get him racing the last part of the season and ready for next year. We just bought a new neck brace, chest protector and helmet for him.

Matt races in district 23. In 2009 he got 5th in his district in the 85cc class 12-15, out of 108 people. He also got 8th in the district for the 85cc class 9-12, out of 104 people. Also that year he got 17th in his district in the Super mini class, out of 90 people. He raced over 40 races to receive those spots. Each race you gain so many points and those points at the end of the year are your spots over all in the district. Matt didn't get to race much after 2010 and once he got his 250 last year he practiced when he could and tried to get stuff going again. One difficulty after another has kept Matt from racing so far this year. Matt only got to race one day, mother's day in two heats before his bike needed the forks replaced. :(

On mother's day Matt got third in his first Moto and second in his second Moto, so second overall. It was his FIRST TIME racing in over two years and FIRST TIME racing on his 250. There were 16 people in each race. He did very good for that day! He received a trophy and has many trophies from the previous years. He has placed first, second, and third in many races, in the couple of seasons he raced. 

The goal of 500 is for parts and labor to get the bike up to par for racing conditions and up keep after. If we reach the goal we can always go over. Fixing a bike for racing is different from just leisure riding. The bike needs to have special attention to detail when fixing the bike and also more sturdier parts, because of the hard use of the bike. The wear and tear of races every weekend takes its toll on the bike and up keep is very important after the bike is fixed. Each race costs money to enter and if we reach our goal, the extra money will go towards racing and up keep. If we don't reach our goal, the funds that are donated will be used to get started on fixing the bike. Any amount helps and we are very grateful for all contributions and help to make dreams come true.

The perks of donating come in the form of t-shirts, stickers, posters, and company logos on his bike for the big sponsors. We have three different options for t-shirts. One option is $25 for a white 90% cotton 10% polyester blend shirt that on the front has a printed image of Matt going over a jump with his name and number. The second option is $35 for a white with blue side stripes 100% polyester shirt with moisture wicking technology to keep you cooler. The image of Matt will be on the back with his name and number on the front. The image and text will be heat transferred onto the shirt which creates a bond with the fabric and lasts longer.

The third option is $40 for a gray 90% cotton 10% polyester blend shirt with an image of Matt going over a jump and the words Never Look Back on the back and his name and number on the front. This shirt will only be available at a limited quantity. It is a bigger image and harder to produce. If you have any questions on how to order the t-shirts or want more info about the fundraiser email 441mhendrix@gmail.com

** Pictures of shirts in gallery **

*Let us know your t-shirt size. We might be doing only men's sizes, but we will let you know. Also if we don't offer a combo of shirts that you want email us and we can probably work out a deal :D*

*Special Thanks to Minneapolis Custom for sponsoring Matt and providing us with these great t-shirts*

For the bigger sponsors we can offer to put your logo on his bike and on all our up and coming flyers and advertising. We will promote your business through promotion of Matt and let everyone know who is sponsoring his racing. Your company will get publicity through his promotion. Any chance we get we will promote your business as one of Matt's sponsors. Matt in the past has gave his trophies, and other items to companies that have sponsored him. They can display the items in their stores and show their customers how they sponsor a local racer. He can promote your business on other items as well. If you sponsor him and have clothing or other items he can use while racing or in off season he will make sure to use them. Any questions or more information email 441mhendrix@gmail.com 

Matt has loved riding and racing dirt bike since he started. He has always been the Evil Kenevil type, riding skate board, bmx bikes and doing stunts on everything he can get his hands on. He has always been good at sports and gets good grades in school. He is a hard worker and is smart about his racing style. He wants to go places in racing dirt bike and needs the support to get there. Watching Matt race dirt bike is such a thrill and adventure. As soon as he can get racing again everyone is invited to come to them. He has received many trophies, plaques, and achievements in the couple years he has raced and wants to keep his good record going. 

If you are unable to donate, but would love to help, we have many options for people to get involved. You can let all your friends and family know about the fundraiser and connect them with the link. You can share this site through Facebook and other social media. If you have any other fundraiser ideas please let us know. If you know of any companies that sponsor up and coming young adults in sports let us know. Matt will need to get the parts for his bike, so if anyone knows any parts places that will offer a discount for sponsorship, please let us know. He will need oil and the basic amenities to keep the bike up and people sponsor that part by paying for the necessities each month. If you can think of any other ways of offering your services please let us know. 441mhendrix@gmail.com

** any blue links on the page are not affiliated with us except the email link**

story: Luna Sharlotte Humerez grew up in El Alto, a quickly-growing city north of La Paz, Bolivia. She is brilliant and unapologetic. Luna is also the first trans woman to get married in Bolivia. Recently, she was invited to the WorldOut Games, a conference hosted annually to celebrate the LGBTQ+ community. The organization will cover the cost of her registration fee and accommodation in Miami. This is where you come in. Luna needs $1,200 to cover the cost of two flights to Miami for her and her husband. Please consider donating today so that Luna can keep inspiring young, queer folks -- like me! -- to demand justice and visibility.

story:
In a world of "everywhere always the same" we have put together the very first customization process for one of the best eScooter in the market nowadays: the Nexity Sonic series.

Let's say the truth: turning your head and finding out a car, a motorbike, a t-shirt or even an eScooter exactly the same as ours is a bit boring. In Nexity we want to take to the market a simple and fast on-line process to stand out from the masses on top of a high-end eScooter, whose performances aren't second to no one. So not only you'll ride a custom or even a one-off eScooter, but also you'll have under your feet a formidable premium electric device.

The Nexity Sonic eScooters go fast (up to 32 Km/h - 20 Mph), they run long (up to 45 Km - 28 Mi autonomy), ride safe (triple braking system, oversized 10'' wheels), work smart (removable Cruise Control & Panasonic battery with Intelligent BMS), look cool (curvilinear aerospace aluminum frame) and, last but not least they

STAND OUT FROM THE CROWD!

These are our standard black Nexity X7 Sonic and X8 Sonic:
 

Close your eyes and imagine any custom design applied on your Nexity eScooter! Now open your eyes: YES, YOU CAN DO IT, with 15 cool designs right now!

 

Not only we have taken to the market one of the best premium electric scooter for 2021 season, but we have also created a full line of exciting wrap-stickers to make your Scooter a real one-off!

We have lost the counting of how many times we have cut millimeter by millimeter the prototypes, tested different materials and thicknesses, wrapped and unwrapped hundreds of times, and finally we have reached the perfect balance of brilliance, simplicity in the application process (including detach-attach multiple times to eliminate wrong applications), resistance to scratches, water and long sun/cold exposures. This is why we have chosen the highest quality wrapping film, therefore the 3M Scotchcal Graphic Film IJ35C, the same used to wrap Rally & Dakar cars & trucks!

You can apply our 3M hi-grade wrapping stickers at room temperature, reposition any component as many times you need and then activate it with the final pressure, when you have found the perfect placing. 

Because Nexity Sonic models share the frame (and just this!) with other brands, you can also perk just the sticker and customize your eScooter from Amazon, Blaupunkt, Cecotec, Carrefour, Grundig, Levy, Renault, Turboant and Vivobike (check carefully the correspondence of your model frame with our X7 Sonic and X8 Sonic versions).

Discover in deep the key-winning factors which position Nexity eScooters on a clear superior quality level:

NEXITY X7 SONIC

NEXITY X8 SONIC

If you aren't yet fully convinced of Nexity's technical supremacy, then have a look at these  comparison tables: we analysed the main competitors and simply have put the results on the same line. We let you judge....

Proudly we have the same retail price of the global brands (if not less), but we give you much more value, including the best of the best battery in the world, the genuine Japanese PANASONIC!

For Nexity Sonic eScooters we have selected the best factory among many, because we did not want any compromise on quality, whatever it would have meant in terms of costs. Nexity eScooters are proudly produced on the same production line of models sold directly by Amazon, Blaupunkt, Renault and Walmart. With a significant difference: we have configured the Nexity Sonic eScooters with the same frame but with all the possible up-grades in all the other components, such as: oversized engine (350W), oversized tyres (10''), oversized battery (6.4 Ah/12.8 Ah genuine Japanese Panasonic), cruise control and multiple Speed menu settings.

With a workforce of 400 people and the best certifications, include the prestigious WalMart Audit, our factory can produce up to 75.000 electric Scooters per month.

With 3 warehouses (Hong Kong, Latvia, and Italy) and a global agreement with both DHL and TNT, we can easily serve any location in the world.

The Founders' inspiration

On february 2020 an etherogeneous team of four (Linda-40, Arturs-26, Paolo-58 and Stefano-48) joined their so different but complementary competencies, a great mix of young innovative digital vision with feminine sense of style and a long experienced business development basis. That was the birthday of the Nexity eScooters project.

At Nexity we are a small but committed Team, there is for sure an incredible passion for what we do! We are excited to contribute to the evolution of a finally sustainable urban commuting  made possible by the ecological electric propulsion of our vehicles. But we also love the idea that any of us is a single person and not a standardised entity.

To challenge and overcome the last step we have chosen Indiegogo and we ask for your help.Your support will fire-up the final investment that we have planned: the development of an online 3D configurator and the set-up of  the industrial wrapping line of our eScooters.

The Team

As a team we have had the luck to work by Digital start-ups, hi-tech Fortune 2000 companies and fashion luxury brands, so immediately we have recognized the deep transformation brought into urban mobility by electric scooters: ecological sustainability! In parallel we also have recognized the total lack of design and customization of the eScooter market, where 99% of them look anonymously grey and with standardized shapes.

So, after finishing the high-end configuration of the Nexity Sonic eScooters series, we started to engineer the possibility to customise 1 by 1 every new eScooter to go in the market, by designing the 1st step of the process through the design of 15 cool graphics for our premium Nexity eScooters. Step 2 will be development our on-line 3D configurator.

The Founders

In the digital world we still need to communicate, even more than before, so we chose some of the most professional Influencers to become Brand Ambassador for Nexity. They very well represent exactly the five values behind Nexity: elegance, performance, active life, efficiency and style. Look for them in the social networks and you will have the confirmation of what we asked them to be for nexity: just themselves.

The Ambassadors

Project genesys

When we launched Nexity we chose the same factory producing eScooters for Amazon, Blaupunkt, Renault and Walmart, thus to have ensured both reliability and quality. Then we configured our X7 and X8 Sonic models with the best-in-class details: original oversized and removable Panasonic battery for the longest autonomy, oversized 10'' wheels for best comfort, 350 W oversized engine for top performances, triple braking system for absolute safety, curvilinear aeronautical aluminium forged frame for stand-out design, Intelligent Battery System and Cruise Control for maximum riding confidence.

But the Vision of our project goes even further: late personalization is the "mantra" of Fashion and Luxury world and we all like to own one-off products, standing-out from the crowds. So at Nexity we begun to design and test our own high-grade original wrapping stickers, encountering immediately the "woow" factor from anyone when crossing the roads with one of our custom-designed Nexity Scooter. This was the signal we were looking for, so we invested in creating the first 15 original designs perfectly fitting our premium eScooters, ranging from national flags to pythons, from hip-hop skulls to tigers, from military camouflage to tartan design and many more. Any design one"woow" and head turned on the streets!

And the tagline "DISTINGUISH YOURSELF" become reality!

The final step of our project is starting right now with your final support: to create a 3D model to be published in our website to allow anyone not only to preview in a fascinating way any pre-designed skin, but even to design your own, eliminating any boundary to fantasy, creativity and original one-off creations.

And So now here we are: we need your support to finalize this last step to change the above-mentioned tagline into the most exciting "DISTINGUISH YOURSELF!". This last step in not such a big investment, but any last step to conquer a Mountain peak is always the most strenuous, but with your passionate help we can get up-there together: becoming indeed the 1st customizable premium e-Scooter in the world!

We just need a 10.000€ funding to develop the following components of the last step of this project:

  • Wrapping production line set-up (customised stickers application)
  • 3D Models optimization for both X7 Sonic and X8 Sonic eScooters
  • Into our Shopify-powered eCommerce website:
    • Dynamic viewer interface development
    • 3D real-time Configurator (files/designs upload, modification and preview)

We have a full stock (continuously refilled) of our eScooters always available and stickers production facility 2 Km away from us, so if you bake us today, tomorrow we produce your sticker and within 24 h your "jewel" is on a TNT courier!

So, we offer a great discount on our first Stickers collection and our standard or custom Nexity X7 sonic,with or even without stickers for anybody who will love to bake our project. But only for the first 100 bakers: we really want you to distinguish yourself by not finding another camouflage Nexity on the street beside you! ;-)

Challenges & Risks

The whole process of creating the online platform able to visualize and customize with our 15 preloaded textures onto the 3D model of both our Nexity Sonic eScooters is fully under control. The real-time designing of a one-off personal texture is fine too.

What could be tricky is to finalize the visualization of the new live design creation onto the 3D model. We have found the way to overtake this problem, by reducing the nr. of polygons that compose the 3D model, but only by going through the development of the website we'll be able to quantify the trade-off between page speed and detail quality displayed by correct 3D polygons utilization.

Risks for Bakers? ZERO! Two full warehouses of X7 Sonic based in Italy and Latvia ensure that as soon as you fund us, the same day we print your desired high-grade wrapping sticker and on the next day we immediately ship to you your perk: the stickers or the scooters or both together.

One risk is there: we have set to 100 scooters the maximum quantity the we could ship under Indiegogo special discount campaign. So, hurry up, don't let the occasion fly away!

Other Ways to support us

Maybe you like our project but cannot fund it. In this case you can simply support with a donation or share it with your friends and through your socials and/or the Indiegogo share tools!

 

We have sold online the 1st Nexity eScooter on 28.09.2020 and since then we have been increasing our sales reaching the break-even point already on 13.01.20201. Honestly a result that makes us happy, also supported by the very first reviews which are dropping in both Amazon.it (main market close to our central logistic) and our website (ww sales). Have a look at them , they are genuine and sincere :-)

www.amazon.it

www.nexityscooters.com

We are ready now for any shipment: the Italian warehouse has full stock of Nexity X7 Sonic, while our Latvian stickers production can print out any design within 12 h form the order. So we plan to run the campaign but already ship out first orders before the mid of April, when the campaign will finish.

Pricing for any continent (by Country) are visible in the cart, while shipping time range from 3 days in EU up to max 15 days in Asia and Australia. So by the end of April every one of you will have his perk at home!

--------------------

 

Designed and powered by Vex Media Group, because crowdfunding is just the beginning of your digital journey!

But we also love the idea that any of us is a single person and not a standardised entity.To challenge and overcome the last step we have chosen Indiegogo and we ask for your help.Your support will fire-up the final investment that we have planned: the development of an online 3D configurator and the set-up of  the industrial wrapping line of our eScooters.The TeamAs a team we have had the luck to work by Digital start-ups, hi-tech Fortune 2000 companies and fashion luxury brands, so immediately we have recognized the deep transformation brought into urban mobility by electric scooters: ecological sustainability! In parallel we also have recognized the total lack of design and customization of the eScooter market, where 99% of them look anonymously grey and with standardized shapes.So, after finishing the high-end configuration of the Nexity Sonic eScooters series, we started to engineer the possibility to customise 1 by 1 every new eScooter to go in the market, by designing the 1st step of the process through the design of 15 cool graphics for our premium Nexity eScooters. Step 2 will be development our on-line 3D configurator.The FoundersIn the digital world we still need to communicate, even more than before, so we chose some of the most professional Influencers to become Brand Ambassador for Nexity. They very well represent exactly the five values behind Nexity: elegance, performance, active life, efficiency and style. Look for them in the social networks and you will have the confirmation of what we asked them to be for nexity: just themselves.The AmbassadorsProject genesysWhen we launched Nexity we chose the same factory producing eScooters for Amazon, Blaupunkt, Renault and Walmart, thus to have ensured both reliability and quality. Then we configured our X7 and X8 Sonic models with the best-in-class details: original oversized and removable Panasonic battery for the longest autonomy, oversized 10'' wheels for best comfort, 350 W oversized engine for top performances, triple braking system for absolute safety, curvilinear aeronautical aluminium forged frame for stand-out design, Intelligent Battery System and Cruise Control for maximum riding confidence.But the Vision of our project goes even further: late personalization is the "mantra" of Fashion and Luxury world and we all like to own one-off products, standing-out from the crowds. So at Nexity we begun to design and test our own high-grade original wrapping stickers, encountering immediately the "woow" factor from anyone when crossing the roads with one of our custom-designed Nexity Scooter. This was the signal we were looking for, so we invested in creating the first 15 original designs perfectly fitting our premium eScooters, ranging from national flags to pythons, from hip-hop skulls to tigers, from military camouflage to tartan design and many more. Any design one"woow" and head turned on the streets!And the tagline "DISTINGUISH YOURSELF" become reality!The final step of our project is starting right now with your final support: to create a 3D model to be published in our website to allow anyone not only to preview in a fascinating way any pre-designed skin, but even to design your own, eliminating any boundary to fantasy, creativity and original one-off creations.And So now here we are: we need your support to finalize this last step to change the above-mentioned tagline into the most exciting "DISTINGUISH YOURSELF!". This last step in not such a big investment, but any last step to conquer a Mountain peak is always the most strenuous, but with your passionate help we can get up-there together: becoming indeed the 1st customizable premium e-Scooter in the world!We just need a 10.000€ funding to develop the following components of the last step of this project:
Wrapping production line set-up (customised stickers application)
3D Models optimization for both X7 Sonic and X8 Sonic eScooters
Into our Shopify-powered eCommerce website:
Dynamic viewer interface development
3D real-time Configurator (files/designs upload, modification and preview)


We have a full stock (continuously refilled) of our eScooters always available and stickers production facility 2 Km away from us, so if you bake us today, tomorrow we produce your sticker and within 24 h your "jewel" is on a TNT courier!So, we offer a great discount on our first Stickers collection and our standard or custom Nexity X7 sonic,with or even without stickers for anybody who will love to bake our project. But only for the first 100 bakers: we really want you to distinguish yourself by not finding another camouflage Nexity on the street beside you! ;-)Challenges & RisksThe whole process of creating the online platform able to visualize and customize with our 15 preloaded textures onto the 3D model of both our Nexity Sonic eScooters is fully under control. The real-time designing of a one-off personal texture is fine too.What could be tricky is to finalize the visualization of the new live design creation onto the 3D model. We have found the way to overtake this problem, by reducing the nr. of polygons that compose the 3D model, but only by going through the development of the website we'll be able to quantify the trade-off between page speed and detail quality displayed by correct 3D polygons utilization.Risks for Bakers? ZERO! Two full warehouses of X7 Sonic based in Italy and Latvia ensure that as soon as you fund us, the same day we print your desired high-grade wrapping sticker and on the next day we immediately ship to you your perk: the stickers or the scooters or both together.One risk is there: we have set to 100 scooters the maximum quantity the we could ship under Indiegogo special discount campaign. So, hurry up, don't let the occasion fly away!Other Ways to support usMaybe you like our project but cannot fund it. In this case you can simply support with a donation or share it with your friends and through your socials and/or the Indiegogo share tools! We have sold online the 1st Nexity eScooter on 28.09.2020 and since then we have been increasing our sales reaching the break-even point already on 13.01.20201. Honestly a result that makes us happy, also supported by the very first reviews which are dropping in both Amazon.it (main market close to our central logistic) and our website (ww sales). Have a look at them , they are genuine and sincere :-)www.amazon.itwww.nexityscooters.comWe are ready now for any shipment: the Italian warehouse has full stock of Nexity X7 Sonic, while our Latvian stickers production can print out any design within 12 h form the order. So we plan to run the campaign but already ship out first orders before the mid of April, when the campaign will finish.Pricing for any continent (by Country) are visible in the cart, while shipping time range from 3 days in EU up to max 15 days in Asia and Australia. So by the end of April every one of you will have his perk at home!-------------------- Designed and powered by Vex Media Group, because crowdfunding is just the beginning of your digital journey!

story:
Overview

Riding e-bike is only a means of transportation? Not only that, it can be fun, and it can be your lifestyle. FIIDO commits itself to providing customers all over the world with a practical, free, and personalized environmentally friendly commute method. Now it comes to our D11 electric folding bike. 

Stylish & Powerful

It's electric, but comes with concealed battery and motor.


Media Coverage

D11 reconstructs the shape of the traditional e-bike, using aerospace lightweight aluminum alloy to make the body weigh 12.9kg. It provides 100km riding range in moped mode, while still being ultra-light weight. This allows riders a next-level riding experience with an unprecedented body frame. 

The FIIDO D11’s modular design has a 36V 11.6Ah removable battery to allow for great distances to be traveled.

We thought of everything. The integrated seatpost contains both the battery and taillight to minimize parts and maximize efficiencies.  

The folded D11 can easily fit into the trunk and can be rolled, which makes it convenient to transfer by offering more use scenarios.

Hidden in the 20-inch rear wheel is the 250W brushless gear motor, which boasts compact size and light weight to provide greater power for overcoming steeper roads with lower energy consumption. The aesthetics of the electric bicycle are unique. The perfect balance between form and function.

Shimano 7-speed gear with 3 adjustable levels in moped mode endows FIIDO D11 with sports attributes, assisting every rider in finding their personalized riding style.

Equipped with Shimano 7-speed gear and chain, you can cycle with different speeds. Take in the scenery and enjoy the ride with effortless performance.

FIIDO D11’s ergonomic electric bike design conforms to your body. Your riding posture will improve, so prepare for a comfortable ride. 


The FIIDO team has been working hard to study electric folding bicycles over the years and is committed to providing better products and more riding fun for people who promote eco-friendly commute. 

Founded in December 2016, FIIDO is committed to assisting every optimist who strives forward. Every FIIDO e-bike is designed with an extremely lightened frame and a stealth  bicycle exterior.

The first FIIDO e-bike was born in 2017, and gained widespread attention. We desire to provide cyclists the ability to commute more efficiently, while giving riders exercise with a more enjoyable riding experience.

Production is on schedule. Each FIIDO e-bike is carefully produced by our factory, and be tested over and over again. Just sit back, relax and get ready to ride your new FIIDO in style.

We have begun our mass production! And we will ship our first batch in August!

story:
Never be inconvenienced by a dead car battery again

Have you ever been in a situation when you needed to get to work or an important meeting, but your car wouldn't start? We have, and we're guessing it will eventually happen to you if it hasn't already. When such a situation arises, chances are that a dead or weak battery is the culprit.

Why does a car battery die or weaken?

There are a number of reasons why batteries can weaken and fail. A few common ones include:

  • Leaving headlights, interior lights, flashers, and the CD / radio on when the car isn't running.
  • Using the air conditioner when the car is not running.
  • Not starting a car for long periods of time (e.g., while it's in storage).
  • Lack of battery maintenance (e.g., not keeping terminals clean).
  • Failure of the diode bridge or voltage regulator in the alternator; the alternator charges the battery when the car is running.
  • Low air temperature, which causes batteries to freeze.

Who to call?

If your battery does fail, there are a number of people and services you might want to turn to for assistance:

  • Friends and family
  • Towing service
  • Auto club
  • Manufacturer's roadside assistance

Or

JumperZ - a tough palm-sized emergency battery rescuer.

Designed specifically for vehicle jump starting applications, JumperZ provides extremely high power output, extended cranking power and a long service life.

JumperZ's 400 peak Amps is powerful enough to jump start your motorcycle, car, boat, RV or tractor as long as the engine is under 3 liters in size with 12V battery. JumperZ works no matter how your vehicle is powered (gasoline, LPG or diesel).

What size is JumperZ?

By the way, a fully charged JumperZ could jump start cars more than 10 times.

Rescue at scene


How to jump start your vehicle


Emergency Rescuer Charging for Mobile Devices

Pre-disaster planning is essential, but our team hopes you will not have to use JumperZ often. We provide compact 7200mAh lithium-polymer battery cells with dual USB outputs making JumperZ ideal for mobile device emergencies. 

2.1A/1A dual USB outputs enable fast charging of two smartphones and tablets simultaneously.

7200mAh (triple 2400mAh cells) is the actual capacity for JumperZ, we do not try to bloat any amp to mislead you. It is enough to charge most smartphones 3 to 4 times.


Lithium-polymer Cell Lab Test Result at Room Temp

LED Emergency Light

JumperZ is powered with a bright 2W high efficient LED light.

Turn on switch #7 (shown below), then press the “on” button #5 for three seconds to turn on the LED light. Press button #5 to switch from SOS signal, Blink and Flashlight modes.

SOS signal consists of three short, three long, and three more short flashes of light based on Morse code.

LED Electrical / Optical Characteristics Testing Curves (Ta=25°C)


Angular displacement vs Relative intensity

Complete Protection

Inverse current protection

You must disconnect clamps immediately with traditional jump starters to avoid a high inverse current destroying the battery cell. Since JumperZ is embedded with industry-leading IC chip to protect inverse current pulse, you have plenty of time (30s) to finish your jump start job.

Over Discharging Protection  

When JumperZ is disconnected from a car battery or mobile device, the Intelligent Power Management System (IPMS) will allow JumperZ go to sleep automatically to avoid over discharging.

Over Charging Protection

When JumperZ is fully charged, the IPMS will let JumperZ go to sleep automatically to avoid over charging. 

Short circuit protection

If someone unintentionally connects the black and red clamp, the IPMS will cut off the power immediately to keep JumperZ from short circuiting.

Collision and impact protection

JumperZ will remain intact under extreme collision sand impacts.

Fast Charging

The IMPS inside JumperZ enables fast charging with CC/CV (Constant Current/Constant Voltage) mode which fully charges JumperZ in about 5 hours.

JumperZ gets charged much faster than traditional charging methods in the beginning CC phase. In the CC (Constant Current) phase the current is maintained at a constant level until the battery reaches the final charge voltage of 15 V. 

Heat Resistance

We understand that some users may encounter extreme climates during an emergency. We designed and tested carefully to guarantee the safety and performance for JumperZ at our lab.

JumperZ Operating temperature: 14 - 131 °F (-10 - 55 °C)

Discharging Lab Test Result at High Temp 131 °F (55 °C)

JumperZ Storage temperature: 14 - 185 °F (-10 - 85 °C)


Stretch Iron-clad Warranty

As an experienced team, PowerJoltz ensures JumperZ meets the highest quality standard. To provide a comprehensive warranty to every JumperZ user, we are negotiating with Allianz for $20,000/$10,000 bodily injury and property damage insurance. After carefully reviewing our prototype, Allianz has provided an insurance contract to us. 

Once the stretch goal #1 ($50,000) is met, we'll seal the $10,000 bodily injury and property damage global warranty.

If the stretch goal #2 ($100,000) is met, we'll increase the insurance to $20,000 per JumperZ. 

JumperZ Features

JumperZ Specifications


PowerJoltz

PowerJoltz is an innovative team of friends focusing on designing and introducing revolutionary power solutions by applying state-of-the-art technologies and the best in manufacturing practices.

Formed in early 2013, PowerJoltz is a boutique team led by an experienced product manager at a national leading company in the power supply industry, a talented industrial designer from Art Center College of Design, and a product engineer from a top innovative technology company. 

Where are we?

PowerJoltz initiated the JumperZ project after exchanging dead car battery experiences in Jan 2013. We tried five leading car jump starters on the market and we were frustrated by the bulkiness and expense of all of them. We collaborated with the power management industry and with the world's leading IC chipset design and engineering company for a year.

JumperZ is now in the funding phase. Our team has tested and finalized the prototype for the past three months. We have screened manufacturers in China down to two who have successful assembling experience for top brands like Apple, HTC and Duracell. We're in the final stages negotiating with Allianz for global product warranty.

With your support we can fund the manufacturing, packaging, and transportation to supporters. It will help us place the first significant order (200 units) so we can get JumperZ to an affordable price level.

How to help JumperZ happen?

Make JumperZ brand known by backing the project and spreading the words from the following links!

Share on Facebook

Share on Twitter

Share on LinkedIn

Share on Google+

Thank you for helping to make it happen!








Risks and challenges

Product Quality Control - 
JumperZ is designed, tested and refined by PowerJoltz. PowerJoltz is a boutique team led by a product manager at a national leading company in the power supply industry, a talented industrial designer from the Art Center College of Design, a product engineer from a top innovative technology company. What have total confidence in the prototype we developed in our lab.

The biggest challenge we face is ensuring our quality standard during the manufacturing process. Our product manager uses his abundant experience in coordinating manufacturing activities in China. We will only choose the most experienced manufacturers and suppliers having long-term collaboration experience with top brands including Apple, HTC and Duracell.

Our materials and components are simply the best quality we can find in the global market. We'll ensure quality control throughout the manufacturing processes. At no extra cost for supporters, we'll provide $20,000 Allianz Worldwide Care Insurance for every unit of JumperZ.

We have complied with FCC Safety Certification during design and testing. Once the funding goal is met, we'll get JumperZ FCC certified ASAP.

Production - 
We have pre-ordered essential IC chipsets and other power supplies. Our suppliers and manufacturers have ensured us the manufacture capacity for JumperZ. Unexpected manufacturing issues may arise later, but we will keep everyone updated.

Transportation - 
JumperZ will be transported from Hong Kong to our warehouse in Los Angeles by air via UPS. U.S. Customs may delay release from port at any reason. Our team member has dealt with these issues in the past, so we have allocated enough time to avoid late fulfillment for supporters. We will let you know if there's any delay.

Fulfillment - 
We will ship out JumperZ to each supporter once we double check the product condition at our warehouse in Southern California. Please expect your JumperZ to be delivered before August 2014.

Please contact us via Indiegogo if you have any question or encounter any issues.

With your support we can fund the manufacturing, packaging, and transportation to supporters. It will help us place the first significant order (200 units) so we can get JumperZ to an affordable price level.
How to help JumperZ happen?



Make JumperZ brand known by backing the project and spreading the words from the following links!
Share on Facebook
Share on Twitter
Share on LinkedIn
Share on Google+
Thank you for helping to make it happen!









Risks and challenges
Product Quality Control - JumperZ is designed, tested and refined by PowerJoltz. PowerJoltz is a boutique team led by a product manager at a national leading company in the power supply industry, a talented industrial designer from the Art Center College of Design, a product engineer from a top innovative technology company. What have total confidence in the prototype we developed in our lab.
The biggest challenge we face is ensuring our quality standard during the manufacturing process. Our product manager uses his abundant experience in coordinating manufacturing activities in China. We will only choose the most experienced manufacturers and suppliers having long-term collaboration experience with top brands including Apple, HTC and Duracell.
Our materials and components are simply the best quality we can find in the global market. We'll ensure quality control throughout the manufacturing processes. At no extra cost for supporters, we'll provide $20,000 Allianz Worldwide Care Insurance for every unit of JumperZ.
We have complied with FCC Safety Certification during design and testing. Once the funding goal is met, we'll get JumperZ FCC certified ASAP.
Production - We have pre-ordered essential IC chipsets and other power supplies. Our suppliers and manufacturers have ensured us the manufacture capacity for JumperZ. Unexpected manufacturing issues may arise later, but we will keep everyone updated.
Transportation - JumperZ will be transported from Hong Kong to our warehouse in Los Angeles by air via UPS. U.S. Customs may delay release from port at any reason. Our team member has dealt with these issues in the past, so we have allocated enough time to avoid late fulfillment for supporters. We will let you know if there's any delay.
Fulfillment - We will ship out JumperZ to each supporter once we double check the product condition at our warehouse in Southern California. Please expect your JumperZ to be delivered before August 2014.
Please contact us via Indiegogo if you have any question or encounter any issues.

story:
Sharing Locally, Impacting Globally


Our ultimate goal is to help college kids get healthier and get to class faster while contributing to a greener future!  


Help us reach our goal of creating a healthier and more environmentally sustainable future through the use of shared resources and efficient use of property.


Why Was Campus Bike Started?

Campus Bike was created on the basis of supporting healthier and more environmentally friendly college campuses. Founded in August 2013, we focus on providing an innovative, inexpensive, and easy solution to a needed service on campuses; Bicycles. Most students do not own a bicycle, but have a need for one on a daily basis.

Who Are We? What Do We do?

We provide a unique service that offers full service bicycle sharing stations across college campuses, with 24/7 access! We promote health and sustainability by providing an outlet to non-motorized modes of self powered transportation. We are currently in the process of designing and developing systems that will ultimately provide this automated 24/7 access. Our program and systems are tailored to specifically meet the needs of students, faculty, and visitors. They are different than many traditional systems, in that they utilize new and unique technologies such as quick release fingerprint scanners, solar technologies, airless tires on the bicycles, and include small release modules at each station for no wait, quick release.

What is our plan?

We first intend to implement 8-15 stations on Baylor Universities campus. Each station will contain approximately 20 bicycles, and 20 open slots for docking. A user can release a bicycle from one station, an return it to another with no problem. Our systems will also provide personal dashboards for all users, showing personal progress made while using our systems. Progress reports will include data such as miles riden, calories burned, CO2 emissions saved, etc. A large portion of proceeds generated from these stations will go to benefit new and emerging programs at the university. After our first round of implementation, we plan to move forward and scale our systems to other universities. 

We understand that with a project like this, there are inherent risks. We have outlined most potential risks and how we plan to overcome them in our 60+ page business plan. We will put our full efforts and utilize all of our resources into overcoming any unforeseen complications that may arise.


Where are we now?

After months of dedicated research and development, we have laid the groundwork and need to continue working with developers to take our business model from theory to reality.  The developers we’re working with will take the project forward by developing the integrated technology we know we need to make this project happen; Subsequently, all of these hardworking people need to be paid for their work. Our plan includes working with our in-house-team as well as outside development teams. Included on these teams are various project managers, engineers, (senior level, electro-mechanical, documentation control, etc) and experienced in-house software developers. .

Once our funding goal is met, our in-house software development team will be able to finish developing our unique cloud based software which tracks, reports and monitors users, bicycles, usage, maintenance, sensitive data, accounts, miles riden, CO2 emissions saved, calories burned, RDIF data, solar, battery usage and capacity, as well as other various functions.

Our contracted teams will be able to finish all of the hardware development, which includes a fully functional prototype of the station. The interface platform will be constructed of aluminum and/or steel and finished in an industrial powder coat paint.  It will have dimensions of approximately 16”W x 24”D x 84”H.  The interface platform will include a touch screen monitor and mini PC w/Windows Embedded 7, a credit card swipe device, a security camera, an ID scanner, a fingerprint reader, a cellular router, and battery back-up in case of power failure. It will also provide a place near the top of the cabinet to display the Campus Bike logo/branding illuminated with back lighting. The kiosk will include an access door(s) that locks and when opened will be used to service any of the hardware components. Space will be allocated for future installation of solar battery power, however our initial design will assume the stations will have access to a standard 110V power source. In addition to the primary interface platform there will be 2- 3 smaller “release stations”, each consisting of a fingerprint scanner, keypad to enter 4 digit code, and card swipe for ID cards. These release stations will allow a user to “quick release” a bicycle by simply using a fingerprint scan or card swipe. 

The bicycle docking platform will provide stations for approximately 40 bicycles and will include a locking system to secure each bicycle. The docking platform will be modular with 5 modules to accommodate 8 bicycles each. This will allow for configuration variations based on available space or site conditions.  It will also provide an RFID system to identify the number of each bicycle, and a “repair” button that can be pushed to identify a bicycle in need of repair.  The docking platform will also be constructed of aluminum and/or steel and finished in an industrial powder coat paint.

Necessary Hardware will include:

Touch Screen Interface – Approximately 8” x 12”

Intel based industrial mini PC running Microsoft Windows Embedded 7

Swipe Style credit card reader.

Fingerprint readers

ID Scanners

Key Pads

Cellular Network Router

Circuit board interface to PC and mechanisms

Relays to control locking mechanisms

Lock hardware

Buttons for “repair” service


Why are we here?

Well, it's pretty simple. We need your help. We are currently seeking funding which will provide us with the capital needed to move forward with our next phase of development. Once the development is completed, we plan to quickly move forward in working with corporate sponsors to manufacture and implement these systems at our first targeted location, Baylor University. After this implementation, we plan to expand our reach, targeting new campuses. To have the largest possible impact, our ultimate goal is to have our systems implemented at as many locations as possible.

Our base goal of $35,000 will cover the basic hardware and software development involved in creating the system. If we don't reach our initial goal, we will still move forward with completing any development we can with the funds raised. We will seek out other funding sources to make up for any remainder if our goal is not met. The total cost of all development, including all of the unique features mentioned above as well as a fully functioning prototype goes beyond our $35,000 base goal.We will reveal additional funding goals once we get closer to our deadline!

Help fund our development and become a part of something bigger. Help us reach our goal of creating healthier and more sustainable college campuses, by sharing locally and impacting globally.

story:
Help the Bike Repair Hub double its hours!

Have you heard of the Bike Repair Hub? We call it the Hub for short. It’s located in the heart of New Columbia, an affordable housing community in North Portland’s Portsmouth neighborhood where over 80% of families with children live below the poverty line.  In New Columbia, many people had bikes, but could not afford to fix them. They also lived in a bike shop desert, with no place nearby to take their bikes. In 2012, we helped transform a vacant lot into a place where locals can get their bikes fixed, meet friends and go on bike rides, while learning bike maintenance and mechanics.

This summer, we need your support. We are doubling the amount of hours the Hub is open, which means fixing over 50 bikes a week. We’re leading more bike rides for residents, adding more bike maintenance trainings, and debuting a new program where people living on low incomes can build their own bikes with the support of one of our professional mechanics.

The Hub is a real community effort that makes your heart feel good. With the support of people like you who believe in access to bikes, more people will ride bikes for transportation, recreation, and for fun.  Help the Hub double its hours today!

Your donation will contribute to:

  • Doubling the amount of hours the Hub is open each week
  • 50+ free bike repairs a week for residents of New Columbia
  • Helmets for youth
  • Tubes and tires
  • Bike mechanic trainings for local kids and adults
  • Build-a-bike classes, at no cost to attendees
  • Community bike rides 

Where is the Hub?

Nestled between Kenton and St. Johns, Portsmouth is home to the New Columbia housing community. Here live 2,500 Portland residents that hail from 22 countries. The neighborhood is a diverse and vibrant community with over half the residents under the age of 18. The Bike Repair Hub serves as a community meeting point and place for adults to have a positive influence in the life of youth in the neighborhood.
