story:
Jump TO:   Solution   |   Startup   |   Use of Contributions   |   Perks   |   FAQs


Hello Everyone!  

I'm Thad,

The idea for the electronic bike rack came to me when a friend had two bicycles stolen in one week. When the second bike was stolen the thief left a sticky note attached to the cut bike lock chain. The note had a smiley face and “THANKS” written across it. I agreed with my friend that the situation totally sucked because he really liked to ride bicycles. Then I thought ... How can I help out my friend?

Coincidentally I was trying to find an idea for my engineering senior design project. After some research I found out ... 

It's REALLY easy to steal a bicycle!

... ALL BECAUSE ...

All Bike Locks Broken in 30 Seconds.

United States Bicycle Theft

$350 Million Yearly Problem



Solution 

A patented outdoor Electronic Bike Rack that locks the wheel and frame of your bicycle. The rack prevents theft by integrating the bike lock into a bike rack. You can activate the rack with a cell phone app, key card, or attached kiosk.
  • Secures 90% of the bicycles on the market.
  • Able to run off solar power with a backup battery.
  • Modular design allows for multiple rack deployment. 
  • Steel design weighs 200 lbs and is bolted to the ground.

     

        

              


Media

 

        

Pro Business Podcast: Business Authority Radio Episode 22 
Thad Oviatt & the Electronic Bike Rack



GARAGE STARTUP 

After 4 years of bootstrapping I need your HELP!!!

To bring the Electronic Bike Rack 
out of my parents garage...

... AND INTO THE WORLD!


Use of Contributions 

  • 1% of ALL Contribution $$$ Goes To American Cancer Society. 

  • Develop a phone app with TenRocket.   

  • Build electronic bike racks with PCI Procoaters out of Conyers, Georgia. Deploy them around the Atlanta Metro area as a pilot program.


  • Cover any overhead or problems that might show up in manufacturing.
  • Market & Advertise to the general public and interested parties.




Timeline



PERKS 


SEE PINS HERE

Thank you for contributing to secure bicycle parking and a need to HUG YOUR BIKE! Your name will be listed on our website for EVA AND EVA!! We will also mark your city down on our map of America with one those red headed pin thingies.


$10 - Awesome Button & Sticker


$50 - A Printed Logo Short Sleeve T-Shirt


$150 - A Snappy Logo Embroidered Polo Shirt


$300 - Year of Free Membership

This includes:
  • A Personal Profile 
  • Insurance for your bicycle to get repairs. 
  • One-hour free parking at any place that charges for parking. 
  • Separate tab on the phone app for location based advertising simply because they're annoying ... we know. 

$500 - One Year Free Membership & Free Parking

Woh you really like to ride your bike! Congratulations, you get the free year of membership AND you will also NOT be charged for parking for one whole year!! (* if a place charges for parking) 

$1,000 - Sponsor Name

You are an extra special person! Along with all the other PERKS listed above you get your name affixed to a bike rack when it's installed in the community. Now anyone passing by will know you has a part in that rack.

$6,000 - Signature Electronic Bike Rack

Thank you very much for your contribution! We will affix your name and ONLY your name to a rack when we install it in the community. Everyone passing by will know you made that rack possible.

$10,000 - 1/2 Year of Advertising

Congratulations on choosing to sponsor a bike rack in the community. Your advertising will show prominently for 6 months. Data we record will be shared will be shared with you! 

$20,000 - One Whole Year of Advertising

Congratulations on choosing to sponsor a bike rack in the community. Your advertising will show prominently for a WHOLE YEAR. Data we record will be shared will be shared with you! 

$30,000 - Painted Sponsor Rack

Hey you the MAN! Your advertising and logos will be PAINTED onto the rack you're sponsoring in the community!!

$40,000 - 3 Day Trip to Atlanta!

    

Yes, you and a "friend" will fly to Atlanta and get a 3 day a tour of the Atlanta Startup scene. This includes lodging meals and transportation. You will also be sponsoring a bike rack we install in the community. Your name OR advertising will be painted on the rack.

$50,000 - YOU GET ONE!! 

ELECTRONIC BIKE RACK!!!

You are the all controlling and generous MASTER OF THE UNIVERSE!!! YOU GET AN ELECTRONIC BIKE RACK. 

\**MIND BLOWN**/

We will build one and ship it to you for FREE!!!! 


Frequently Asked Questions 

Q. How can you claim to lock up 90% of the bicycles on the market?
A. The patented product was developed after analyzing hundreds of bicycles. It is built from a single point of continuity found for all bicycle frames.

Q. Why can't I just use a regular bike lock?
A. You can... BUT research has shown that all bike locks on the market can be broken in 30 seconds or less. There are Youtube™  videos to demonstrate how to break the bike locks.

Q. What's wrong with just a regular bike rack?
A. Regular bike racks DO NOT LOCK UP BICYCLES. A regular bike rack is a "hitching post". Not much has changed since the days of riding horses. You are counting on the bike lock to secure your bike to the rack. See the above Q&A for how effective a bike lock is. 

Q. What is the electronic bike rack made of?
A. The electronic bike rack is a steel design weighing over 200 lbs. The locking arms are composed of a steel outer and inner sleeve containing an actuator. The center column contains a backup battery and the control system.

Q. How does the electronic bike rack "lock up" a bicycle?
A. First a person pushes their bicycle into the rack. Once the system is activated the rack extends a metal bar through the spokes of the wheel. There are bars in the reaching arms that extend down to stop the gated bars from swinging. This action creates a "locking bar" through the opening in the frame.

Q. What about locking the back wheel?
A. You can push a bicycle into the rack forwards OR backwards. It is possible to lock both wheels if you push the bicycle into the rack backwards. Then, depending on tire width, detach the front wheel and put it with the back wheel before engaging the lock.

Q. What happens if there is a loss of power in the area?
A. The backup batteries will keep the rack running for a few days. If the area around the rack and the rack itself looses power the electronic bike rack will stay in either the locked or unlocked position.

Q. Is there anything special about the "electronic" part of the bike rack?
A. No. All electronics used in the rack are "off the shelf".

Q. How is the electronic bike rack controlled?
A. The rack is controlled with a Raspberry Pi 2. It communicates with your phone app via Bluetooth LE and with a RFID reader for key card access.

Q. How can the electronic bike rack run off solar power?
A. The whole device uses 12 volts and 2 amps of energy. A single solar panel can charge multiple racks.

Q. Where can the electronic bike racks be deployed?
A. The racks can go onto campuses, into metropolitan areas, hotel resorts and out on the trails or in parks. They can go anywhere there is a cell phone signal.

Q. What was the development process and how many prototypes did you build?
A. The development process is illustrated in the Gallery section.

Q. Is anyone else electronically locking bicycles?
A. There are a growing number of bike locks entering the market that connect to a phone app and the internet. They can only tell you when your bicycle is being stolen. Others have created large structures using robots to "file away" bicycles. Bike shares electronically lock one specific type of bicycle they own.

Q. How is your device different than a bike share?
A. The electronic bike rack secures 90% of the bicycle market instead of just one bike. Each rack is controlled independently. The devices take up a fourth of the physical footprint space than a bike share station. One device secures two bikes instead of one bike. The clearance needed around the installed units is 60% less than the space needed for a bike share.

Q. Is the electronic bike rack just for parking my bicycle?
A. No. The product can be used to rent out bicycles at a resort, campus, beach, or from hotels. The electronic accessibility allows for reservation codes.

Q. Will you ship the electronic bike rack internationally?
A. Not at this time.

Q. Why are 1% of all contributions going to the American Cancer Society?
A. Last fall my mother was simultaneously diagnosed with lung and bone marrow cancer. Only ten years ago this would have been a death sentence. Due to modern advancements in cancer research she now only has to take pills and have a shot. Thankfully she does not need chemotherapy! 
*FYI, If  you know anyone who, heaven forbid, gets cancer DO NOT look it up online. Everything online is 10 years out of date and will scare the crap out of you.

If you think this is a COOL product then 

PLEASE share it with your friends!

 We will build one and ship it to you for FREE!!!! 



Frequently Asked Questions 

Q. How can you claim to lock up 90% of the bicycles on the market?
A. The patented product was developed after analyzing hundreds of bicycles. It is built from a single point of continuity found for all bicycle frames.


Q. Why can't I just use a regular bike lock?
A. You can... BUT research has shown that all bike locks on the market can be broken in 30 seconds or less. There are Youtube™  videos to demonstrate how to break the bike locks.


Q. What's wrong with just a regular bike rack?
A. Regular bike racks DO NOT LOCK UP BICYCLES. A regular bike rack is a "hitching post". Not much has changed since the days of riding horses. You are counting on the bike lock to secure your bike to the rack. See the above Q&A for how effective a bike lock is. 

Q. What is the electronic bike rack made of?
A. The electronic bike rack is a steel design weighing over 200 lbs. The locking arms are composed of a steel outer and inner sleeve containing an actuator. The center column contains a backup battery and the control system.

Q. How does the electronic bike rack "lock up" a bicycle?
A. First a person pushes their bicycle into the rack. Once the system is activated the rack extends a metal bar through the spokes of the wheel. There are bars in the reaching arms that extend down to stop the gated bars from swinging. This action creates a "locking bar" through the opening in the frame.

Q. What about locking the back wheel?
A. You can push a bicycle into the rack forwards OR backwards. It is possible to lock both wheels if you push the bicycle into the rack backwards. Then, depending on tire width, detach the front wheel and put it with the back wheel before engaging the lock.

Q. What happens if there is a loss of power in the area?
A. The backup batteries will keep the rack running for a few days. If the area around the rack and the rack itself looses power the electronic bike rack will stay in either the locked or unlocked position.

Q. Is there anything special about the "electronic" part of the bike rack?
A. No. All electronics used in the rack are "off the shelf".


Q. How is the electronic bike rack controlled?
A. The rack is controlled with a Raspberry Pi 2. It communicates with your phone app via Bluetooth LE and with a RFID reader for key card access.


Q. How can the electronic bike rack run off solar power?
A. The whole device uses 12 volts and 2 amps of energy. A single solar panel can charge multiple racks.

Q. Where can the electronic bike racks be deployed?
A. The racks can go onto campuses, into metropolitan areas, hotel resorts and out on the trails or in parks. They can go anywhere there is a cell phone signal.


Q. What was the development process and how many prototypes did you build?

A. The development process is illustrated in the Gallery section.

Q. Is anyone else electronically locking bicycles?
A. There are a growing number of bike locks entering the market that connect to a phone app and the internet. They can only tell you when your bicycle is being stolen. Others have created large structures using robots to "file away" bicycles. Bike shares electronically lock one specific type of bicycle they own.

Q. How is your device different than a bike share?
A. The electronic bike rack secures 90% of the bicycle market instead of just one bike. Each rack is controlled independently. The devices take up a fourth of the physical footprint space than a bike share station. One device secures two bikes instead of one bike. The clearance needed around the installed units is 60% less than the space needed for a bike share.

Q. Is the electronic bike rack just for parking my bicycle?
A. No. The product can be used to rent out bicycles at a resort, campus, beach, or from hotels. The electronic accessibility allows for reservation codes.

Q. Will you ship the electronic bike rack internationally?
A. Not at this time.


Q. Why are 1% of all contributions going to the American Cancer Society?

A. Last fall my mother was simultaneously diagnosed with lung and bone marrow cancer. Only ten years ago this would have been a death sentence. Due to modern advancements in cancer research she now only has to take pills and have a shot. Thankfully she does not need chemotherapy! 
*FYI, If  you know anyone who, heaven forbid, gets cancer DO NOT look it up online. Everything online is 10 years out of date and will scare the crap out of you.
 If you think this is a COOL product then 
PLEASE share it with your friends!

story:
3000km. Across the outback. 

Powered only by the sun. 


Our mission: 

To be the first UK team to complete the challenge. 

 

Durham University Electric Motorsport (DUEM) are a team of 50 students from a variety of academic backgrounds who design, construct and race solar cars. This year, we have something incredibly exciting to share with you. 

In our 15th anniversary year, we have continued to evolve our innovative, aerodynamic & technologically advanced vehicle over a period of nearly 5 years. The most incredible part is that it is only powered by the sun. 

The team was founded in 2002 & competed in the 2008 North American Solar Challenge & the 2011 & 2015 World Solar Challenge. Our brand new solar car will be competing in the 2017 World Solar Challenge. This is a 3000km marathon solar race across the heart of the Australian outback from Darwin to Adelaide. We are up against many high-profile teams from around the world but feel confident, following on from our success in 2008, 2011 and 2015, that we will deliver an outstanding result.

No UK team has ever completed the full distance entirely on solar power. This challenge is incredibly tough on the team and the cars, with harsh road and climate conditions - temperatures range up to 40C - with reliability a key stumbling block. We are confident that this year we will be the first ever UK team to complete the immense 3000km distance entirely on solar power.  

The Car

Our game-changing solar car builds upon this experience and combines stunning design with state-of-the-art technology to deliver:

  • An incredibly aerodynamic design, enabling the car to use five times less power, when cruising, than a Toyota Prius
  • A breakthrough in-wheel motor, designed in-house, powering the car up to speeds of 70mph
  • An aerospace-grade, lightweight carbon-fibre monocoque chassis 
  • Hundreds of high-performance silicon solar cells 
  • Advanced electronics, enabling wireless monitoring and control of the car and its systems

How you can support us:

We are looking to raise at least £10,000 to deliver a world class solar car in Australia. We have come up with variety of unique, personalised benefits you will receive by supporting our team, enabling us to achieve the incredible feat of being the first UK team to complete the race.

These perks include:

  • A limited edition poster of the solar car
  • A meticulously crafted DUEM-branded keyring 
  • The chance to have your name displayed on the trailer accompanying the solar car 
  • The ultimate personal expression: your name displayed on our solar car which will travel 3000km across Australia

For those who wish to support us at a level greater than those suggested, we would be more than willing to discuss a customised set of unique benefits to ensure your support is fully recognised. 

Thank you very much indeed for reading our campaign and for supporting us, however you choose to do so. Please feel free to contact us with any questions or queries you may have. Check out our Facebook & Twitter pages as well as our brand new website, our recently updated YouTube channel and all the videos and pictures in our gallery.

Through your crucial support we will continue to push forward in our mission: to showcase, educate and inspire.
